( k ) of proviso.

( circle inspector ) as authority for the arrest.

summarized_judgment: assessee was dealing in iron scrap and hardware purchased a jute press and sold it at a profit. the appellate tribunal modified the order and reduced the total income. the high court answered the question in affirmative. the question must be answered in the negative, asking if the assessee had purchased the property.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, West ... vs Gungadhar Banerjee And Co. (P) Ltd on 22 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: india's income - tax act passed under s. 23a - dividend - distribution - burden of showing low - circumstances to be considered - - meaning of - " assessable profits " - - meant to be distributed as dividends on date of the annual general meeting of the company. section 23a of the income tax act is in the nature of a penal provision that would not be unreasonable.

tagline: Harbhajan Singh vs State Of Punjab on 2 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: punjab state of punjab issued a press note stating certain dailies in the states were publishing false reports alleging the appellant's son in smuggling. appellant filed a complaint of defamation against appellant, who was a public worker. he claimed therein the protection of both the first and ninth exceptions to s. 449 of the indian penal code, 1860.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs Seth Govindram Sugar Mills Ltd on 26 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: kartas died in 1945 leaving as members of his branch of the family, three widows and two minor sons. both families represented the respective joint families, and the partnership deed provided that the death of any of the parties shall not dissolve the partnership and either the legal heir or the nominee of the deceased partner should take his place.

tagline: Tata Iron And Steel Co. Ltd vs S. N. Modak on 19 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: appellant applied under s. 33 ( 21 ) ( b ) of the industrial disputes act, 1947 ( 14 of 1947 ) the appellant discharged its employee - the respondent. appellant'contended that the application made by it no longer survived'the application was made because certain industrial disputes were pending.

tagline: Nirmala Bala Ghose And Another vs Balai Chand Ghose And Ors on 29 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: nirmala bala ghose, ors, could not invalidate the endowment. if approved, it would create a charge in favour of the worship of the idol. a provision for the benefit of persons other than the shebait may not be valid, if it infringes rule against perpetuities or accumulations.

tagline: Dr. G.H. Grant vs State Of Bihar on 30 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: the appellant owned certain lands in the state of bihar. it was then filed under s. 12. but before possession under. s. 16 of the act was taken the bihar land reforms act. 1950 was passed and by the operation of s. 3 of the. act was passed. under the act, collector fixed the area of the land to be acquired and compensation payable.

tagline: Workmen Of Motipur Sugar Factory ... vs Motipur Sugar Factory on 30 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: workmen of the respondent started a go - slow in motipur sugar factory. the workers of the respondingent started the go slow in its sugar factory, but didn't record their willingness to discharge his duties faithfully and diligently so as to give a certain minimum output, he must record his willingness in the office.

tagline: Nathulal vs State Of Madhya Pradesh on 22 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: the appellant is acquitted of the offence with which he was charged. the bail bond is discharged. if any fine has been paid, it shall be returned. the bond was discharged and it will be returned to the high court. the judge will be sentenced to a maximum of five years.

tagline: Alapati Venkataramiah vs Commissioner Of Income Tax ... on 29 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: an entry was made in the assessee's account showing that a sum of rs. 2, 00, 000 / - had been paid to an assessee. in 1948 a sale deed was executed and registered and the board of directors of the company ratified the sale. the high court held that it was immaterial as to when the money was actually paid.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income Tax vs Mugneeram Bangur & Co on 31 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: the business of the assessee firm carrying on land development business was sold as a going concern to a company promoted by their partners. the sale was the sale of the whole concern and no part of the slump price was attributable to stock - in - trade. a. c. 327, applied for a $ 2. 6 million fine and applied for the value of the land.

tagline: J.P. Shrivastava And Sons ... vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 24 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: judgment sikri, j. p. shrivastava and sons of bhopal textile ltd. had financial year as their accounting period ended march 31, 1952. tribunal correctly included commission of rs. 41, 842 and rs. 1, 16, 690 in applicant's profits of accounting periods ended 31 march 1953.

tagline: Anda And Ors. vs The State Of Rajasthan on 9 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: judgment m. hidayatullah, j. 1. the appellants were convicted by the rajasthan high court under section 302. they were charged in the alternative and no question of a new charge arises. the incident took place on june 29, 1961, at about 5. 30 a. m. at a village called hindas.

tagline: Badri Prasad vs State Of Madhya Pradesh And ... on 16 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: the coupe was divided into 4 sections according to rules which were deemed to be part of the contract. appellant stood surety for the payment of the remaining three instalments. the appellant was informed by forest authorities that no further removal of the timber would be allowed, as the value of timber already removed exceeded the amount paid.

tagline: R.S. Madanappa And Ors vs Chandramma And Anr on 5 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: the first defendant was their father and the suit properties were in his possession. first defendant admitted the plaintiff's claim and herself claimed a decree against the other defendants in respect of her half share. the trial court decreed that the plaintiff ’ s claim, but held that the second defendant was estopped from claiming.

tagline: S. Chattanatha Karayalar vs The Central Bank Of India And ... on 9 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: the central bank of india and others date of judgment. the appellant and respondent no. 3 pleaded, inter alia, that they had executed the promissory note as a surety for respondent nos. 2 and 3 for recovery of the amount due on the overdraft.

tagline: Bharat Kala Bhandar Ltd vs Municipal Committee, Dhamangaon on 26 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: appellant was paying a tax at the rate of one anna per - - unit weight of cotton, under s. 66 ( 1 ) ( b ) of the central provinces municipalities act. 1922, from 1936. in all 1941, a tax in excess of rs. 50 per annum could not be imposed by the appellant.

tagline: Mohammad Safi vs The State Of West Bengal on 25 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: mudholkar, j. r. bachawat, was benchmarked for an offence under s. 409, i. p. c. after the examination of the prosecution witnesses a charge was framed. he held that he had no jurisdiction to proceed, and as the charge had already been framed, made an order a -, quitting the appellant.

tagline: Her Highness Maharani Mandalsa ... vs M. Ramnarain (P) Ltd. And Ors on 19 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: consent of central government to the institution of the suit under s. 87 - b of the code of civil procedure was not obtained. the firm admitted liability and the court passed a decree and directed the decretal amount would be payable in certain instalments. the appellants and a ruler of a former indian state were partners.

tagline: Union Of India (Uoi) vs Watkins Mayor And Co. on 10 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: both appeals are brought from the judgment and decree of the state of punjab. the plaintiff brought the suit claim - tag a sum of rs. 1, 07, 700 and odd from the union of india as compensation for storage of over 600 tons of iron sheets for the period from july, 1944 to may, 1949.

tagline: Bishan Paul vs Mothu Ram on 24 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: jack wilshere is one of the most - capped players in the world. he has been inundated with criticism from the media. he is hoping to win the u. s. supreme court spot - kick - off of the season. the 25 - year - old has been on the pitch for almost two years.

tagline: Calcutta Dock Labour Board vs Jaffar Imam And Others on 22 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: the appellant - board and appellant board were dismissed. they were dismissed, but were allowed by a division bench on appeal. appellants had been detained under the preventive detention act. they filed writ petitions in the high court, challenging orders on the grounds that reasonable opportunity was not given to them.

tagline: Sheikh Gulfan And Others vs Sanat Kumar Ganguli on 15 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: sanat kumar ganguli date of judgment in calcutta, 1911. he accepted betterment fee assessed and levied under s. 78a of the act. he filed suits for the ejectment of the appellants. but he was dismissed as not maintainable because of s. 5 of the calcutta thika tenancy act.

tagline: The Calcutta Tramways Co. Ltd vs The Corporation Of Calcutta on 12 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: the calcutta tramways act ( w. b. act 25 of 1951 ), s. 5 agreements with arbitration clause - - whether saved. the appellant nominated its arbitrator without prejudice to its rights. both the right to the payment of rent and the procedural one to have any dispute arose.

tagline: The Morvi Mercantile Bank Ltd. And ... vs Union Of India, Through The ... on 3 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: a firm doing business in bombay entrusted goods worth rs. 35, 500 the railway for delivery in delhi. the firm endorsed the railway receipts to a bank against an advance of rs. 20, 000 made by the bank to the firm. the bank also executed a promissory note in favour of the bank for that amount.

tagline: Narayandas Shreeram Somani vs The Sangli Bank Ltd.(With ... on 15 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: indian companies act ( act 7 of 1931 ), s. 91b ( 1 ) director interested in allotment of shares - - taking part in meeting - - effect. first appellant and his brother paid off the balance due from him after giving effect to the credit entry.

tagline: Sarju Prasad Saha vs The State Of U.P. And Ors. on 3 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: on june 28, 1955 the state of u. p. notified under section 4 ( 1 ) of the land acquisition act 1 of 1894. the appellant filed under section 5 - a of the act objections against the intended acquisition. on march 7, 1960, a fresh notification was issued.

tagline: Workmen Of M/S Dharampal ... vs M/S. Dharampal Premchand ... on 16 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: some 18 workers of the respondent were dismissed by an order passed on the same day. the appeal must be allowed. the definition of " industrial dispute " in s. 2 ( k ) shows that before any dispute raised by any person can be said to be an industrial dispute, unless it is supported by a number of workmen.

tagline: Rangubai Kom Shankar Jagtap vs Sunderabai Bhratar Sakharam ... on 1 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: petitioner rangubai kom shankar jagtap vs. respondent brought on record in final decree proceedings. petitioner's appeal to high court was dismissed in 1959 and a petition for special leave to appeal was granted in june 1959. the petitioner died in november 1959.

tagline: Fazlul Rabbi Pradhan vs State Of West Bengal on 8 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: the appellants were the respective mutawallis of two wakfs. they were issued by the collector under the west bengal estates acquisition act, 1953. notices were issued under the act of 1953, but were not solely for charitable purposes. the deeds were not covered by the expression " religious purpose ", and were not exclusively for charitable or religious purposes.

tagline: The Cantonment Board, Ambala vs Pyarelal on 12 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: in 1954, the words " rent on land or buildings " were added to s. 250 of the cantonments act, 1924. the appellant applied under the section to the concerned magistrate for realisation of arrears of rent from the respondent, on the basis of a lease in his favour. appellant contended that, upon correct interpretation of the section, the magistrate had the power to order the recovery of rent.

tagline: Karpagathachi And Ors vs Nagarathinathachi on 10 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: two co - widows divided their husband's property and each entered into separate possession of her share. case law referred to 337 c - d case, which on appeal was set aside by the high court. the widows filed a suit against the respondent claiming possession of that share.

tagline: Employers In Relation To Digwadih ... vs Their Workmen on 22 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: a badli workman worked for more than 240 days, with interruptions in each of the calendar years 1959 and 1960. he was retrenched in 1961 after an industrial dispute having arisen, it was referred to the tribunal, which held, that the appellant was not justified in terminating the services of the workman as the provisions of the industrial disputes act, 1947 were not com - plied with.

tagline: State Of Rajasthan vs Hari Shankar Rajendra Pal on 19 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: the appellant refused the first prayer but extended the period by a few months. appellant applied for extension of the lease in order to renew the lease. state of rajasthan filed a writ petition in the high court for striking down the order of the government renewing the lease for a period of 5 years.

tagline: The Tata Iron And Steel Co. Ltd vs D. R. Singh on 19 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: appellant filed an application under s. 33 ( 2 ), ( b ) asking for approval of action which it proposed to take against its employee the respondent. appellant requested that this application was made as a matter of abundant caution. the appellant asked for permission to take action against its employees.

tagline: Abdul Karim Khan And Ors vs Municipal Committee, Raipur on 8 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: the first appellant filed a representative suit for an injunction restraining the respondent from committing acts of encroachment on the suit property. " 306 a - b " the enquiry which the act contemplates is an entriry into the question as to whether a trust is public or private. inasmuch as the response was not a party to the proceedings.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs Kalooram Govindram on 22 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: the respondent formed an association with another hindu undivided family to carry on business. the income - tax officer allowed as a permissible deduction a debit item of rs. 25, 000 in the accounts, payable as interest to respondent - family on its investment. the high court of madhya pradesh held that entries posted in the books of govindram sugar mills.

tagline: Indra Kumar Karnani vs Atul Chandra Patitundi And Anr on 10 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: the appellant filed a suit against respondent no. 2 for eviction on the ground that the tenancy had been determined on account of default in payment of rent. the suit was upheld by the trial court, which was affirmed by the appellate courts. the appeal must be dismissed.

tagline: State Of Maharashtra vs Mohanlal Devichand Shah on 23 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: the labour inspector, appointed under the minimum wages act, submitted two complaints. the inspector was not authorised to file the complaint. the word " mine " in sub - cl. ( 1 ) of the act does not include a stone quarry. the appellants'appeals were dismissed by the high court.

tagline: Gopisetti Venkataratnam And ... vs The Vijayawada Municipality And ... on 5 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: government of madras issued licence for supply of energy at " current official scale of rates " appellants filed a representative suit for a declaration that the later resolution was illegal. under the act, the municipality cannot discriminate between consumers in the matter of rates chargeable for the energy supplied.

tagline: University Of Mysore vs Gopal Gowda And Another on 2 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: under sections 22, 23, and 43 of the karnataka university act, the academic council of the university was empowered, inter alia, to control and operate the teaching, courses of study, to secure maintenance of standards, etc. they were declared unsuccessful in four successive first year course examinations and controller of examinations informed each respondent that he lost their right to continue studying for the degree.

tagline: Oriental Metal Pressing Works ... vs The Workmen And Anr. on 23 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: a dispute between appellant and its workmen as to bonus for the year 1959. the appellant claimed six months'wages as bonus to the workmen concerned. it gave an award to the effect that appellant would pay 10 per cent of their basic earnings for year 1959 as bonus. three points have been urged on behalf of appellant.

tagline: National Bank Of Lahore Ltd vs Sohanlal Sehgal And Others on 5 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: in 1951, the appellant bank was tampered with and the valuables kept in them were removed by the manager. in due course the manager was prosecuted and convicted for theft. in the appeal, the high court accepted the findings of the trial court on both the questions and dismissed the appeals.

tagline: Vijay Singh vs State Of Maharashtra on 12 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: appellant drove a jeep at an excessive speed and dashed against a wall. in the jeep was also a bottle with a label on it as " tincture zingeberis " on medical examination the appellant was found to be intoxicated. appellant filed a revision against the acquittal and appellant appealed.

tagline: Life Insurance Corporation Of ... vs Crown Life Insurance Co on 26 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: life insurance corporation of india and the life insurance company act passed in 1956. under s. 10 ( 2 ) of the insurance act, the act provides for keeping a revenue account in form d of the third schedule, which applies to life insurance business. a balance is struck after taking into account the balance of the fund at the beginning of the year.

tagline: Rai Sahib Dr. Gurdittamal Kapur vs Mahant Amar Das Chela Mahant Ram ... on 19 March, 1965
summarized_judgment: mahant amar das chela mahant ram saran and ors were the occupancy tenant forfeiture of tenancy - right of mahant's successor to sue for possession. if the 2nd respondent represented the akhara in eviction proceedings, the court confirmed the suit and the high court confirmed that the suit was barred by limitation.

tagline: Kamala Mills Ltd vs State Of Bombay on 23 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: state of bombay sales tax act, 1946, was'outside'sales non - taxable under act. state of gujarat and ors. india's supreme court dismissed the suit. it was barred by s. 20 of the act accepting the plea, but the high court said the suit was barred from the act.

tagline: Pandurang Dhoni Chougule vs Maruti Hari Jadhav on 26 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: a decree was passed directing respondents'predecessors to pay a certain sum within a specified time. the appellants also filed an application for adjustment of the debt due under the decree. the respondents filed a application under the bombay agriculturists debtors relief act for justice of the debts. but the court rejected the application and dismissed the respondents'application.

tagline: Poona Electric Supply Co. Ltd vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 19 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: the appellant - company was a commercial undertaking, doing the business of supply of electricity subject to the provisions of electricity act, 1948. for the purpose of rationalization of rates and keeping them under control, the licensee was directed by the act to adjust rates in such a way that the clear profit in any year did not exceed the amount of reasonable return.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs The Panbari Tea Co. Ltd on 19 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: annual instalment paid as premium was taxed by the income tax authorities as revenue receipt of the assessee. premium paid in instalments - - whether capital gains or revenue receipts - - is in fact advance rent and rent is a deferred price. premium can be paid in a single payment or by insurers.

tagline: Parimisetti Seetharamamma vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 21 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: appellant submitted a return of her income from property and business for the assessment year 1947 - 48. appellant admitted she was'out of natural love and affection'and given jewellery and money amounting to rs. 5, 20, 000. the appellant was admittedly in receipt of large sums of money, in order to claim exemption from tax.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax U.P. ... vs The Maheshwari Devi Jute Mills ... on 15 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: a member of the jute mills association was permitted to work their looms for a fixed number of hours. the order was confirmed by the appellate asistant commissioner and the tribunal. the commissioner of income - tax u. p. lucknow is the commissioner for income tax. the high court was right in holding that receipts from sale of " loom hours " were not taxable.

tagline: All India Reserve Bank Employees ... vs Reserve Bank Of India on 23 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: class ii and class 1i1 staff raised an industrial dispute with the central government on march 21, 1960, to the national tribunal. class ii staff raised the dispute between class 1 and class iv staff in march 1960. the tribunal pointed out that class i1 staff worked in a supervisory capacity and demand for a minimum wage as recommended by the tripartite conference.

tagline: Milkhiram (India) Private Ltd. ... vs Chamanlal Bros. on 23 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: the trial judge was right in granting leave to appellants to defend the suit based upon promissory notes executed by the appellant no. 1. rules 2 and 3 of this order have been amended by the bombay high court. the judge may at any time within ten days from the service of such summons by affidavit.

tagline: Kedarnath Jute Manufacturing Co vs Commercial Tax Officer, Calcutta ... on 2 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: appellant tried to set duplicate forms from purchasing dealers without success. appellant's application under s. 5 ( 2 ) of the bengal finance act, 1941 in respect of certain sales. the appellant filed a writ petition but failed to get redress. it was rejected by the commercial tax officer and the higher authorities refused to issue directions.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs The Cocanada Bank Ltd. Kakinada on 2 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: the respondent bank had income from banking business and interest on securities. for the assessment year 1949 - 50 its loss was set - off against the income from interest. the high court remitted the case to the tribunal for a finding whether the securities in question formed part of the trading assets held by the assessee.

tagline: Damji Valji Shah And Another vs Life Insurance Corporation Of ... on 8 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: indian companies act, 1938, transferred funds from life insurance to general department of composite insurer. under s. 10 ( 1 ) of the indian insurance act,. 1938, a composite insurance insurer had to keep separate accounts in respect of the different classes of business. in 1948, a sum of rs. 60, 000 was transferred from the general to the life department.

tagline: Union Of India And Anr vs India Fisheries (P) Ltd on 9 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: the respondent was assessed to tax amounting to rs. 3737 / - for the year 1948 - 49. a claim made for this tax on the official liquidator was adjudged and allowed as an ordinary claim and certified as such in april 1952. a petition under art. 226 of the companies act, 1922, was rejected by the commissioner of income tax.

tagline: Sree Bank Ltd vs Sarkar Dutt Roy And Co on 9 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: in 1949, the banking companies act was passed with a view to protect and secure the interests of depositors. in 1949 a decree for a sum of money had been passed in favour of the appellant - - bank, against the respondents. the decree also provided that in computing the period of limitation prescribed for an application by a banking company which is being wound up.

tagline: Jaora Sugar Mills (P) Ltd vs State Of Madhya Pradesh And Others on 19 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: madhya pradesh high court struck down s. 23, which was the charging section of the aforesaid madhya pradesh act no. 1 of 1959. the act adopted provisions of state acts and validating assessments and collections made thereunder - - central act adopting provisions. the supreme court ruled that such a levy was not valid.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs Shah Mohandas Sadhuram on 15 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: the assessee - firm claimed registration under s. 26a of the indian income tax act on the strength of a partnership deed executed between four partners of which two were minors. the income tax officer refused registration on the ground that the minors were made parties to a contract by the eldest brother acting on their behalf and the minor had actually been debited with loss.

tagline: The Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs Chari And Chari Ltd on 9 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: the respondent, a private company, carried on business in tobacco and other commodities. in 1951, the respondingent passed a resolution placing one directors, a, in " special charge " of all the work under the contract with the central government. the state government acquired the company, but the state was forced to pay him 30 per cent of the net profits.

tagline: Commissioner Income-Tax, U.P vs Kunwar Trivikram Narain Singh on 9 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: the respondent was head of a hindu family and was descendant of a jagirdar. certain disputes had been settled in 1837 by a compromise between the british government and the then jagrdar, whereby they were entitled to a pension. the supreme court decided the issue in favour of the respondingent, but the high court reversed this finding.

tagline: Ram Charan Das vs Girjanandini Devi And Ors on 20 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: u. p. court of wards act, 1912, passed under his will, drawn in 1883, to k and m who were brothers. in 1932 g, sister's son of k, filed a suit challenging the release of m's share in favour of his daughter. two other suits were filed in respect of the property by descendants of c's brother.

tagline: Kedar Pandey vs Narain Bikram Sah on 15 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: the appellant and respondent were contesting candidates for election to the state legislative assembly. the respondent was not a citizen of india, but the high court in appeal upheld the election. india's constitution of india was upheld by the supreme court on the grounds that the response was not properly qualified under art.

tagline: B. H. Aswathanarayan Singh And ... vs State Of Mysore And Others on 23 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: state transport undertaking published a scheme in the gazette for taking over routes mentioned therein to the entire exclusion of existing operators. writ petitions were filed by bus - operators challenging the validity of the scheme but they were dismissed. the scheme was published when the rules of 1963 had come into force and the approved scheme was dismissed.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs Managing Trustees, Nagore ... on 8 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: trustees called nattamaigars to manage wakf property - - surplus income to be distributed among beneficiaries of trust called kasupangudars according to definite shares - - income how to be assessed - - by trustee. trustees unsuccessfully appealed to appellate assistant commissioner and appellate court.

tagline: Prabhakar Rao N. Mawle vs State Of Andhra Pradesh on 9 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: the high court of madras was competent to issue an order against any person that no proceedings will be instituted without the leave of the district and sessions judge. the appellant contended that the act merely created a procedural jurisdiction to put persons who indulge habitually in vexatious litigation under a procedural restraint.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs Raghbir Singh on 9 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: indian income - tax act, 1922, directed trustees to pay debts of settlor. trustees directed to pay off settlors's debts, and only thereafter for other purposes of the trust. act was held by income tax officer that the trust was liable to be taxed in the hands of the assessee.

tagline: Radha Rani Bhargava vs Hanuman Prasad Bhargava on 20 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: a widow alienated her husband's estate and one of her daughters in a representative capacity on behalf of the reversioners. during the pendency of the appeal the widow died and no order of the high court under 0. vxi r. 12 ( a ) of the supreme court rules substituting the heirs of the widow, and her daughters as respondents.

tagline: R. Venkataswami Naidu And Another vs Narasram Naraindas on 27 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: tenants of madras city tenants protection act, 1922, were entitled under s. 3 to compensation for their structures. in the letters patent appeal the division bench took the view that since a covenant not to build is enforceable in law and a superstructure in contravention of it is liable to be demolished.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, West ... vs Calcutta Hospital And ... on 2 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: the respondent association was a mutual insurance concern carrying on insurance business. they included provision of help anywhere in the world in respect of expenses of accommodation and treatment in nursing homes for members and their dependents. they were required to pay a monthly premium. in the assessment years 1949 - 50 to 1953 - 54 the income - tax officer taxed the reserves for payment of income tax which had been debited to the profit.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs Shah Jethaji Phulchand on 25 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: the respondent m / s. shah jethaji phulchand can be granted registration under section 26a of the indian income - tax act for the assessment years 1953 - 54 and 1954 - 55? the relevant facts are these, and the relevant clauses of the agreement on which the learned counsel made comments are these. the next two parties will contribute rs. 22, 500 ( twenty - two thousand five hundred dollars )

tagline: Mahadeva Sharma & Others vs State Of Bihar on 21 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: hidayatullah was convicted under s. 302 read with s. 158 of the indian penal code, 1860. the appellant, %. were charged alternatively under. s. 147 or s. 148. on the question whether the conviction was legal, when they were not charged and convicted. the other charges cannot be regarded as condition precedent.

tagline: The Tata Oil Mills Co. Ltd vs K.V. Gopalan And Ors on 15 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: the kerala industrial establishment ( national and festival holidays ) act, 1958, was passed and s. 3 of the act required every employer to declare holidays on every 26th january, 15th august and 1st may, and to grant four additional festival holidays each year, on dates to be fixed by the inspector after consulting the employer and the employees. in 1962, the company obtained the inspector's decision on the four festival holidays and declared dates on which such holidays would be given.

tagline: The Madhya Pradesh State ... vs The Regional Transport ... on 15 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: the regional transport authority granted a temporary permit to the appellant under s. 62 of the motor vehicles act. the state transport authority was right as a matter of law in granting a temporary license to appellant for four months. the first respondent granted temporary permit in 1964 pending the grant of a permit for a period of two months.

tagline: Chunilal Vithaldas vs Mohanlal Motilal Patel on 15 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: the appellant obtained a lease of the theatre at a monthly rental of rs. 1150 /. -. in 1951. appellant applied under s. 11 of the saurashtra rent control act 22 of 1951. it was dismissed under 0. 41, r. 11 ( 1 ) ; of the code of civil procedure. aggrieved, appellant came to this court.

tagline: Madhya Pradesh Industries Ltd. vs Income-Tax Officer, Special ... on 8 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: madhya pradesh industries ltd - hereinafter called " the company " - - is engaged in mining manganese ore. in the account year 1953 - 54, the company paid rs. 1, 13, 052 - 8 - 9 to the selling agents and claimed it as a revenue outgoing in the calculation of its profits. in 1961, the income tax officer issued a notice to the company in exercise of the power.

tagline: Kalooram Govindram vs Commissioner Of Incometax, ... on 5 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: indian income - tax act, 1922, was claimed on the above valuation of 34 lacs. the court ruled 10 / 16 was the share of the appellant family and 6 / 16 as that of the other branch. but the original value for the purpose of depreciation was not the price determined at the auction.

tagline: Deokuer & Anr vs Sheoprasad Singh And Ors on 8 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: property was attached under s. 145 of the criminal procedure code. it is not necessary to ask for the relief of possession when the property is in custodia legis. the magistrate was in possession and he was not a party to the suit. in the present case magistrate is in possession of the party whom he finds to be in possession.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs Raghbir Singh on 9 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: indian income - tax act, 1922, directed trustees to pay debts of settlor. trustees directed to pay off settlors's debts, and only thereafter for other purposes of the trust. act was held by income tax officer that the trust was liable to be taxed in the hands of the assessee.

tagline: South Asia Industries Private Ltd vs S. Sarup Singh And Others on 19 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: the lessee and appellant were the owners of certain premises in new delhi. they filed an application against the appellant under s. 14 ( 1 ) proviso ( b ) of the delhi rent control act, 1958 for recovery of possession. the company, of these premises assigned the lease to appellant, had the lease. but the company's name was struck off from the record.

tagline: Sita Ram vs State Of Uttar Pradesh on 25 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: appellant wrote the letter with the intention it should be received by the sub - inspector. it contained a confession and was addressed to a police officer. it could not make it a confession made to police officer if the words " sub inspector " had not been written. the confessional letter was found in the bar of s. 25 of the evidence act.

tagline: Jagdish Prasad vs State Of U.P on 15 April, 1965
summarized_judgment: the appellant had been once convicted under the prevention of food adulteration act, 1954 for keeping foodstuff for sale in a container without covering it. it was contended on behalf of appellant that the " second offence " considered an offence of the same kind as the first and not any offence under the act.

tagline: Aghnoo Nagesia vs State Of Bihar on 4 May, 1965
summarized_judgment: the appellant was convicted under s. 302 indian penal code by the high court. the confession was made to a police officer - confessional confessional f. i. r. by accused - baning the confession. if the confession is tainted the taint attaches to the whole statement of the accused.

tagline: Baijnath Gupta And Others vs The State Of Madhya Pradesh on 7 May, 1965
summarized_judgment: sanction under s. 197 ( 1 ) of the code of criminal procedure was necessary for the prosecution of the appellant for offence committed in the discharge of official duty - public servant charged under ss. 477a and 409 i. p. c. - sanction whether required.

tagline: S.A.L. Narayan Row And Anr. vs Ishwarlal Bhagwandas And Anr. on 7 May, 1965
summarized_judgment: the 1st income - tax officer, c - ii ward, bombay, filed an estimate of his income under section 18a ( 2 ) and of the tax payable by him. an order under section 23b of the act provisionally assessed the income was made by the income tax officer. it was found that the tax paid on the basis of the estimate of the assessee was less than eighty per cent of tax determined.

tagline: Rajeswar Prosad Misra vs State Of West Bengal & Anr on 6 May, 1965
summarized_judgment: appellant was prosecuted under s. 408 indian penal code on the ground that he misappropriated certain amounts. high court ordered production of certain documents which would show such deposit. documents were not produced because of the vagueness of the demand. appellant contended that the high court acted beyond the jurisdiction granted by s. 428.

tagline: Lekhraj Satramdas, Lalvani vs Deputy Custodlan-Cum-Managing ... on 4 May, 1965
summarized_judgment: the appellant was appointed manager of evacuee shops. he was ordered to hand over possession of the shops. it was based on the orders of the chief settlement commissioner in ex p. 5. both parties appealed to a division bench of the high court which held against the charge.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs Ishwarlal Bhagwandas And Others on 7 May, 1965
summarized_judgment: the commissioner of income - tax, bombay & another vs. respondent, refused the order before the commissioner on the ground that the omission to charge pepal interest could not be considered a mistake apparent from the record, in view of the proviso to s. 18a ( 6 ), which was introduced on 24th may 1953 but was made retrospectively retrospectively.

tagline: Thayyil Mammo And Anr. vs Kottiath Ramunni And Ors. on 4 May, 1965
summarized_judgment: in all the circumstances of the appeal, we direct that there will be no order as to costs of this appeal appeal. in all, the appeal is dismissed, but the appeal has been dismissed. we can't afford to pay for this appeal... but we don't know what the appeal will appeal.

tagline: Mahant Kaushalya Das vs State Of Madras on 7 May, 1965
summarized_judgment: appellant was arrested by the police and immediately produced before the presidency magistrate. appellant pleaded guilty and upon that plea, he was convicted by the magistrate. the appellant preferred an appeal to the high court alleging that he was an illiterate person, not acquainted with english or tamil or with any other south indian language.

tagline: Bhimaji Shanker Kulkarni vs Dundappa Vithappa Udapudi And Anr on 5 May, 1965
summarized_judgment: the defendants pleaded that the transaction in question was an advance lease and not a mortgage. under s. 70 ( b ) of the act it was one of the duties of the mamlatdar to decide whether a person was a'protected tenant'under the act, the court had no jurisdiction to determine whether defendant no. 1 was a usufructuary mortgagee under a mortgage deed.

tagline: M/S. A. C. Estates vs M/S. Serajuddin & Co. And Another on 7 May, 1965
summarized_judgment: the appellant, owner of certain premises in calcutta, leased them out and the respondent was inducted as a sub - tenant in june 1954. in july 1954, appellant filed a suit for ejectment of the tenant. in august 1954, the apparat filed a lawsuit under art. 227 of the constitution to high court, and it was dismissed except as to fixation of rent.

tagline: Begum Noorbanu And Ors. vs Deputy Custodian General Of ... on 7 May, 1965
summarized_judgment: evacuee property dated september 12, 1960 holding that one zarina who migrated to pakistan in the year 1949 had 7 / 48th interest in certain specified items of property left by her father khan bahadur ahmed alladin who died on december 21, 1954. a similar notice bearing the same date was served on noorbanu, widow of the khan bahadur.

tagline: A.D. Partha Sarathy vs State Of Andhra Pradesh on 7 May, 1965
summarized_judgment: order subba rao, j. 1, filed an application in that court for obtain a certified copy of the judgment. stamps were called for on august 5, 1964, and they were deposited on august 6, 1964. the time taken by the court for furnishing the copy to the petitioner was about 110 days.

tagline: Sachdanand Prasad vs Babu Sheo Prasad Singh on 6 May, 1965
summarized_judgment: mortgagee - respondent had agreed to pay a portion of the rent of the entire holding. mortgagee appealed, which was allowed in part passing a decree for redemption of a small plot only on the ground that this portion of land was not sold at the rent sale. mortgagors'appeal was dismissed and the mortgagee's appeal to the high court was dismissed.

tagline: Kumar Harish Chandra Singh Das & ... vs Bansidhar Mohanty And Ors on 5 May, 1965
summarized_judgment: first respondent lent money to appellant and obtained a mortgage deed from him in the name of benamidar - attestation by lender - if maintainable. the appellant contended that the mortgage deed was not validly obtained and ( ii ) by the high court. neither the definition of " invoked " in s. 3 nor s. 59 of the transfer of property act debars a party to the deed.

tagline: Mohd. Mahmood And Another vs Tikam Das And Another on 4 May, 1965
summarized_judgment: respondent no. 2 was landlord under s. 15 of madhya pradesh's madhya pradesh accommodation control order, 1961. the appellants who were sub - tenants under. s. 16 ( 2 ) of the act gave a notice to the landlord of the accommodation in dispute obtained a decree of ejectment against him. the high court held that the suit was barred by s. 45 ( 1 ) of. the act.

tagline: Gajjan Singh vs State Of Madhya Pradesh on 7 May, 1965
summarized_judgment: appellant gajjan singh appeals to court by special leave against his conviction under section 461 and 474, indian penal code and sentences in the aggregate of three years'rigorous imprisonment and a fine of rs. 1000, was convicted originally under sections 461, 474 and india by the additional sessions judge, indore.

tagline: Municipal Corporation Of The City ... vs Kishan Lal And Ors. on 4 May, 1965
summarized_judgment: judgment raghubar dayal, j. 1, is against the order of the high court of madhya pradesh. order quashing certain notifications and order of land acquisition officer, jabalpur. 2. the respondent was served with a notice issued to mm by the lands acquisition officer. the order was quashed by the supreme court.

tagline: Chidambaraiyer And Others vs P. S. Renga Iyer And Others on 6 May, 1965
summarized_judgment: the mortgagors filed a petition under s. 9a and s. 19a of the madras agriculturists relief act for scaling down the mortgage debt thereunder. the mortgagees raised a plea, inter alia, that the mortgage interest had been transferred to a charity for consideration.

tagline: Bhanwar Lal And Anr vs Regional Settlement ... on 6 May, 1965
summarized_judgment: the custodian of evacuee property issued a notice under s. 7 ( 1 ) to deceased mortgagees. it could not be served on the predecessors of the appellants who had died long before the issue of the notice. the high court dismissed the petition holding that issue of notice was sufficient compliance tinder s 7. 1 of the act.

tagline: Aghnoo Nagesia vs State Of Bihar on 4 May, 1965
summarized_judgment: the appellant was convicted under s. 302 indian penal code by the high court. the confession was made to a police officer - confessional confessional f. i. r. by accused - baning the confession. if the confession is tainted the taint attaches to the whole statement of the accused.

tagline: Baijnath Gupta And Others vs The State Of Madhya Pradesh on 7 May, 1965
summarized_judgment: sanction under s. 197 ( 1 ) of the code of criminal procedure was necessary for the prosecution of the appellant for offence committed in the discharge of official duty - public servant charged under ss. 477a and 409 i. p. c. - sanction whether required.

tagline: S.A.L. Narayan Row And Anr. vs Ishwarlal Bhagwandas And Anr. on 7 May, 1965
summarized_judgment: the 1st income - tax officer, c - ii ward, bombay, filed an estimate of his income under section 18a ( 2 ) and of the tax payable by him. an order under section 23b of the act provisionally assessed the income was made by the income tax officer. it was found that the tax paid on the basis of the estimate of the assessee was less than eighty per cent of tax determined.

summarized_judgment: appellant was prosecuted under s. 408 indian penal code on the ground that he misappropriated certain amounts. high court ordered production of certain documents which would show such deposit. documents were not produced because of the vagueness of the demand. appellant contended that the high court acted beyond the jurisdiction granted by s. 428.

tagline: Lekhraj Satramdas, Lalvani vs Deputy Custodlan-Cum-Managing ... on 4 May, 1965
summarized_judgment: the appellant was appointed manager of evacuee shops. he was ordered to hand over possession of the shops. it was based on the orders of the chief settlement commissioner in ex p. 5. both parties appealed to a division bench of the high court which held against the charge.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs Ishwarlal Bhagwandas And Others on 7 May, 1965
summarized_judgment: the commissioner of income - tax, bombay & another vs. respondent, refused the order before the commissioner on the ground that the omission to charge pepal interest could not be considered a mistake apparent from the record, in view of the proviso to s. 18a ( 6 ), which was introduced on 24th may 1953 but was made retrospectively retrospectively.

tagline: Thayyil Mammo And Anr. vs Kottiath Ramunni And Ors. on 4 May, 1965
summarized_judgment: in all the circumstances of the appeal, we direct that there will be no order as to costs of this appeal appeal. in all, the appeal is dismissed, but the appeal has been dismissed. we can't afford to pay for this appeal... but we don't know what the appeal will appeal.

tagline: Mahant Kaushalya Das vs State Of Madras on 7 May, 1965
summarized_judgment: appellant was arrested by the police and immediately produced before the presidency magistrate. appellant pleaded guilty and upon that plea, he was convicted by the magistrate. the appellant preferred an appeal to the high court alleging that he was an illiterate person, not acquainted with english or tamil or with any other south indian language.

tagline: Bhimaji Shanker Kulkarni vs Dundappa Vithappa Udapudi And Anr on 5 May, 1965
summarized_judgment: the defendants pleaded that the transaction in question was an advance lease and not a mortgage. under s. 70 ( b ) of the act it was one of the duties of the mamlatdar to decide whether a person was a'protected tenant'under the act, the court had no jurisdiction to determine whether defendant no. 1 was a usufructuary mortgagee under a mortgage deed.

tagline: M/S. A. C. Estates vs M/S. Serajuddin & Co. And Another on 7 May, 1965
summarized_judgment: the appellant, owner of certain premises in calcutta, leased them out and the respondent was inducted as a sub - tenant in june 1954. in july 1954, appellant filed a suit for ejectment of the tenant. in august 1954, the apparat filed a lawsuit under art. 227 of the constitution to high court, and it was dismissed except as to fixation of rent.

tagline: Sadhu Singh vs Delhi Administration on 1 June, 1965
summarized_judgment: the petitioner was detained under an order of detention passed by the district magistrate of delhi under r. 30 - a ( b ) on the same date. within six months i. e. on february 24 1965, the order was confirmed by the administrator of the order. in support of the petition it was urged that ( 1 ) even if the proceedings are purely purely administrative, a proceeding for review. the order of review involves judicial consideration of the facts on which the order may be made.

tagline: M. G. Abrol vs M/S. Shantilal Chhotalal & Co on 27 July, 1965
summarized_judgment: customs authorities ordered the confiscation of the scrap sought to be exported by the respondents. a part of the goods was not'steel skull scrap'and all the provisions of the said act would apply. the customs authorities took the view that a part wasn't'steel teeth scrap '

tagline: Sahib Singh Dugal vs Union Of India on 30 July, 1965
summarized_judgment: petitioner was arrested on december 6, 1964 for an offence under 3 of the official secrets act. the petitioner came out of the jail he was to be detained in order to prevent him from acting in a manner prejudicial to the defence of india, public safety, and india's relations with foreign powers.

tagline: Joint Chief Controller Of Imports ... vs M/S. Aminchand Mutha Etc on 21 July, 1965
summarized_judgment: the central government was given power to restrict or controlling the import of goods into india. it provided for the granting of licences to " established importers ", persons engaged in import trade for at least one financial year falling within a specified period called the basic period. the company was dissolved in 1947, and the state was handed power to the licensing authority.

tagline: Matukdhari Singh And Others vs Janardan Prasad on 20 July, 1965
summarized_judgment: the appellants were tried on a complaint before an honorary magistrate for offences under s. 467 indian penal code. the complainant appealed to the high court against the acquittal and ordered retrial - legality of high court's order. acquit hidayatullah, m. sarkar, a. k. ramaswami, was acquitted of charges in respect of which he had jurisdiction.

tagline: Raja Bhanupratap Singh vs Assistant Custodian Evacuee ... on 29 July, 1965
summarized_judgment: the appellant was the holder of a money decree against an evacuee whose property had vested in the custodian under s. 10 ( 2 ) of the act, 1950. it was not liable to be proceed against in execution so long as it remained vested in. the order was confirmed by the cuspdian general, in revision. in his appeal to this court, appellant contended that the. appellant should have entertained his claim.

tagline: Madhya Pradesh Industries Ltd vs Union Of India And Others on 16 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: appellant's revision application under r. 55 of the mineral concession rules, was rejected by the central government. the appellant filed an appeal under art. 136 of the constitution, to this court, against the order of central government dismisses its revision application. state of bombay had been divided into the states of maharashtra and gujarat, the government of maharashtra, in which state the mines fell.

tagline: Kanwal Ram And Ors vs The Himachal Pradesh Admn on 19 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: k, a woman, was alleged to have married a second time in contravention of the provisions of the hindu marriage act. two of her relatives were convicted for abetment of the second marriage. the trial court and the judicial commissioner of himachal pradesh held that evidence of the only witness who was produced to prove second marriage, fell short of proving it.

tagline: The Bahrein Petroleum Co. Ltd vs P. J. Pappu And Another on 16 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: appellants applied for stay of suit under s. 34 of the indian arbitration act, 1940 and protested against the jurisdiction of the court to try the suit. they fought up to the appellate and revisional courts, and were compelled to apply for stay - dismissed - appeal - if recognition of jurisdiction of court. appellant's application is in no way a recognition that court has jurisdiction to try.

tagline: Union Of India vs West Punjab Factories Ltd on 24 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: two suits were filed claiming damage for loss of goods by'fire'the union of india resists both the suits. it was claimed to be owner of the goods as consignor. the two suits, as filed, were not maintainable. both suits claim damages should have been awarded at the contract rat - and not the market rate.

tagline: Martin Burn Ltd vs The Corporation Of Calcutta on 19 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: valuation of premises wrongly made under s. 127 of the calcutta municipal act, 1923, was ascertained by the methods prescribed in cl. ( b ) of s. 131 ) the appellant lodged objections to the high court claiming that the basis of valuation was wrong as it should have beenmade by the method prescribed by the court of small causes.

tagline: Jan Mohammad Noor Mohammad Begban vs State Of Gujarat And Another on 18 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: the bombay agricultural produce markets act ( 22 of 1939 ) was enacted by the provincial legislature of bombay and under the state of gujarat. the act was passed but under the act, the act 22 of 1964 remained in operation. the petitioner filed a petition under art. 32 of the constitution seeking a declaration that gujarat act 20 of 1964 was unconstitutional, unconstitutional and violative of arts.

tagline: Bhagwandas Goverdhandas Kedia vs M/S. Girdharilal Parshottamdas ... on 30 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: m / s. girdharilal parshottamdas and co. andothers date of judgment. they entered into a contract with the appellants by longdistance telephone. the offer was spoken by the respondent at gujarat and the acceptance was spoken at gujarat. the application was made in limine, where by special leave, he came to court.

tagline: Bharat Singh And Anr vs Bhagirathi on 26 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: the appellants filed a suit alleging that the entry in the name of the respondent in the jamabandi papers of certain villages was incorrect and alleged that their brother died as a member of the joint hindu family. the suit, which was brought in 1951, was barred by time as she had become owner and possessor of the land in suit in 1925 on her death.

tagline: V. N. Sarin vs Major Ajit Kumar Poplai on 9 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: appellant became tennant of premises owned by a hindu family of which respondent no. 2 was the head. on partition of a hindu undivided family was not an'acquisi - tion by transfer'the appellant came to the supreme court by special leave. it was contended on behalf of appellant that under s. 53 of the indian registration act, and s. 17 ( 1 ) of the act.

tagline: Ram Kishore Sen And Others vs Union Of India And Others on 11 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: ' indo - pakistan agreements'entered into in 1956 between prime ministers of india and pakistan half of the area known as barubari union no. 12. a portion of chilahati village admeasuring 512 acres were agreed to be transferred by india to pakistan. a section of the indian parliament will be divided to give half the area to pakistan, the half adjacent to india being retained by india.

tagline: The Public Passenger Service ... vs M. A. Khader And Two Others on 30 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: a notice under art 29 of the articles of association was issued. the respondents filed a petition under ss. 402 and 237 of the companies act, 1956. they obtained interim orders directing stay of collection of the moneys and restraining forfeiture of the shares. but when the call money was not paid into court as directed the interim order was vacated.

tagline: Achuthan Nair vs Chinnamu Amma And Others on 13 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: an appellant was the 4th defendant in the suit while his mother was the 1st defendant. they denied that the said chalakkode property belonged to the tavazhi property. the defendants were impleaded as respondents in the appeal. the high court, however, took into account the presumptions under marumakkathayam law.

tagline: Ratilal Balabhai Nazar vs Ranchhodbhai Shankarbhai Patel ... on 23 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: appellant was required under the terms of the tenancy to pay in addition municipal taxes and electric energy consumed by him. the appellant did not pay rent from june 1, 1956 for a period of over six months, in 1956 for which the respondent gave a notice to him on february 20, 1957 terminating his tenancy.

tagline: Ishverlal Thakorelal Almaula vs Motibhai Nagjibhai on 10 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: in june 1939, appellant granted tenancy of certain lands for agricultural purposes, at first to the respondent's father. the appellant's claim, but in appeal, the district judge reversed this decision - on the ground that under the proviso to s. 43c, of the bombay tenancy and agricultural lands act 67 of 1948. the tenancy was continued from year to year under fresh agreements.

tagline: Ahmedabad Mill Owners' ... vs The Textile Labour Association on 10 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: textile workers at gujarat's gujarat industrial relations act paid for dearness allowance. demand became subject of arbitration and arbitration and an, award by the industrial court at bombay. government of india advised state government to remove anomalies in the state series of price index number, with 2. 98 as the linking factor.

tagline: Sidram Narsappa Kamble vs Sholapur Borough Muncipality & ... on 27 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: in 1946, the bombay tenancy act, 1939 was applied to the respondent - muncipality. in 1948, the appellant became a protected tenant under s. 3, 3a and 4 of the 1948 act. in 1947, the act provided that every tenant shall, on the expiry of one year from the date of the act, be deemed protected.

tagline: Mirza Ali Akbar Kashani vs United Arab Republic And Anr on 5 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: first respondent was the united arab republic while second responder was one of its departments. the appellant filed a suit for breach of contract against the respondents on the original side of the calcutta high court. it was filed without obtaining the consent of central government under s. 86 ( 1 ) of the law.

tagline: Nichhalbhai Vallabhai And Ors. vs Jaswantlal Zinabhai And Ors. on 23 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: judgment v. ramaswami, j. 1, is brought on behalf of defendants 1 to 6 and 24 to 39 against the high court of gujarat dated april 17, 1963 in first appeal allowing an application for amendment of the plaint and remanding the suit for retrial before the civil judge ( s. d. ) at surat.

tagline: W Union Of India (Uoi) vs West Punjab Factories Ltd. on 24 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: two suits filed against india claiming damages for loss of goods destroyed by fire on the railway platform at morar road railway station. the consignment was consigned to j. c. mills while the remaining goods wee still in the custody and possession of the railway. the case of the factory was declared in favour of ishwara nand saraswat who filed the suit.

tagline: Dr. S. Dutt vs State Of Uttar Pradesh on 18 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: the appellant was examined as a forensic expert in sessions trial. he claimed to hold a diploma in criminology which he produced before the sessions judge was asked to do so. appellant objected it his trial for these offences that he could not be prosecuted as the facts disclosed offences under ss. 193 and 196 of the indian penal code.

tagline: Ramchandra vs Tukaram And Ors on 24 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: landlord could terminate a lease by issuing a notice to the lessee under s. 9. landlord could apply to an order restoring possession to the landlord. landlord may apply to the tahsildar who may pass such order as he deems fit. the landlord could be subject to the conditions contained in cls.

tagline: Kamal Narain Sharma vs Shri Pandit Dwarka Prasad Mishra ... on 17 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: an election petition was filed by the appellant against the first respondent in his objections before the election tribunal raised the question whether the affidavit under rule 94a was sworn before a clerk of court appointed commissioner of oaths under s. 139 ( cj ) of the code of civil procedure - af fidavit sworn before the high court under art. 226 and art. 227 of the constitution and high court, holding that order of the tribunal were challenged by the first.

tagline: M. Radhakrishna Gade Rao Sahib vs State Of Madras on 27 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: the appellants'predecessors by an instrument provided that out of the income of properties a specified sum was to be set apart for certain charities. a specific endowment was created by the per sarkar and dayal, jj. an appellant filed a suit under s. 62 ( ii ) of the act for cancellation of this order.

tagline: Pema Chibar Alias Preamabhai ... vs Union Of India And Others on 9 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: petitioner a resident of goa, daman a former portuguese territory in india, became a citizen of india on the 20th december 1961, by conquest. he had obtained licences between 9th october and 4th december 1961. they were valid for 180 days and could be renewed for a further period of 180 days.

tagline: Ram Rattan Gupta vs Director Of Enforcement, Foreign ... on 30 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: appellant visited far eastern countries during the years 1951 to 1956 after - obtaining from india the necessary foreign exchange for the purpose of meeting his expenditure during his tour. the appellant should have lent foreign exchange to a person who was not authorised dealer. he was guilty of contravening s. 4 ( 1 ) and ( 3 ) of the act.

tagline: P. Mohammed Meera Lebbai vs Thirumalaya Gounder Ramaswamy ... on 23 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: the appellant filed an appeal in 1960 after the kerala high court act 5 of 1959 had been passed and under its provisions the appeal was heard by a single judge. on the judgment came to the supreme court by special leave. it was contended on his behalf on the basis of kadhakrishan's case that the institution of a suit carries with it the assertion all rights of appeal are preserved to the parties thereto till the rest of the career of the suit.

tagline: S. N. Sundalaimuthu Chettiar vs Palaniyandavan on 12 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: the appellants act, of 1955 s. 2 ( a ) and ( ee ) - " carry on personal cultivation ", scope of - - son - in - law if member of family. appellant objected on the ground that neither the wife nor the daughter was a cultivating tenant under the act. but the sub - collector overruled the objection and directed the respondent to deposit the arrears.

tagline: M/S. Bundelkhand Motor Transport ... vs Behari Lal Chiaurasia And Another on 17 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: appellant applied to the r. t. a., jabalpur, for renewal of the permit and the permit was renewed. the appellant also applied for countersignature of the renewal, to the same authority, under rule 63, framed under s., 68 of the act, for plying in the rewa region ;. the application wag rejected.

tagline: P. C. Gulati vs Lajya Ram Kapur And Others on 19 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: when s. 193 of the code of criminal procedure prohibits the court of session, from taking " cognizance of any offence as a court of original jurisdiction " the court is competent under s. 526 ( 1 ) ( ii ) of the. code to transfer a case from magistrate's court to sessions power of high court.

tagline: Sant Saranlal And Another vs Parsuram Sahu And Others on 6 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: the appellants sued the respondents for recovery of money advanced. the 2nd appellant was registered as a moneylender under s. 5 ( 4 ) of the act, 1938 and r. 5 of the rules made thereunder. since registration certificate mentioned he could transact money - rending business up to a maximum of rs. 4999, he could get a decree only for that sum.

tagline: Pacific Minerals (P) Ltd. vs The State Of Madhya Pradesh And ... on 19 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: judgment r. s. bachawat, j. 1. the question turns entirely on the meaning to be given to the words " cost of carriage and freight " both the leases provided for payment of royalty at the rate of 5 per cent of the sale value at the pit's mouth of dressed ore.

tagline: Mamidi Venkata Satyanarayana ... vs Mandela Narasimhaswami And ... on 27 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: the shares of the four sons in the joint family properties, described altogether as 4 / 5 th share, were put up for auction in december 1936 and purchased by s. n. on november 6, 1939. the sale to s. s. was duty confirmed. but the sale of the properties was not approved as it was the subject matter of insolvency proceedings. some of the defendants filed an appeal to the high court.

tagline: Modhusudano Mollana vs Kontaru Naiko And Others on 6 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: orissa money lenders act 1939 had become void on account of the money lent being in excess of rs. 2, 000. appellant under s. 5 ( 4 ) and r. 5 provided for maximum capital to be invested in business. application of appellant was not accepted by the high court.

tagline: Ramvallabh Tibrewalla vs Dwarkadas & Co on 31 August, 1965
summarized_judgment: the appellant applied to the court for filing of the arbitration act, under s. 20 of the act. there were changes in the arbitrator, and extensions of time, but no award was made. but the application was rejected on the ground that the section was not attracted.

tagline: Dr. Ram Manohar Lohia vs State Of Bihar And Others on 7 September, 1965
summarized_judgment: dr. ram manohar lohia, a. k. bachawat, is the latest state of bihar to win the toss of the toss in the toss or toss it out. he was the first elected member of the state of india to take over the sport's governing body of india.

tagline: A. K. Gupta And Sons vs Damodar Valley Corporation on 10 September, 1965
summarized_judgment: appellant filed a suit against the respondent claiming a declaration on a proper interpretation of the contract between them. the appellant was entitled to an enhancement of 20 % over the tendered rates. the high court rejected a petition for amending the plaint by including a prayer for a decree for rs. 65, 000.

tagline: Kalyani Stores vs The State Of Orissa And Others on 21 September, 1965
summarized_judgment: in a petition under article 226, the appellant challenged imposition of a duty of excise on'foreign liquor'imported goods fromout side the state of the state. it was contended on behalf of an appellant that since no foreignliquor was manufactured within the state and therefore noexcise dutywas being levied on such liquor.

tagline: The State Of West Bengal vs Nripendra Nath Bagchi on 10 September, 1965
