summarized_judgment: soni lalji jetha and grandson of the original mortgagee sold to l and k, sons of original mortgages. the coparceners, by a registered sale deed, sold the properties to l. k and sons. the suit was decreed. in pursuance of the decree, k was not made one of the conveying parties, but only an attesting witness.

tagline: Hazarat Pirmahomed Shah Saheb ... vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 27 October, 1966
summarized_judgment: the death of hazrat pirmahomed shah saheb in gujarat in 1962 was the reason for his death. the class of murids consists of the descendants of the murid family initiated by the saint in his lifetime. the order of the roza and the mosque required moneys and so did the observance of festive occasions such as urs, death anniversaries.

tagline: Commissioner Of Wealth Tax, ... vs Ramaraju Surgical Cotton Mills, ... on 5 October, 1966
summarized_judgment: the respondent claimed deduction of - an amount laid out for setting up a new unit. the assessee was entitled to the claim as it satisfied the condition laid down in cl. ( xxi ) of s. 5 ( 1 ) of the act. the act came into force, ie., april 1, 1957.

tagline: A. Narayanan And Anr. vs Commissioner Of Income Tax, ... on 27 October, 1966
summarized_judgment: judgment shah, j. 1. chockalingam executed will devising property. court of judicature at madras the following question under section 66. court heard income tax officer assessed income - tax officer's income. ruling could be used as a way to restore trust of the aforesaid.

tagline: Ram Kumar Agarwalla And Brothers vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 26 October, 1966
summarized_judgment: shah, j. c. ramaswami, v. bhargava, vishishtha and d were partners of a firm of. share brokers and paper merchants. they started negotiations for the purchase of shares representing the controlling interest in s. company. m and his associates would pay rs. 6 lakhs upon completion of the purchase.

tagline: Sales-Tax Officer, Circle-1, ... vs Hanuman Prasad on 11 October, 1966
summarized_judgment: madhya pradesh general sales tax act, 1958, came into farce repealing the former act thereupon. the respondent was assessed to tax under s. 19 ( 1 ) of the repealed act, which provided five years period for reassessment escaped assessment. the appeal must be dismissed.

tagline: Mahendra Rambhai Patel vs Controller Of Estate Duty, ... on 28 October, 1966
summarized_judgment: the trustees were to hold the shares of each beneficiaries until he reached the age of twenty - five years. if either of them died before that age, their interest passed under s. 5 of the act. under the deed of trust 160 shares of a company were settled equally upon the appellant and younger brother.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs Girdhardas & Company Private Ltd on 7 October, 1966
summarized_judgment: shah, j. c. and girdhardas & company private ltd. date of completion of winding up it had an accumulated profit of rs. 5, 34, 041, from time, to time the liquidator distributed the assets in his hands among the shareholders. the income - tax officer in the course of assessment for the year 1958 - 59 sought to bring the entire amount so distributed to tax as'dividend'the appellate assistant commissioner confirmed order of the income tax officer.

tagline: Krishna Coconut Co. & Anr vs East Godavari Coconut & Tobacco ... on 27 October, 1966
summarized_judgment: the respondent market committee il - vied in respect of the declared commerical crops, a fee on goods'bought and sold'in notified area. the appellants filed suits contesting the levy on the ground that they sold coconuts and copra to customers outside the notified area and in some cases outside the state. a second appeal was dismissed by the sub - judge who further held the fee in substance being a tax.

tagline: Gurbax Singh vs State Of Punjab & Ors on 25 October, 1966
summarized_judgment: appellant was a tenant of the 3rd respondent since 1950. he applied for the purchase of those lands under s. 18 of the punjab security of land tenures act, 1953, and rule 23 of the rules made thereunder. an appellant's writ petition against the financial commissioner's order was dismissed in limine.

tagline: S. S. Rajalinga Raja vs State Of Madras on 26 October, 1966
summarized_judgment: the state of madras plantations agricultural income tax act ( 5 of 1955 ) in 1957 - 58, he submitted a return under the act, 1955. the high court ought to have directed determination of the produce which was actually derived from agriculture in the year of account. income derived from sale of that produce was not exempt from tax under that act in the earlier years.

tagline: Jammu & Kashmir Bank Ltd vs Attar-Ul-Nissa & Others on 7 October, 1966
summarized_judgment: s. 72 - state government making excess payments into bank account of constituent of bank - bank. the bank was entitled to reverse the entries at the instance of the ac - countant general without reference to s. m. mitter, k. n. shelat, j. m, mitter and g. k. were among those to receive the money on behalf of the state.

tagline: Shyam Sunder vs Satya Ketu & Ors on 5 October, 1966
summarized_judgment: the appellant, who was also a candidate challenged the election by an election petition. the high court dismissed the preliminary objection and allowed the appeal to be dismissed as it was not accompanied by a copy of a decree containing details of cost directed to be prepared by the tribunal. the appeal was upheld in an appeal to high court under s. 116 - a of the representation of the people act, 1951.

tagline: Srinivasavardacharur And Ors vs Gopala Menon And Ors on 4 October, 1966
summarized_judgment: the trial court granted the appellants'suit for enforcement of the mortgages against the property and awarded interest at the rate of 15 per cent compoundable with yearly rests. the court must go back to the date of the original transaction and form an opinion as to rate of interest.

tagline: R.B.H.M. Jute Mills, Katihar And ... vs Certificate Officer, Katihar And ... on 13 October, 1966
summarized_judgment: judgment r. s. bachawat, j. 1, was assessed to pay sales tax for four different periods. appellant filed objections disputing its liability to pay any interest. the appellant has filed four writ applications challenging these orders. the certificate officer claimed payment of the interest due on the certificates.

tagline: Lala Ram vs Supreme Court Of India & Ors on 31 October, 1966
summarized_judgment: the petition was found defective as the cash security of rs. 2, 000 as required by o. xl r. 2 ( 2 ) of the supreme court rules, 1966 had not been deposited. the petitioner has been given a full hearing and his case had been disposed of on merits.

tagline: Srinivas Gupta vs Hindustan Commercial Bank Ltd. on 3 October, 1966
summarized_judgment: hindustan commercial bank limited ( hereinafter ) with its head office at kanpur. clause 13 of the agreement was that treasurer would look after commodities and articles given to the bank as security was genuine. clause 26, inter alia provided that the security deposited would be under the control and dominion of the bank.

tagline: Delhi Cloth & General Mills Co. Ltd vs The Workmen & Ors on 14 October, 1966
summarized_judgment: dispute between the management of delhi cloth mills and swatantra bharat mills and their workmen was referred to the industrial tribunal. issue 3 in the order of reference raised the question whether the strike at the two units and a lockout declared by management was justified and legal. the tribunal overruled pleas of the management.

tagline: S. Srinivasan vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 4 October, 1966
summarized_judgment: firm's share of the five persons in the profits were defined by the partnership. but the firm allowed interest at 9 % per cent per annum. the interest indirectly arose and accrued to pay for interest on loan upto 12 %. the firm let firm use the funds because of their membership of the firm.

tagline: Ashwin Nanubhai Vyas vs State Of Maharashtra & Anr on 10 October, 1966
summarized_judgment: the complaint had been filed under s. 198 cr. p. c. but the application for substitution of the complainant was resisted by the accused. the complaint was filed under the state of maharashtra and anr. the case law was dismissed after a complaint by the person aggreived - death.

tagline: Municipal Corporation Of Delhi vs Ghisa Ram on 23 November, 1966
summarized_judgment: the sample was divided into three equal parts, put in separate bottles and sealed. one bottle was handed over to the public analyst who analysed it. but the director of central food laboratory was acquitted of his right of obtaining the director's certificate by delay in launching the prosecution.

tagline: Janak Raj vs Gurdial Singh And Anr on 8 November, 1966
summarized_judgment: the appellant, a stranger to the suit, was the auction - purchaser of the judgment - debtor's immovable property in execution of an ex parte money decree. the law makes ample provision for the protection of the judgement - when his property is sold in execution. he can file an application for setting the sale under the provisions of o. xxi, rr. 89 and 90.

tagline: Samarendra Nath Sinha & Anr vs Krishna Kumar Nag on 1 November, 1966
summarized_judgment: application for foreclosure was rejected by the high court. but the trial court ruled that there was lack of conformity between the original court's order and the final decree for sale. the case was remanded to the court and leave was given possession of the properties.

tagline: K. V. Rajalakshmiah Setty & Anr vs State Of Mysore And Anr on 7 November, 1966
summarized_judgment: petitioners were placed in charge of sub - divisions between december 1945 and november 1949. but by a notification dated 17th may 1950, the government showed a concession to a different batch of 41 surveyors. in november 1958, another batch of 107 persons were promoted as assistant engineers.

tagline: Govind Dattatray Kelkar & Ors vs Chief Controller Of Imports & ... on 1 November, 1966
summarized_judgment: petitioners were promoted before the new 57 appointments were made. petitioners had to be promoted before new appointments made. the petitioner said that the appointments should be regularised and that there should be 75 % direct recruits and 25 % departmental promotees. the union public service commission has objected to the appointments.

tagline: Mangal Singh & Anr vs Union Of India on 17 November, 1966
summarized_judgment: punjab reorganisation act, 1966, transferred some areas to himachal pradesh and constituted chandigarh into a union territory. under the act the legislative assembly of haryana is to consist of only 54 members ; members of the legislative council of the old state belong to haryana area - unseated. the appellants challenged the legality of the act in a writ petition.

tagline: Kumara Nand vs Brijmohan Lal Sharma on 29 November, 1966
summarized_judgment: appellant was the winning candidate in an election to the rajasthan legislative assembly. the appellant presided over by a poem read out which represented the respondent to be the greatest of all thieves'appellant is the winner of an election in the rajasthan legislature. he was one of the unsuccessful candidates filed an'election petition and alleged therein that appellant guilty of corrupt practice within the meaning of a. 123 ( 4 ) of the representation of the people act, 1951.

tagline: Attar Singh vs Inder Kumar on 4 November, 1966
summarized_judgment: application for ejectment under s. 13 ( 3 ) of the act requires landlord to have the land vacated if he needed the land for his own use. the landlord could only obtain an order under his. 13 ) ( 3 ( 2 ) ( 1 ) ( ii ) ( f ) ( v ) ( 55 d ) of. the act. the rent controller dismissed the application on view that landlord could get a tenant ejected whatever may be the purpose.

tagline: M. M. Parikh, Income-Tax Officer, ... vs Navanagar Transport & ... on 1 November, 1966
summarized_judgment: an order under s. 23a of the indian income - tax act, 1922 should not be made for the assessment year 1957 - 58. the high court held that an order un - derd 23a. of the act after its amendment by the finance act, 1955 was constitutional. section 23a is not a charging section and an order made thereunder is not an order of assessment.

tagline: Balraj Madhok vs The Union Of India Through Its ... on 18 November, 1966
summarized_judgment: in each of nine petitions, 9 petitions ( nos. 2 to 10 of 1966 ) under article 22 and 226 of the constitution of india and under section 491 of the code of criminal procedure. they allege that they were not informed whey they were arrested, nor were they produced before any magistrate their case is unlawfully detained.

tagline: Jai Singh vs The State on 18 November, 1966
summarized_judgment: more sessions judge, delhi, in sessions cases nos 6 and 9 of 1966. murder reference no. 49 of 1966 is a reference made by the learned additional sessions judge. jai singh was sentenced to death, subject to confirmation of the death sentence. the deceased faqir chand soni was the principal of the commercial college residence.

tagline: Raj Kishore Prasad Narain Singh vs Ram Partap Pandey & Ors on 7 November, 1966
summarized_judgment: appellant obtained usufructuary mortgage from respondents in 1925. appellant filed an application under s. 14 of the act before claims officer - claim sought to be withdrawn at appellate stage - mortgagee if free to pursue remedies under ordinary law in respect of non - vested properties.

tagline: Harish Chander vs Union Of India, Through ... on 21 November, 1966
summarized_judgment: order ( d ) of the indian railway establishment manual ( to be hereinafter referred to as the manual ) under articles 226 and 227 of the constitution, the petitioner is impugning the selection on various grounds. petitioner was given only notice before he was asked to appear the test.

tagline: Mohanlal Hargovinddas vs State Of Madhya Pradesh & Ors on 15 November, 1966
summarized_judgment: the appellant was a firm in madhya pradesh and was registered as a dealer'under the central provinces and berar sales tax act, 1947. in 1955 the firm imported tobacco from the state of bombay on the declaration that it would be used as raw material for manufacturing goods for sale. but the goods were used for a different purpose other than the one declared and mentioned in registration certificate.

tagline: Municipal Committee, Akot vs Manilal Manekji Pvt. Ltd. And ... on 17 November, 1966
summarized_judgment: the appellant municipality was empowered to impose certain taxes under the berar municipal law, 1886, by virtue of a saving provision in s. 66 ( 6 ) of the act, 1923. the title of act 11 of 1922 became the central provinces and berar municipalities act, 1922, which was later amended and re - named c. p. municipalities act in 1922.

tagline: Union Of India And Ors. vs Viranwali And Ors. on 1 November, 1966
summarized_judgment: court below decreed bs. 22, 500. 00 in favour of the plaintiff against the defendants. defendants contended there was no negligence on the part of the servants of defendants. the court below found against defendants on all issues nos. 1 to 5. there is satisfactory evidence on record to show that at the time of accident the gate of the level crossing was open.

tagline: Bharat Fire & General Insurance ... vs Paramshwari Prasad Gupta on 25 November, 1966
summarized_judgment: judgment will dispose of three regular first appeals, being r. f. a. nos. 88. d of 1956. the company also filed a suit against bharat fire and general insurance limited for a declaration that he continues to be the general manager of the company and recovery of rs. 31, 152. 00 / 13.

tagline: Periyasamy vs State Of Madras on 25 November, 1966
summarized_judgment: the appellant was declared hostile - no formal order transferring previous statement to record of case - if previous statement can be relied on. trial judge questioned appellant with reference to the statement of the witness in the committal proceedings and informed him that it was marked under s. 288, cr. p. c. he did not pass an order transferring earlier deposition to the record of the sessions.

tagline: Union Of India vs Daulat Ram, Etc. on 2 November, 1966
summarized_judgment: daulat ram, respondent no. 1, is said to have died on 7th january, 1963. the appeal is alive and can be disposed of on merits, he says. he argues that the appeal as against the deceased must be held to have abated. the rule of law approved by it goes against the appellant, but the ratio does not seem to help him.

tagline: Bharat Fire & General Insurance ... vs Parameshwari Prasad Gupta on 25 November, 1966
summarized_judgment: judgment will dispose of three regular first appeals, being r. f. a. nos. 88 - d of 1956. in the alternative, gupta asked for a decree of rs. 1, 63, 820 as money due to him from the company as detailed in the plaint. the company also filed a suit against bharat fire and general insurance limited.

tagline: Jai Singh And Anr. vs The State on 18 November, 1966
summarized_judgment: the appellants, jai singh and prem singh an offence under s. 302 read with s. 34 of the indian penal code and sentenced jai singh to death. jai singh was sentenced to suffer imprisonment for life. the deceased faqui chand soni was principal of the commercial college situate in park mansion, darya ganj, delhi.

tagline: Superintendent & Legal ... vs Corporation Of Calcutta on 7 December, 1966
summarized_judgment: the state of calcutta filed a complaint against the state for contravention of india. the state was carrying on trade as owner and occupier of a market without obtaining a licence as required under s. 218 of the calcutta municipal act, 1951. state immunity - rule that crown is not bound by statute. if exempted by provisions of the act, state was bound by law in force.

tagline: Lallan Prasad vs Rahmat Ali & Anr on 13 December, 1966
summarized_judgment: india's first respondent executed an agreement to pledge as security - for the debt certain goods, to deliver them to the appellant, and to keep them in appellant's custody. appellant would not be entitled to a decree on the promissory note and retain the goods found to have been delivered to him and in his custody.

tagline: Ghulam Sarwar vs Union Of India & Ors on 15 December, 1966
summarized_judgment: petition seeks issue of writ of habeas corpus. petition to supreme court under art. 359 - - if approved by arts. 14, 21 and 22 of the constitution were suspended during period of emergency. petitioner was arrested for an offence under indian customs act, 1962.

tagline: Ajit Singh vs State Of Punjab & Anr on 2 December, 1966
summarized_judgment: in 1961, consolidation proceedings were taken under the east punjab holdings ( consolidation and prevention of fragmented ) act, 1948, in an estate in which the appellant was a small proprietor holding land within ceiling limit - holders. but no portion of the common pool apart from what was already owned by the gram panchayat, was reserved for providing income to the community, under r. 16 ( ii ) of punjab holdings.

tagline: Triloki Nath Tiku & Anr vs State Of Jammu & Kashmir & Ors on 15 December, 1966
summarized_judgment: petitioners were school teachers in the service of the state of jammu & kashmir. they came to this court under art. 16 of the constitution an the ground that muslims all over the state and hindus in jammu were backward communities. the state is enabled to make reservations in favour of backward classes.

tagline: Chandra Bhushan & Anr vs Deputy Director Of Consolidation ... on 15 December, 1966
summarized_judgment: the appellant filed the petition on the re - opening of the court. the high court erred in exalting a rule of practice, prescribed a binding rule of limitation. the court and its offices were closed, without previous intimation, for the diwali holidays.

tagline: K.N.Shukla vs Navnit Lal Manilal Bhat And Anr on 15 December, 1966
summarized_judgment: appellant was not a public servant who was not removable from his office save by or with the sanction of the central government. the appellant is a class ii officer who could. be removed from office with sanction's approval of the railway board, as per r. 134 of the indian railway establishment code.

tagline: Ramchandra Spg. & Wvg. Mills vs Bijli Cotton Mills & Ors on 16 December, 1966
summarized_judgment: appellant challenged the sale on the allegation that one - fourth of the sale - proceeds was not paid immediately after auction - - order whether appealable - - o. 21 r. 90 was not applied. the order of the civil judge determined the question whether the sale was a nullity. the court decided in favour of the respondents and rejected the appellant's legal argument.

tagline: D. S. Reddy vs Chancellor, Osmania University & ... on 9 December, 1966
summarized_judgment: the 1959 act was amended to provide for the appointment of the vice - chancellor by the chancellor alone. section 5 of this amending act xi of 1966 introduced a new s. 13a. provision introduced whereby he could only be removed from office by an order of the chancellor passed on the ground of mis - behaviour or incapacity after enquiry by a person who was or had been a judge of a high court or supreme court.

tagline: Prem Ballabh Khulbe vs Mathura Datt Bhatt on 16 December, 1966
summarized_judgment: appellant obtained a final decree for certain sums against the respondent. the appellant applied for the execution of the'respondent'appellant was the managing partner of the partnership assets. the appeal must be dismissed if a partner cannot be regarded as a trustee for the other partners.

tagline: H. A. K. Rao, Chartered Accountant vs Council Of Institute Of Chartered ... on 13 December, 1966
summarized_judgment: the council of institute of chartered accountants of india filed a writ petition to quash the notification. it was contended on his behalf that the power of the council to issue a notification is limited by the express provisions of cl. ( ii ) of part 11 of the second schedule to the act, 1949. the appellant claimed that he had a legal right to issue circulars or manifestoes within the meaning of the proviso.

tagline: Bhagat Ram & Ors vs State Of Punjab & Ors on 2 December, 1966
summarized_judgment: petitioner challenged it on the ground that in so far as it makes reservation of land for the income of the panchayat - if acquisition - if hit by second proviso to art. 31a ( 1 ) of the constitution of india would not amount to acquisition within the second. in the first case, the beneficiary is the state while in the second, the state of the second is not the state.

tagline: Ram Lal Puri vs Gokalnagar Sugar Mills Co. Ltd. on 13 December, 1966
summarized_judgment: two letters patent appeals ( letters patent appeal nos. 26 - d and 27 - d of 1964 ) arise out of the same proceedings and being directed against one main judgment of a learned single judge may be disposed of by one judgment. the vendee sought extension of time for the completion of the sale upto 20 - 4 - 1947.

tagline: Vijendra Nath & Ors vs Jagdish Rai Aggarwal & Ors on 2 December, 1966
summarized_judgment: application consigned to records pending tenant's appeal against decree - s. 19 amended pending appeal - fresh execution application filed after dismissal of appeal - whether can be filed without obtained fresh permission from competent authority under 19 of 1956. those objections to the execution application failed and his appeal and subsequent revision before high court failed.

tagline: Harinder Mohan Dass vs General Manager, Northern ... on 12 December, 1966
summarized_judgment: order ( 1 ) these are connected with petitions under article 226 of the constitution. petitioners who are serving as enquiry cum reservation clerks in the northern railway, seek the following carvings. they raise common questions of law and fact. but they can be considered in a common judgment.

tagline: Narinder Mohan Pass vs General Manager Northern Railway on 12 December, 1966
summarized_judgment: petitioners who are serving as enquiry cum reservation clerks in the northern railway seek to restore the names of the petitioners on panel. petitioners seeking to restore names of petitions on panel's panel shown in annexure'e'to petition and restore name of petition.

tagline: Indian & General Investment Trust ... vs Shri Purna Chandra Mardaraj & Co on 13 December, 1966
summarized_judgment: claims officer required under s. 3 of the orissa estates abolition act 1951 to determine amount of debt'legally and justly due'the claims officer cannot determine the principal and interest due under a mortgage without considering the question as to whether the claim is true or whether it is still subsisting.

tagline: A.K. Mallu vs Puranachandra Rao & Anr on 16 December, 1966
summarized_judgment: the words " any offence under the indian penal code " cannot be read ejusdem generis with theft etc. mentioned earlier in the section of the section. the words'no offence under indian law punishable with not more than two years'imprisonment are capable of being dealt with under the penal code.

tagline: Babu Lal vs Sheonath Das on 13 December, 1966
summarized_judgment: landlords obtained a decree for ejectment of the tenant from the accommodation under s. 7 ( 2 ) of the u. p. ( temporary ) control of rent judgment. the appellant was a tenant of respondents 2 & 3 in varanasi. landlords obtain a decree from the tenant to make new allotment and to evict tenant.

summarized_judgment: appellant obtained a final decree for certain sums against the respondent. the appellant applied for the execution of the'respondent'appellant was the managing partner of the partnership assets. the appeal must be dismissed if a partner cannot be regarded as a trustee for the other partners.

tagline: Raghubans Dubey vs State Of Bihar on 19 January, 1967
summarized_judgment: the appellant was discharged - and transferred to another magistrate. he was charged with a non - bailable warrant against the other accused under s. 207 - a cr. p. c. the order was confirmed by the sessions court and high court. in appeal to this court, there could be no discharge of accused - whether possible, when accused not included.

tagline: State Of Madhya Pradesh & Anr vs Thakur Bharat Singh on 23 January, 1967
summarized_judgment: state of madhya pradesh made an order under s. 3 of the madhya pradesh public security act, 1959, directing the respondent to a police station in raipur district. a single judge of the high court declared clauses ( ii ) and ( iii ) of the order invalid on the view that clauses ( b ) and. ( c ) of. the constitution of india - art. 358 - - scope of legislative or executive action infringing rights of citizens or others taken during emergency under art.

tagline: D.R. Nim, I. P. S vs Union Of India on 5 January, 1967
summarized_judgment: the officers are divided into categories : ( a ) officers appointed as a result of a competitive examination, and ( b ) the year of allotment of an office determines his seniority, is determined according to r. 3 ( 3 ) ( 1 ) of the recruitment rules. if an officer started officiating continuously in a senior post from a date earlier than the date on which any of the officers were recruited by competition, the year was determined ad hoc by the central government.

tagline: Niranjan Shankar Golikari vs The Century Spinning And Mfg. Co. ... on 17 January, 1967
summarized_judgment: appellant joined the service of the respondent company as shift supervisor and was given training in the manufacture of tyre cord yarn. but shortly after completing his training he joined rival concern at higher emoluments. appellant came to this high court under 136 of the constitution. it was contended that the appellant was against public policy within the meaning of s. 27 of the indian contract act.

tagline: Management Of Northern ... vs Industrial Tribunal, Rajasthan, ... on 27 January, 1967
summarized_judgment: petition filed under art. 226 of constitution of india - competency of reference of dispute to industrial tribunal challenged. the society of railway workers union thereupon raised an industrial dispute which was referred by the state government to the industrial tribunal. the high court dismissed the petition, saying it was not competent.

tagline: State Of Mysore vs H. Sanjeeviah on 16 January, 1967
summarized_judgment: state of madras forest act, 1900, gave power to government to make rules regulating transit of forest produce. the state appealed, saying it violated the validity of the provisos on the ground that they were beyond the rule making power under s. 37 of the constitution in 1950.

tagline: National Iron And Steel Co. Ltd. & ... vs The State Of West Bengal & Anr on 17 January, 1967
summarized_judgment: the appellants are four public limited companies, all produced iron and steel goods. they had a common general manager who later became their works manager. but the company was not interested in all the disputes. the order of gratuity binding on all companies was bad as the tribunal considered balance sheets, profit and loss accounts.

tagline: The State Of Uttar Pradesh vs Madan Mohan Nagar on 5 January, 1967
summarized_judgment: order of retirement cast an aspersion or attach a stigma to the officer when it purports to retire him compulsorily. two tests are derived from shayam lal's case, which means the officer is losing benefit he has already earned as he does by dismissal or removal.

tagline: Bejoy Lakshmi Cotton Mills Ltd vs State Of West Bengal And Ors on 18 January, 1967
summarized_judgment: state of west bengal granted a writ under s. 4 of the west bengal land development and planning act, 1948. a development scheme was then prepared and after objections to it bad been invited and disposed of. it was contended by him that the entire proceedings were void for the reasons, inter alia and the state government could not be said to have applied its mind.

tagline: Kamani Metals & Alloys Ltd vs Their Workmen on 24 January, 1967
summarized_judgment: the award of the industrial tribunal in an industrial dispute between the appellant - company ( manufacturing products of non - ferrous metals and alloy ) and its workmen. the tribunal took into account an irrelevant factor in making the award retrospective. the court in november ruled that there was no change of circumstances justifying a revision of wages, pay scales and dearness allowance.

tagline: N.C. Mukherjee And Co. vs Union Of India And Anr. on 18 January, 1967
summarized_judgment: the appellant was a registered firm with our partners. for the accounting years ending with march 31 of the years 1942, 1943, 1944 and 1945. under notice dated september 3, 1954, the firm was assessed to excess profits tax. it raised other objections with which we are not now concerned.

tagline: R. S. Seth Gopikrishan Agarwal vs R. N. Sen, Assistant Collector on 5 January, 1967
summarized_judgment: the assistant collector issued an authorization under s. 126 ( 2 ) of the defence of india ( amendment ) rules. the order could not be defective merely because it did not expressly employ the phrase'reason to believe'in s. 105 of the customs act. the appellant's writ petition under art. 226 challenging the search on various grounds was dismissed.

tagline: D.Sanjeevayya vs Election Tribunal Andhra Pradesh ... on 27 January, 1967
summarized_judgment: the appellant was elected as a member of the rajya sabha. he filed a writ petition in the high court for the issue of a writ of mandamus to the election commission. the petition was dismissed by a repellant who was appointed as a minister in the central cabinet. thereupon resigned his seat in the state legislative assembly.

tagline: Ramekbal Tiwary vs Madan Mohan Tiwary & Anr on 17 January, 1967
summarized_judgment: sessions judge had jurisdiction to set aside acquittal and directing committal for minor offence. he directed the magistrate to commit the accused to sessions on charges under ss. 326 and 338, i. p. c. and 439. the magistrate passed an order under s. 209 ( 1 ) criminal procedure.

tagline: Syed Yousuf Yarkhan & Ors vs Syed Mohammed Yarkhan & Ors on 4 January, 1967
summarized_judgment: syed yousuf yarkhan & ors'date of judgment'india's landmark court dismissed the suit as time barred under art. the indian act of 1322f did not apply to wakf properties, and thus there was no limit under it for a suit for recovery of such.

tagline: State Of Punjab vs Surjit Singh & Another on 6 January, 1967
summarized_judgment: vaidyialingam, c. a. rao, k. subba ( cj ) shah, j. c. rao. first respondent issued summons to the second respondent and another accused. high court was right in holding that public prosecutor not in charge of case - whether can file application - - for withdrawal of case.

tagline: Lala Shanti Swarup vs Munshi Singh & Ors on 3 January, 1967
summarized_judgment: the respondents executed a simple mortgage for a sum of rs. 12, 000 in 1914. the appellants took possession of the property conveyed, but did not make any payment to the mortgagees. when a conveyance contains a covenant by purchaser to pay off encumbrance, they executed a self - liquidating mortgage of three - fourths of their half - share.

tagline: Valliammai Achi vs Nagappa Chettiar & Ors on 23 January, 1967
summarized_judgment: the son obtained pro bate of the will indicated therein and came into possession of the residue of the property. the plaintiffs claim two - thirds share of the properties left by his father. in - appeal was upheld by high court. the defendants appealed to the high court and appealed.

tagline: Ahmedabad Millowners' ... vs I.G. Thakore, President & Ors on 20 January, 1967
summarized_judgment: gujarat millowners'association and union of workmen's association & anr were among those who filed a writ petition in the'high court'the act was passed under s. 73a of the bombay industrial disputes act, 1947 and must be deemed to have been repealed. the act had not been made - applicable to the cotton industry at gujarat.

tagline: Patel India Private Limited vs Union Of India And Ors. on 25 January, 1967
summarized_judgment: the petitioner herein is private company having its office in homby road, bombay. it is the sole distributing agent in india of messrs sawyer's inc. portland, u. s. a. in india imported into india 35 consignments of view master stereoscopes, reels, etc.

tagline: Maneklal Jinabhai Kot vs State Of Gujarat & Ors on 30 January, 1967
summarized_judgment: vaidyialingam, c. a. hidayatullah, m. sikri, s. m., was the manager of a factory in gujarat, india. a complaint was filed against the appellant for contraction of s. 63 of the act. the salesman and the supervisor pleaded guilty to the charge.

tagline: R. B. Seth Jessaram Fatehchand vs Om Narain Tankha & Anr on 19 January, 1967
summarized_judgment: the appellant firm was appointed sole selling agent of a sugar manufacturing company and deposited rs. 50, 000 as security for due performance of the contract ; this amount was to carry interest at 6 % per cent per year. appellant was entitled to commission as if agency had not terminated. judge held that amount was an ordinary debt.

tagline: I.N.Saksena vs State Of Madhya Pradesh on 30 January, 1967
summarized_judgment: state of madhya pradesh issued a memorandum whereby the age of retirement of its employees was raised from 55 to 58 years. clause 5 of the aforesaid memorandum said that appointing authority may require a servant to retire after being granted three months'notice without giving any reasons. the clause also said that this power was normally used to weed out unsuitable employees.

tagline: Ram Rishi Anal vs Delhi Adminisration, Delhi And ... on 30 January, 1967
summarized_judgment: petition for awrit of. habeas - corpus was submitted by the petitioner ram rishi. anal from jail. sri chhabra swore in affidavit that the detenu was arrested on november 7, 1966, while he was participating in the demonstration outside parliament house.

tagline: Life Insurance Corporation Of ... vs Bibi Padmawati on 31 January, 1967
summarized_judgment: the widow of diwan balkishan died in april, 1949. it appears that the first policy lapsed in march, 1947, and the second in may, 1947. in the alternative, the respondent claimed the premia that had been paid on the two policies.

tagline: Syed Khawaja Moinuddin vs Government Of India And 3 Ors on 18 January, 1967
summarized_judgment: appellant was born in india in 1951 at the age of 13. he stayed there till 1955 when he came to india with a pakistani passport. in 1964, he returned to pakistan with pakistani passport in 1964. in 1963, he was deported to pakistan in 1964 and again came to pakistan.

tagline: The Employers Of Azam Jahi Mills ... vs The Workmen on 30 January, 1967
summarized_judgment: the appellants and their workmen entered into an agreement in february 1960 which provided a claim for bonus would only arise if there should be an available surplus after making a provision for all prior charges such as a fair return on paid wages to all the workmen over and above the two weeks'bonus which the employees had agreed to pay irrespective of any profits made by the company.

tagline: Prem Nath And Ors. vs S. Venkatesan And Ors. on 27 January, 1967
summarized_judgment: civil writ petitions nos. 180 - d to 186 - d of 1959 are connected petitions under articles 226 and 227 of the constitution in these petitions. petitioners had a right to go up in appeal to the central board of revenue under section i s8 of the sea customs act. a heavy penalty was imposed on the petitioners on the ground that they imported into india chaff cutter knives without obtaining licences.

tagline: Amar Singh vs The Union Of India And Ors. on 31 January, 1967
summarized_judgment: a petitioner herein is a displaced person from west pakistan. he has prayed for two reliefs to quash the orders passed by the respondents. he is the lawful occupant of a portion of the premises, mentioned earlier. a petition has been filed under article 226 and 227 of the constitution.

tagline: State Of Orissa vs Dr. (Miss) Binapani Dei & Ors on 7 February, 1967
summarized_judgment: shah, j. c. mitter, g. k., was the first respondent to the service of the state government in 1938. she was asked to show why a certain date should not be taken as her date of birth. in 1961 the state of orissa held an enquiry into birth - report and evidence not given - date re - fixed and compulsory retirement order.

tagline: B. Shama Rao vs The Union Territory Of ... on 20 February, 1967
summarized_judgment: the legislative assembly passed the pondicherry general sales tax act in 1959. shelat, j. m. rao, was served as the date of commencement of the act. the act was amended to act as amended up to april 1, 1966. it was brought into force in the state of madras immediately before the completion of the bill.

tagline: S. G. Jaisinghani vs Union Of India And Ors.(With ... on 22 February, 1967
summarized_judgment: acro, v. m. vaidyialingam, cj and a. vehicularia were among the most popular figures in the history of the union of india and ors. in the 1980s, rf 1991, rf won the u. s. supreme court for the first time in the uk and the united states.

tagline: Commissioner Of Sales Tax, Madhya ... vs Jaswant Singh Charan Singh on 23 February, 1967
summarized_judgment: the respondent claimed that charcoal was'coal'within meaning of entry i part iii of sch. ii to the act - rate of tax applies. india the high court held in favour of the responseent relying on the dictionaty meaning of the word'coal "

tagline: I.C. Golak Nath And Ors. vs State Of Punjab And Anr. on 27 February, 1967
summarized_judgment: the expression " estate " shall, in relation to any local area, have the same meaning as that expression or its local equivalent has in the existing law relating to land tenure in that area. any land held under ryotwari settlement, ( ii ) no land held for purposes of agriculture or for purposes ancillary thereto.

tagline: S. Govinda Menon vs The Union Of India & Anr on 2 February, 1967
summarized_judgment: appellant filed a petition for the grant of a writ of certiorari to quash the proceedings initiated against him. an enquiry officer was appointed under rule 5 to investigate the charges. the appellant was a member of the indian administrative service and the first member of board of revenue, kerala state.

tagline: State Of Andhra Pradesh & Anr vs Nalla Raja Reddy & Ors on 28 February, 1967
summarized_judgment: the andhra pradesh land revenue ( additional assessment ) and cess revision act, 1962 ( act 22 of 1962 ) was passed with the object of bringing uniformity in assessment of land revenue in the telengana and andhra areas of the state. the act offended art. 14 of the constitution and was there - fore void.

tagline: Tata Engineering And Locomotive ... vs Assistant Commissioner Of ... on 24 February, 1967
summarized_judgment: the assistant commissioner of commercial taxes and anr filed a petition under art. 226 of the constitution cannot be a substitute for the ordinary remedies at law. but there are exceptions, such as when action is being taken under an invalid law or arbitrarily without the sanction of law.

tagline: Moon Mills Ltd vs Industrial Court Bombay (M.R. ... on 28 February, 1967
summarized_judgment: case no longer exists in india, but it's not clear what happened to the case. the case is expected to be heard at the supreme court of india's supreme court. india is the subject of a series of civil war cases in the uk and the uk's parliament.

tagline: I. C. Golaknath & Ors vs State Of Punjab & Anrs.(With ... on 27 February, 1967
summarized_judgment: the act of india's constitution of india, arts. 13 ( 2 ) constitutional amendments - scheme of consitution will be passed. the act is part of a series of constitutional amendments, including constitutional amendments. the legislation will be amended to allow constitutional amendments to the constitution.

tagline: Workmen Of Shri Rangavilas Motors ... vs Shri Rangavilas Motors (P) Ltd. ... on 1 February, 1967
summarized_judgment: workmen of shri rangavilas motors ( p ) ltd. & anr and ors ( d ) proviso ( 1 ) " affected ", if means " interested " - - order of reference - - could mean " interest " in reference to labour court. india's krishnagiri motor workers'union, a majority of members of the company, took up the workman's grievance. the court ruled that the order of transfer was illegal.

tagline: The State Of Maharashtra & Anr vs B. K. Takkamore & Ors on 2 February, 1967
summarized_judgment: state government passed impugned order superseding the nagpur municipal corporation. order was valid and could not be set aside. state government may pass an order supersession order if sustainable when one of the charges was found not proved. the order of supersing the corporation was valid but could not set aside if the order was proved.

tagline: New Manek Chowk Spinning And ... vs Municipal Corporation Of The City ... on 21 February, 1967
summarized_judgment: petitioners were certain textile mills of gujarat. they filed writ petitions under art. 32 of the constitution against assessment to proper tax by the city of gujarat act. petitioners filed writs under the provisions of the bombay provincial municipal corporation act, 1949. they also fell beyond the ambit of entry 49 of list 11 of the seventh schedule.

tagline: State Of Mysore vs Syed Ibrahim on 21 February, 1967
summarized_judgment: the respondent was the owner of a motor vehicle registered as a " transport vehicle " but the state of mysore acquitted him on the ground that as s. 42 ( 1 ) of the act and not. a'transport vehicle'means, under s. 2 ( 25 ), a vehicle either used or adapted to be used for the carriage of passengers for hire or reward.

tagline: Mahant Harnam Singh, Chela Ofbhai ... vs Gurdial Singh & Anr on 24 February, 1967
summarized_judgment: the appellant was the mahant of a gurdwara which was maintained for a seat known as. nirmala sadhus. the institution owned land,. which was donated to it by the inferior owners of the village. they sought to establish that they had interest in the trust as representatives of the owner of the land.

tagline: Bengal Timber Trading Co. Ltd vs Commissioner Of Sales Tax, ... on 1 February, 1967
summarized_judgment: sales of railway sleepers'actually delivered " meaning of - - question to be considered for decision on delivery within the state of madhya pradesh. in appeal to this court, the sales were covered by the explanation and as such were not taxable by the state's general law. the sale of the sleepers - - " actually delivered, " meant of question.

tagline: State Of Punjab & Ors vs M/S. Tara Chand Lajpat Rai on 28 February, 1967
summarized_judgment: the respondent firm was a registered dealer and furnished quarterly returns of its turnover as required by the rules under the punjab general sales tax act, 1948. a partner of the firm complied with the notice by appearing and producing its account books. the order could not be said to be under s. 11 ( 4 ) of the act and that it was barred by limitation.

tagline: Calcutta Insurance Co. Ltd vs Their Workmen on 6 February, 1967
summarized_judgment: in 1958, an agreement was entered into between the appellant company and its employees. in 1963, the company was incurring losses and it was only in 1962 that its prospects had improved. the dispute was referred to by its award that :'the scales of pay and dearness allowance should be increased and that the employees should be pulled up to fit into the revised scale of service - propriety of provision for gratuity, privilege and sick leave.

tagline: Ram Bachan Lal vs The State Of Bihar on 28 February, 1967
summarized_judgment: petition filed under art. 32 of the constitution challenging the provisions of act as infringing arts. 14, 19 and 31 of the act give sufficient guidance to the government. section 4 contemplates a town containing not less than five thousand inhabitants and a town of a particular density of population.

tagline: Pritam Singh Chahil vs State Of Punjab And Ors on 1 February, 1967
summarized_judgment: petitioner owned certain land in the erstwhile state of punjab and ors. petitioner filed a petition under art. 32 of the constitution challenging the special collector's order and validity of the act. the petitioner is expected to fetch up to $ 1million in the next six months.

tagline: Bishwanath And Anr vs Shri Thakur Radhaballabhji & Ors on 6 February, 1967
summarized_judgment: a temple alienated the idols property in s. 92 of the code of civil procedure. they sought a declaration that the property belonged to the idol and recovery of possession. the trial court's decree in favour of the plaintiff was upheld by the high court. the defendants came to this court with certificate of the plaintiffs title and for possession of its property.

tagline: New Delhi Municipal Committee, ... vs Indian Bank Ltd. on 6 February, 1967
summarized_judgment: mahajan, j. in civil writ no. 29 - d of 1963 challenged the legality of the appellant, passed on 24 / 3 / 1961, enhancing rental value of the premises in the possession of the respondent from rs. 1, 650. 00 to rs. 7, 200. 00 as well as the additional district magistrate's order aggrieved by that decision.

tagline: State Of Assam & Anr vs Gauhati Municipal, Board on 24 February, 1967
summarized_judgment: the appellant issued a notice on june 9, 1964 under s. 298 of the assam municipal act ( xv of 1957 ) which stated that the board was incompetent to perform its duties. the charges were set out in the notice and the board were asked to give an explanation in reply. the high court accepted all these arguments and allowed the appeal.

tagline: Sher Singh & Ors vs State Of Uttar Pradesh on 23 February, 1967
summarized_judgment: the appellants were charged for murder under s. 302 / 34 i. p. c. and were acquitted by the sessions judge. on appeal the high court overturned the acquittal and convicted appellant's under s 302 / git i. m. mitter was acquitted by a sessions judge on appeal. high court can consider evidence and weigh the probabilities.

tagline: Madhavanagar Cotton Mills Co. ... vs Union Of India And Ors. on 23 February, 1967
summarized_judgment: the supreme court referred to the scope of this sub - section in the course of its judgment in pannalal binjraj v. union of india. the court observed thirein : " in this sub section'case'in relation to any case of a particular assessee pending upon the date of transfer "

tagline: Shibsankar Nandy vs Prabartak Sangha And Ors on 1 February, 1967
summarized_judgment: a society registered under the societies registration act, 1860, took to lease a piece of land part of which was already leased to respondents 2 and 3. under the lease respondent no. 1 was entitled to rent from respondents 2 to 3. the terms of the aforesaid tenancy act were not satisfied in the case, but the high court, in revision, allowed it.

tagline: Rajendra Prasad Jain vs Sheel Bhadra Yajee & Ors on 28 February, 1967
summarized_judgment: the appellant was a man of means and he had no political background in bihar where he did not have a permanent residential house. the court ruled that both the above mentioned types of corrupt practices were proved against appellant. there was no misreading of the evidence and no case had been made out for re - appraisal of findings.

tagline: R. Santhankumar Nadar vs Indian Bank Ltd., Madras & Ors on 6 February, 1967
summarized_judgment: a mortgage was created over property situate in the city of madras and the mortgage - deed granted on the mortgage. the appellant purchased a small portion of the property from the first respondent bank. but no notice was served on the app depot. the court ruled that the sale was invalid and not binding on his part in the absence of notice to him.

tagline: Union Of India And Ors. vs Rai Bahadur Seth Shree Ram Durga ... on 28 February, 1967
summarized_judgment: judgment h. r. khanna, j. ( 1 ) this order relates to s. c. a. nos. 28 - d to 54 - d of 1962. petitions'under articles 132 and 133 of the constitution of india and sections 109 and 110 and order 45 have prayed for a certificate of fitness to appeal.

tagline: Khambalia Municilpality & Anr vs State Of Gujarat on 16 February, 1967
summarized_judgment: the appellants field a writ petition for - quashing the notification and declaring s. 9 of the act as ultra vires and unconstitutional. appellant's claim was made by the state of gujarat. the state authorised its development commissioner to exercise powers exercisable by the government.

tagline: Pannalal vs Murarilal on 27 February, 1967
summarized_judgment: appellant had dealings with the respondent in respect of a ruqqa and mortgage. appellant filed two suits against the appellant for recovery of the moneys. they were declared ex - parte and ordered to set aside a lawsuit. in appeal, the court was barred by art. 164 of the indian limitation act, 1908, as more than 30 days had expired.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax Bihar ... vs Manager, Court Of Wards Estate, ... on 24 February, 1967
summarized_judgment: bettiah estate was in possession of the manager, court of wards estate. income tax officer made assessment - propriety of procedure to be followed. high court on reference held that income tax authorities could not impose the tax. case should be made final after the disposal of litigation and the high court could call for a revised judgment.

tagline: Bhagat Raja vs The Union Of India & Ors on 29 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: appellant was one of several applicants for a mining lease in andhra pradesh. the appellant filed an application in revision under s. 30 of the mines & minerals act, 1957, read with r. 54, to the union of india. the state government granted it to'respondent no. 3'to the act. an appeal was filed before this court.

tagline: Thakur Jugal Kishore Sinha vs Sitamarhi Central Co-Operative ... on 13 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: appellant claims assistant registrar in deciding a matter against him under s. 48 of the bihar and orissa co - operative societies act, 1935 had discriminated against the appellant and used double standards. in proceedings under contempt of courts act, the high court of patna held the. appellant guilty. appeal with certificate was filed in this court.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs M/S. Walchand & Co. (Pvt.) Ltd., ... on 17 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: acquittal of indian income tax officer disallowed the increase in remuneration off directors and officers of the assessee - company since the increase was not reflected in ', he said. appellate tribunal rules that the appeal must be dismissed. appeal must now be dismissed if the appeal is dismissed, but the court is not a court.

tagline: Orient Paper Mills Ltd vs Union Of India on 16 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: the appellant company held a licence in form l. 4 under the central excise act. in 1960 a new siding was constructed outside the original factory premises. the company's request to amend its licence so as to include the new railway siding in the factory area was refused. in 1961 the company loaded some wagons of paper after effecting clearance of these goods.

tagline: Phoolchand And Anr vs Gopal Lal on 10 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: the appellant filed a suit for partition against his father, mother, brother, and the adopted son of a predeceased brother. a preliminary decree was passed specifying the shares of the parties, but before the final decree could be passed, the father died, and soon after, the mother died. the judge ruled that the appeal was maintainable without a copy of preliminary decree.

tagline: Mulraj vs Murti Raghonathji Maharaj on 2 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: the appellant applied for the transfer of proceedings relating to permission from the magistrate's court. appellant's application was rejected by a magistrate in appeal. it is not of the same nature as an order allowing an appeal and quashing execution proceedings. an order of stay of execution does not take away the jurisdiction of the court, and there is no fresh conferment.

tagline: Ram Laxman Sugar Mills vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 17 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: a deed of partnership for carrying on the business of a sugar factory in the name and style of m / s. ram laxman sugar mills was executed on august 21, 1939. there were two parties to the deed, the first party representing the joint hindu family of dina nath nanak chand.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income Tax, West ... vs Anil Kumar Roy Chowdhury & Anr on 30 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: the income tax officer, district vi, bid jurisdiction over the assessee's appeal. anil kumar roy chowdhury and anr are seeking to appeal. the high court sent for the records looked into them and on new facts. they answered the question against the revenue in appeal by special leave.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs Thayaballi Mulla Jeevaji Kapasi ... on 15 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: judgment shah, j. 1. thayaballi mulla jeevaji - hereinafter called " the respondent " was a trader in " malabar produce ", cloth, pepper and other commodities. a process server was informed that respondent was in bombay and that " it would take a week to return "

tagline: Union Co-Operative Insurance ... vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 23 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: indian insurance act, 1938, s. 15 - profit of insurance companies, assessment of - bonus paid by company to policy - holder on renewal of policies on which no claim had been made. the high court in a reference under s. 66 of the income - tax act held against the company.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs M/S. Alps Theatre, Patiala on 15 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: the appellate tribunal accepted the assessee's appeal and the high court answered the question in favour of the. assessee. the appeal must be allowed. building under s. 10 ( 2 ) does not include the site because there cannot be any question of destruction of the site. if depreciation on land was allowed it would give a wrong picture of the true income.

tagline: Cochin Company vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 14 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: judgment ramaswami, j. 1 appeal is brought, by special leave, from the judgment of the high court of kerala dated march 26, 1962. for the assessment year 1955 - 56 the appellant, a firm carrying on the business of frozen prawns, made a claim for initial and additional depreciation under sections 10 and 10 ( 2 ) of the latter purchased at pounds.

tagline: State Of Maharashtra vs Dr. M.N. Kaul (Deceased By His ... on 28 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: order hidayatullah, j. 1. by an order dated february 12, 1962. the court granted conditional stay of the operation of an assessment order. dr. kaul must furnish bank guarantee for the amount in favour of the registrar. the writ petition was placed before this court on march, 15, 1965.

tagline: Nagpur Electric Light & Power Co., ... vs Regional Director Employees ... on 2 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: the employees insurance court held the said workers to be employees under s. 2 ( 9 ) and a single judge. the court was wrong in laying down the proposition that every inch of the area over which transmission lines were spread was a factory within the meaning of its. 2. the company appealed to the court by special leave.

tagline: The Union Of India, Represented By ... vs The Indian Sugar Mills ... on 21 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: indian sugar mill association, calcutta & another date of judgment. the company had a large sugar mill for the construction of two " assisted sidings " the company also demanded an increase in charges to be paid instead of the fixed contribution. the railway would charge the company - a shunting engine charge calculated at a fixed rate per hour.

tagline: Krishna Kumar Narula Etc vs The State Of Jammu And Kashmir & Ors on 1 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: the jammu and kashmir excise act, 1958, s. 20, applied for a fresh licence for another year. the appellant, who was carrying on business in liquor, was asked to shift premises as condition for issue of licence - validity of order under art. in appeal, the excise department received complaints from the inhabitants objecting to the location of the bar in that location.

tagline: Shiv Sharker Lal Gupta vs The Commissioner Of Income-Tax ... on 14 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: judgment 1 is a preliminary objection to the effect that this court has no jurisdiction to entertain this petition. judgment 1, 17, 000 / annum from the 9th july, 1966, till pay with interest thereon at 6 per cent per ment ; ( b ) to issue a writ in the nature of mandamus or any other appropriate writ, direction, or order under art.

tagline: N. Kt. Sivalingam Chettiar vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 27 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: the high court of judicature recorded an answer in the affirmative on the following questions. the appellate assistant commissioner modified the order and held that rs. 10, 000 deposited with ramnathan chettiar alone were taxable in the year of assessment 1947 - 48. an appellate tribunal cancelled the order of assessment.

tagline: L.M. Chhabda And Sons vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 21 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: the appellants were lessees of a cinema theatre called " prakash talkies " at gujarat, j. 1, obtained a decree for possession of the theatre and an order for mesne profits. in appeal, the claim of the landlord was settled by consent and the amount was reduced to rs. 2, 57, 963.

tagline: Bant Singh Gill vs Shanti Devi & Ors on 1 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: the appellant, relying on the provisions of the delhi rent control act, filed under s. 34 of the 1952 act claiming that suit had abated - application dismissed by trial court - appeal. on march 13, 1961 the delhi rental control act became applicable to the premises in question.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs Daulat Ram Khanna on 29 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: order v, r. 20 ( 1 ) of the code prescribes two alternative methods of service when summons - could not be served in the ordinary way. order should affixture on the notice board of the income - tax office - sufficiency of substituted service. order may be served as if summons were a summons under civil procedure code.

tagline: M/S. Haji Esmail Noor Mohammad & ... vs The Competent Officer, Lucknow & ... on 8 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: in 1949, a partnership firm carrying on business in calcutta had also a branch in kanpur. the firm raised objections under s. 8 of the aforesaid ordinance. in 1949 evacuee property act passed into force. it was succeeded on april 17, 1950, by the administration of evacuees property act.

tagline: Prem Nath & Ors vs State Of Rajasthan & Ors on 15 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: rajasthan higher judicial service rules, 1955, provided recruitment to the high court. but appointments were validated by article 233a introduced by the constitution ( twentieth amendment ) act, 1966. supreme court upholds validity of the rules and appointments made thereunder. but the appointments were not validated in the definition of a " district judge "

tagline: Hiralal Vallabhram vs Kastorbhai Lalbhai & Ors on 31 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: landlords of certain premises gave notice to their tenants terminating tenancy. they filed a suit for eviction under s. 28 of the bombay rents, hotel and lodging house rates control act, 1947. the court held that, in appeal, that there were no arrears of rent, and that he could not be held to be a sub - tenant.

tagline: Maneklal Chhotalal & Ors vs M. G. Makwana & Ors on 2 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: vaidyialingam, c. a. rao, was granted a public notice inviting objections and suggestions from owners of land. the state government sanctioned the scheme under s. 28 ( 2 1 ) and appointed a town planning officer. a draft town planning scheme was forwarded to the state's government.

tagline: Jagir Singh vs State Of Punjab on 21 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: the two appellants and four other accused acquitted - applicability. they were charged under s. 302 and 201 read with s. 149 i. p. c. high court altered the convictions to those under ss. 302. the appeal must be dismissed where six persons have taken part in the murder and it is not known who gave the fatal blow.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs Managing Trustee, Jalakhabai ... on 23 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: under a deed of trust dated april 4, 1936, certain properties described in schedules a, b, and c were settled by one jalakhabai for purposes mentioned therein, and trustees appointed hereunder as per provisions. the remaining half of one of these 3 parts should be utilised for effecting improvements to existing buildings.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs Keshavji Morarji And Anr. on 16 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: court of judicature at bombay answered the second question set out herein below in the negative, and declined to answer the first question. in the case, the commissioner of income - tax has appealed to this court. a trust by jaysinh in favour of his minor grand - children committed indirect transfers of assets to their respective children.

tagline: B.D. Bharucha,Bombay vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 21 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: appellant had advanced a sum of rs. 1, 00, 000 to film distributors. clause 3 of the agreement between the parties provided that the appellant was not entitled to interest but that he was to share with distributors their profit and loss. but the company's distributor would return to appellant all the moneys advanced with interest at 9 % per annum.

tagline: R.B. Seth Champalal Ram Swarup vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, East ... on 20 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: the assessment year in question is 1942 - 43 and the relevant accounting year is samvat year 1997 - 98. a sum of rs. 3, 25, 000 was due to the assessee from one shanthi lal, who carried on business as proprietor of m / s amolakchand mewaram.

tagline: Bhajan Singh Hardit Singh And Co., ... vs Karson Agency (India) And Ors. on 31 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: appeal under clause 10 of the letters patent originally came up for hearing. judges took the view that the case involved a question of limitation. the appellant, m / s. bhajan singh hardat singh and co. filed a suit no. 718 of 1954 in the court of shri munnilal jain.

tagline: Capital Multi-Purpose ... vs The State Of M.P. & Others on 30 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: madhya pradesh state road transport corporation publishing schemes for take - over of certain routes to be given in the scheme for validly originating proceedings. the scheme would fulfil four - fold purposes mentioned in s. 68 - d ( 2 ) of the constitution or only under s. 67 - d. the proposals were dismissed by a special secretary to the state government empowered under his 68 - c of the act.

tagline: Mangru Mahto & Ors vs Shri Thakur Taraknathji ... on 8 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: no suit filed for setting aside order - res judicata, to what extent of mortgage - suit. the lessees filed claim peti - tions objecting to the attachment under 0. 21 r. 63 c. p. c. but later, k filed a suit against the mortgagor and lessees for recovery of possession of the lands.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs H.H. Raja Of Bhor on 21 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: a hindu undivided family is entitled to exemption from taxation in respect of interest income from government securities held by it. the late raja of bhor held certain government securities and up to the assessment year 1953 - 54, he was assessed in the status of individual. the income - tax officer rejected the claim of the assessee on the ground that the securities were the properties of the hindu family of the present ruler and his brothers.

tagline: Madan Lal vs Sunderlal & Another on 9 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: an arbitration award in respect of certain disputes between the appellant and the respondents was filed in 1957. it was barred by limitation under art. 158 of the limitation act no. 9 of 1908. the application must be made within 30 days of the date of service of notice as provided in art.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax ... vs Amalgamated Development, Ltd on 23 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: the respondent company purchased the assets and liabilities of a firm, m & co. at the time the firm had sold plots for which part of the consideration money had been realized and for the balance mortgage bonds had been executed by the purchasers. the aim was to lay out roads, etc. and to complete certain development work on plots sold by firm - if expenditure on such development deductible expenditure.

tagline: Essen Private Ltd. vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 16 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: the appellant - company is a private company incorporated under the indian companies act. it carries on business as managing agents of several concerns. appellant company paid the bank rs. 81, 593 - 8 - 0 representing the total amount due by amer - hind manufacturers ltd.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, West ... vs Premji Bhimji on 9 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: the appellate tribunal drew up a statement of case under section 66 ( 2 ) of the indian income - tax act. the court then set out six matters on which evidence may be recorded by the tribunal. the high court directed that in arriving at its findings the tribunal will have liberty to take evidence that may be adduced by parties.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs Webbing And Belting Factory Ltd. on 28 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: appeal by the high court of punjab is directed against its judgment in income tax reference no. 18 of 1958. high court answered the question in the affirmative. the appeal is now before us. 4. 4 million people have been affected by the appeal. the case is now in doubt after the supreme court's ruling.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs Jwalaprasad Agarwala on 15 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: two questions were referred to the high court of judicature of assam and nagaland. jwalaprasad agarwala was a partner in the books of that firm in four equal parts and made a gift of rs. 74, 721 to each of his four minor sons in july, 1953.

tagline: Sital Parshad vs Kishorilal on 6 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: the appellant objected under s. 47 c. p. c., that as no final fee. had been prayed for and passed after the high court in appeal. appellants did not appeal against the preliminary fee. the appeal was allowed in respect of interest and costs.

tagline: Sindhi Lohana Chaithram vs The State Of Gujarat on 31 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: in 1955 the saurashtra government empowered specially certain assistant superintendents and deputy superintendents of police. the appellant's house was raided by a sub - inspector of police and on the basis of incriminating evidence. appellant and six others were charged under ss. 4 and 6 of the act.

tagline: R.B. Chaudhary Raghuraj Singh vs Murari Lal & Ors on 16 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: the appellant thereupon applied to the court which passed the decree, under s. 4 of the u. p. zamindar's debt reduction act, 1953, was passed. the court and high court on appeal dismissed appellant's application. if on that date the debt was secured, as per the definition of a secured debt in s. 2 ( m ) of the act.

tagline: Johrimal vs Director Of Consolidation Of ... on 28 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: tinder s. 20 of the east punjab holdings ( consolidation and prevention of fragmented ) act, 1948, provided owners of permanent ghers or enclosures would be permitted to retain them in their possession. appellant successfully challenged the respondent's order in a writ petition, which in appeal was reversed.

tagline: Prem Dulari vs Raj Kumari on 23 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: the first respondent filed a suit for possession of the house on the ground that she had a right of prior purchase under s. 15. the second respondent sold her house to the appellant. her house and the house in question had a common outer entrance within the meaning of that clause. shelat, j. m. rao, hidayatullah, m. bachawat and r. s. vaidyialingam sold her home.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax ... vs Moon Mills Ltd. on 17 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: the income - tax appellate tribunal, calcutta bench " a ", referred to as " the assessee " the sum of rs. 19, 81, 899 received in 1950 was the surplus of the compensation money over the written down value of the assets destroyed by fire in 1948. the amount of compensation was settled between the insurers and the assessed year 1950.

tagline: Roshan Di Hatti vs Commissionr Of Income-Tax, New ... on 29 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: till june, 1947, the assessee was carrying on business in jewellery at lahore. a credit entry of rs. 3, 33, 414 was made in the books of account of an assessee as capital of the business - rs. 2, 92, 340 being the value of gold ornaments, gold bullion and precious stones.

tagline: Shahdara (Delhi) Saharanpur ... vs The Municipal Board, Saharanpur on 21 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: the appellant company ran a narrow - gauge railway between shahdara and saharanpur. as it operated partly within the municipal area of saharanpur the municipal board of that place sought to subject railway stores and materials brought within the area to terminal tax as provided by the rules under the u. p. municipalities act 1 of 1918.

tagline: P.L. Lakhanpal vs The Union Of India And Another on 7 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: petitioner was arrested and detained by an order dated december 10, 1965. on december 2, 1966, he was held with another order under rule 30a. he was served with an order of the central government to review the detention order. the petitioner challenged these two orders on various grounds were dismissed.

tagline: Mohammad Khalid vs The Chief Commissioner, Delhi on 2 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: the chief commissioner of delhi issued the following notification under section 99 a of the code of criminal procedure ( hereinafter referred to as the code ) in urdu by mohammad khalid petitioner. petitioner claimed to be printer of the book'khilafat i meawia wa yazid'in urdu.

tagline: M.J. Kanakabai And Ors. vs Union Of India And Ors. on 31 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: shri a. n. padmanabha shenoi, father of two plaintiffs, was carrying on a joint hindu family business under the name of style of " a n. guna shenoi and bros. " in goa became part of the state of travancore - cochin. the government of india issued a notification giving certain terms to assessee if they disclosed their income.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs `Kharawalla Ltd. on 19 March, 1967
summarized_judgment: " the principles " - appointed tejaji farasram kharawalla sells agent for the district of gujarat. the commission was to include " all charges in connection with the upkeep of offices and godown, turnover rebates and contingency expenses " commission was modified by agreement dated august 29, 1935.

tagline: Abhinandan Jha & Ors vs Dinesh Mishra(With Connected ... on 17 April, 1967
summarized_judgment: vaidyialingam, c. a. hidayatullah, was sentenced to 20 years in prison for the offence. in the case, there was no case made out for sending up the accused for trial. if a magistrate can direct the police to file charge - sheet, they may. under s. 170 cr. p. c. if the police think there is sufficient evidence against the accused. in either case the police should submit a report of the action.

tagline: Rajasthan State Electricity ... vs Mohan Lal & Ors on 3 April, 1967
summarized_judgment: rajasthan state electricity board was directed to frame its own grades and service condi ( ions ) but this was never done. in 1960, the first respondent was taken on deputation from the board and posted to the p. w. d. of the state. in 1959, the state government directed the reversion of the first. respondent to his parent department, and posted him as one of its foremen.

tagline: Northern India Caterers Private ... vs State Of Punjab And Another on 4 April, 1967
summarized_judgment: india caterers private ltd., & anr, and anr. vs. respondent - state leased its premises to the appellant for running a hotel and when the lease expired called upon the. appellant to hand over vacant possession. act, 1959 requires the app to show cause why an order of eviction should not be passed under s. 5 - scope of. the constitution.

tagline: The East India Industries ... vs The Commissioner Of Income Tax, ... on 3 April, 1967
summarized_judgment: the assessee claimed exemption from tax under s. 14 - b of the incometax act, 1922. for a sum donated to a trust, whose most objects were charitable and religious in nature, but one was not, and it was open to trustees to utilise the income of any objects to the exclusion of all objects. the high court answered the question against the assessment year held that trust was a public trust.

tagline: Devi Das Gopal Krishnan & Ors vs State Of Punjab & Ors on 10 April, 1967
summarized_judgment: the east punjab general sales tax act, 1948, was amended by act 18 of 1952, with retrospective effect, fixing the rate of tax at " not exceeding two piece in a rupee " the section of the act, which was amended in 1998, passed on the government power to levy tax at such rates as the government might fix.

tagline: Jamatraj Kewalji Govani vs The State Of Maharashtra on 4 April, 1967
summarized_judgment: the appellants'shop was searched and a number of watches, clocks, etc. were seized. as he could not prove that the goods were smuggled. appellant was prosecuted on two counts under ss. 135 ( a ) and 13 5 ( b ) of the act, 1962.

tagline: T. N. K. Govindarajulu Chetty vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 17 April, 1967
summarized_judgment: the high court in appeal enhanced the compensation and awarded interest on it the revenue assessed to income - tax the amount of interest, which was upheld, in reference to a arbitration in determining the compensation payable to a person depraved of his property. the act was requisitioned under r. 75a of the defence of india act, 1939 and later acquired by the state.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs Gemini Cashew Sales Corporation, ... on 20 April, 1967
summarized_judgment: partnership of two partners dissolved on death of one of them in 1957. firm was taken over by surviving partner on his own account. but the firm was entitled to retrenchment compensation under s. 25ff of industrial disputes act, 1947. but appellate assistant commissioner confirmed his order.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs Rai Bahadur Hardutroy Motilal ... on 7 April, 1967
summarized_judgment: the income - tax officer noted that the assessee had withdrawn at calcutta on march 31, 1952. the transfer of the money from calcutta to forbesganj on the same day was considered a physical impossibility. the appellate assistant commissioner had power to enhance the income as he did but reduced the enhancement to rs. 1, 55, 000 to one of the creditors.

tagline: Satwant Singh Sawhney vs D. Ramarathnam, Assistant ... on 10 April, 1967
summarized_judgment: petitioner satwant singh sawhney vs. respondent's action infringed his fundamental rights under art. 32 of the constitution alleging that the respondent was not entitled to travel abroad or to a passport part of personal liberty within the meaning of art.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, West ... vs George Henderson And Co. Ltd. on 26 April, 1967
summarized_judgment: last year, the respondent purchased 1, 500 shares of bally jute company limited. in 1947, the respondingent transferred the shares to a giridhari lal mehta at the rate of rs. 136 per share. the income - tax officer held the order under the first proviso to section 12b of the income tax act.

tagline: Bhawani Cotton Mills Ltd vs State Of Punjab & Anr on 10 April, 1967
summarized_judgment: the definition of the word " purchase " was amended twice in 1959 and again by punjab act 19 of 1960. in 1959, a notification was issued in april 1958 regarding the rate. of tax on the purchase of goods " for use in the manufacture of good, % for -. is per the then definition of " purchase, " an item of which relates to cotton, and after the 1960 amendment the clause " for sale "

( 2 ) of the ruling.

summarized_judgment: madras state was taxed at 7 % on certain sales effected to registered dealers in the punjab on the ground that the dealers in punjab were not in accordance with r. 10 ( 1 ) of the central sales tax ( madras ) rules, 1957. for the year 1959 - 60 the firm taxed. at a rate of 7 %, state government does not have power under s. 13 ( 3 ) and s. 8 ( 4 ) ( 3 ( 1 / 1 ) ( d ) in this regard.

( 4 ) issued to see that there was a contented labour force during emergency. the government advised one of the respondents to pay the amount retrospectively from 1964. they challenged the validity of three notifications by writ petitions in the high court.

tagline: Rampyari Devi Saraogi vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, West ... on 1 May, 1967

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs R.R. Ramakrishna Pillai on 5 May, 1967
