summarized_judgment: under s. 87a ( 3 ) of the uttar pradesh municipalities act, 1916, when a notice of intention to. make a motion of non - confidence in the president of a municipal board is delivered by the requisite number of members of the municipal board. if the presiding judicial officer is unable to preside at the meeting, he may, after recording his reasons, adjourning the meeting to such a date and time.

( iv - a ) of s. 7 and neither cl. ( b ) of subs.

tagline: State Of Uttar Pradesh & Anr vs Sri C.S. Sharma on 1 May, 1967
summarized_judgment: state of uttar pradesh and anr. vs. respondent was a sales - tax officer under the uttar pradesh government. the state appealed. it was conceded on behalf of the state that the enquiry was under sub - ( 1 ) or r. 55 of the civil services ( classification control and appeal ) rules.

tagline: G. Ekambarappa & Ors vs Excess Profits Tax Officer, ... on 2 May, 1967
summarized_judgment: bellary district of bellary originally belonged to part'a'state of madras in british india. in 1960 the excess profits tax act, 1940 applied only to british india when bellary became part'b'state. the aforesaid excess profits act was to extend " to the whole of india, except the territories which immediately before november 1, 1956.

tagline: Secretary, Home (Endowments), ... vs Digyadarsam Rajindra Ram Dasjee on 3 May, 1967
summarized_judgment: vaidyialingam, c. a. hidayatullah, was trustee of math in accordance with procedure under certain agreements. in 1947, an agreement was agreed that c. d. was entitled to continue as mahant, and that after his death the respondent would succeed him. but the indian commissioner hindu religious and charitable endowments andhra pradesh had approved the succession.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, West ... vs Jalan Investment P. Ltd. on 4 May, 1967
summarized_judgment: a case under section 66 ( 2 ) of the indian income - tax act, 1922, hereinafter referred to as " the act " the only order of the high court appears on record is a formal order containing no reasons for dismissing the petition of the commissioner of income tax. the facts, in brief, are as as follows.

tagline: M.C. Rahbar And Anr. vs Union Of India And Ors. on 11 May, 1967
summarized_judgment: " time within which " do not find a place in clause ( 1 ) from this, it follows that legislature did not intend to give power to the rule making authority fix any time limit for petition under section 24. the clause does not have power to authority to fix the time limit.

tagline: Kirpaldass vs The State on 24 May, 1967
summarized_judgment: the appellants along with cue manglu were prosecuted for an offence under section 307, read with section 34 of the indian penal code. the prosecution case is that appellant was in terms of intimacy with the sister - in law of kanwarpal singh, p. w. 10. there is no doubt that the prosecution has satisfactorily established that gurdial or kirpal or both of them were responsible for injuries found on the person of the victim.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs A. Raman & Company on 18 July, 1967
summarized_judgment: india's income - tax act, 1961, was questioned by the high court in a petition for a writ under art. 226 of the constitution quashed notices under s. 147 of the indian income tax act. but the supreme court must not re - appraise evidence.

tagline: Madras Co-Operative Central Land ... vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 19 July, 1967
summarized_judgment: indian income - tax act, 1922, did not give to cooperative society any exemption from payment of tax in respect of income from its business activities. act was originally enacted in 1922, but cooperative society was not liable to pay tax. in 1956, an explanation, applicable to banking companies, was added to s. 8. clause.

tagline: M. M. Ipoh & Ors vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 26 July, 1967
summarized_judgment: the karta of a hindu family was assessed to incometax from year to year until 1953 - 54. but later, the income - tax officer issued notices to him under s. 34 ( 1 ) of the constitution. the appellate assistant commissioner and the tribunal, in appeals filed before them, confirmed order of the income tax officer.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs Tejaji Farasram Kharawalla Ltd on 19 July, 1967
summarized_judgment: the respondents were selling agents for the goods manufactured by another company. they were paid 7 - 1 / 2 % on sales as selling commission and 5 % as contingency expenses. high court in reference held that the " 5 % commission " received by the respondents represented a special allowance to meet expenditure.

tagline: Collector Of Customs & ... vs A. S. Bava on 27 July, 1967
summarized_judgment: in response to appeal against duty imposed on him under the excise act. the act requires an appellant to deposit, pending the appeal, and empowers the appellate authority, in his discretion to dispense with such deposit pending appeal. the appeals court was allowed, and the repellant was directed to hear the appeal on merits of appeal.

tagline: B.M. Lall (Dead) By L. Rs vs Dunlop Rubber & Co. Ltd. & Ors on 18 July, 1967
summarized_judgment: the respondent limited companies purchased certain premises in calcutta for the purpose of providing residential accommodation for their staff. they were reasonably required for the occupation of the respondents within the meaning of s. 13 ( 1 ) ( f ) of the west bengal premises tenancy act ( xii of 1956 ), 1956. the high court held that a limited company can be a landlord within the. meaning of its own occupation.

tagline: National Engineering Industries ... vs Hanuman on 25 July, 1967
summarized_judgment: the respondent was a workman in the appellant company. on the ground of over - staying his leave for more than eight days the company treated his services as having teen automatically terminated. supreme court will interfere with finding of fact by quasi - judicial tribunal only when they are perverse.

tagline: Dwarampudi Nagaratnamba vs Kunuku Ramayya & Anr on 19 July, 1967
summarized_judgment: v the karta of a joint hindu family transferred in 1946 certain properties, of the joint family to the appellant. v was competent to alienate for value his undivided interest in the coparcenary properties. v's widow and sons filed a suit against appellant for recovery of possession of the properties alleging the documents were executed without consideration or for immoral purposes.

tagline: C.T. Senthilnathan Chettiar vs State Of Madras on 20 July, 1967
summarized_judgment: the madras agricultural income - tax act, 1955, was hit by section 9 ( 1 ) of the act. the settlor puts the settled in possession of the properties set out in the schedule hereunder, without any powers of alienation whatever they want. the act is intended to be used as a tool to protect the land and the land.

tagline: Bhanji Bagawandas vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 18 July, 1967
summarized_judgment: the income - tax officer assessed the amount in 1948 - 49 in the capital, account of the appellant assessee whose accounting period was from november 13, 1947 to november 1, 1948. the appellate assistant commissioner held that the amount was not taxable in the assessment year 1949 - 50 - order whether to be considered in the light of amending, act of 1959 - 49.

tagline: Meattles Ltd. vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax on 13 July, 1967
summarized_judgment: shri b. d. meattle owns practically all the shares of shri meattle. he owns almost all of the shares, and the premiums are paid out of the funds of the company. the board of directors of the indian income - tax act, 1922, resolved as under issue.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax ... vs Hukamchand Mills Ltd. Indore on 21 July, 1967
summarized_judgment: indore sales in british india were made out in the name of'self'and endorsed to customers. india's indian income tax act was passed in the uk by the indian state of indore making sales in india. in the appeal to supreme court it was contended that on behalf of the appellant that on the basis of the case, it would be fair.

tagline: Zila Parishad Moradabad vs Nundan Sugar Mills, Amroha on 18 July, 1967
summarized_judgment: the district board of moradabad was notified under s. 108 ( 2 ) of the u. p. district boards act, 1922. in 1929, the board passed a resolution increasing the maximum limit of rs. 200 per year on the ground that no special resolution of the board had been passed nor a notification issued by the state. in 1932, the district. board passed another resolution in - creasing the maximum further.

tagline: Dabur (Dr. S. K. Burman) Private ... vs The Workmen on 26 July, 1967
summarized_judgment: government referred industrial dispute to labour court, patna, and later issued order by way of corrigendum substituting " ranchi " for " patna " but the high court rejected this contention, saying it was not competent to cancel or withdraw that reference was a mere correction of clerical error.

tagline: The Vith Income-Tax Officer, City ... vs K.Y. Pillaiah & Sons on 18 July, 1967
summarized_judgment: the income - tax officer determined the total income of the respondents for the assessment year 1949 - 50 and served a notice in that behalf in march 1951, on the respondents. the appellate assistant commissioner vacated the notice of march 1951 and remanded the case for further inquiry. the high court was in error, because the ruling was barred because of the expiry of the period of limitation.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs Gold Mohore Investment Co. Ltd. on 18 July, 1967
summarized_judgment: the relevant assessment year is 1950 - 51 and the corresponding previous year ended on march 31, 1950. the appellate assistant commissioner held that losses amounted to rs. 37, 500 from the debits in the share account by the respondent at nil. the appeal was brought from the judgment o the calcutta high court dated march 10, 1964.

tagline: Madras Co-Operative Central Land ... vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 18 July, 1967
summarized_judgment: interest paid on debentures, deposits and other accounts rs. 15, 09, 490. 00 ( vgt ) interest paid for debenture, deposits, other accounts. interest was paid on mementos, deposits or other accounts, rs. 1, 000 ( £80, 000 )

tagline: Sant Ram Sharma vs State Of Rajasthan & Anr on 7 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: the all india services act, 1951, empowers the - central government to make rules for recruitment and conditions of service of persons appointed to an all india service. in 1955, the petitioner was promoted as inspector general of police and respondent 4 was appointed as additional inspector general. a gradation list of all police officers in a state should be maintained to ascertain their seniority.

tagline: Roshan Lal Tandon vs Union Of India on 14 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: vacancies in grade'd'of train examinations filled by apprentice train examiners who had completed the prescribed period of training, and ( b ) promotion from grade d'to'c'was on the basis of seniority - cum - suitability - cum suitability. in 1965 the railway board issued a notification by which it was provided that eighty per cent of grade d d's grades were filled up from two sources.

tagline: State Of Mysore & Anr vs P. Narasing Rao on 31 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: states reorganisation act, 1956, s. 115 ( 7 ) - - respondent in single cadre of matriculate and non - matriculating tracers in old hyderabad state. state of mysore & anr. vs. respondent was given option either to remain in his old hyderabad scale of pay or to accept the new scale applicable to non - mats. he refused to exercise the option and claimed that tracers should not have been divided into two grades.

tagline: Chief Mining Engineer East India ... vs Rameswar And Ors on 8 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: workmen filed applications in 1962 claiming bonus under coal mines provident fund and bonus scheme act, 1948 and railway fares and leave wages from 1948 onwards. the labour court, dhanbad allowed their claims under s. 33c ( 2 ) of the industrial disputes act, 1947, in appeals to this court, the appellant - company challenged.

tagline: Commissioner Of Commercial Taxes ... vs Ramkishan Shrikishan Jhaver And ... on 9 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: the madras high court ruled on a proper construction of section 41 of the madras general sales tax act, no. 1 of 1959. it was contended that of various provisions in section 41 were capable of being construed as authorizing search and seizure of goods. the supreme court is expected to hold a hearing on the issue next month.

tagline: Central Bank Of India Ltd vs Karunamoy Banerjee on 18 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: vaidyialingam, c. a. hidayatullah, was an employee of the appellant bank. two more witnesses were then examined by the enquiry officer. both were examined before other witnesses and was unduly cross - examined. if the allegations are denied by the workman the burden of proving the truth of those allegations will be on the management.

tagline: K. L. Gupta & Ors vs The Bombay Municipal Corporation ... on 21 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: petitioners were owners of certain land in greater bom - bay in respect of which a declaration of intention under s. 4 ( 1 ) of the bombay municipal corporation. they applied for permission to change the existing user of their land and for a commencement certificate. but their application was rejected by the executive engineer, development plan. state government sanctioned final development plan for the ward in 1964.

tagline: The Commissioner Of Commercial ... vs R. S. Jhaver And Others Etc on 9 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: petitions filed in the high court under art. 226 of the constitution praying that the articles seized should be returned. petitioners challenged the department of commercial taxes and a others etc. the petition was challenged by the department's action by writ petitions seeking to rethink the law.

tagline: Shri A. C. Aggarwal ... vs Mst. Ram Kali, Etc on 16 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: section 18 provides for two classes of cases and the classification being reasonable is not violative of art. section 18 is a preventive measure, dealing with premises, and is intended to minimise the chance of a brothel being run near a public place. the magistrate must have recourse to s. 18, thus depriving parties of the benefit of a trial and appeal.

tagline: M. Gopala Krishna Naidu vs State Of Madhya Pradesh on 24 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: the appellant was an overseer in the public works department of the central provinces and berar government. in 1947 he was suspended from service and prosecuted under s. 161 i. p. c. ultimately, on orders from the high court, the. prosecution was dropped. in a departmental enquiry also was exonerated by an order dated december 1960.

tagline: Collector Of Varanasi vs Gauri Shankar Misra & Ors on 29 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: the government acquired 500 acres of land from the respondents under the defence of india act, 1939. a settlement was reached in respect of the compensation payable for the remaining land was referred to arbitration under s. 19 ( 1 ) ( f ) of the act. the high court was able to appeal against award of arbitrator - - whether high court persona designata - - or'court '

tagline: Syndicate Bank Ltd vs K. R. V. Bhat on 22 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: k. r. v. bhat date of judgment was dismissed by the central government. he filed a complaint alleging appellant contravened s. 33 of the industrial dispute act. the company was informed that he might appeal against the order to the working committee of the directors within certain days.

tagline: Ghatge & Patil Concern'S ... vs Ghatge & Patil (Transports) ... on 22 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: the respondent company carried on the business of transport and removal of goods by road. it owned a fleet of trucks and employed drivers and cleaners to run them. the workers'union raised a dispute asking for reinstatement of the ex - employees who had been given work on contract basis.

tagline: Management Of The Indian Overseas ... vs Their Workmen on 16 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: judgment hidayatullah, j. 1, was in receipt of rs. 15 - 00 per month which went under the name of " key allowance " the allowance was paid to other cashiers of the bank also. it was not included in the award given by mr. sastry but not a consequence of the award.

tagline: The Punjab State, Chandigarh vs Sansari Mal Puran Chand on 22 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: the respondents were dealers assessable to sales tax under the east punjab general sales tax act, 1948. they claimed exemption from tax on edible oil produced by them cal process. they were not liable to pay tax on sales of edible oils produced in ghanis run by mechanical power effected by them before 1956.

tagline: The Pabbojan Tea Co. Ltd., Etc vs The Deputy Commissioner, ... on 18 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: appellants denied liability stating that workers were not paid in accordance with the prescribed rate. appellant's claim was made by a judge who dismissed holding that under the minimum wage act. the appeals must be allowed determination of the jurisdiction of civil courts is excluded or not depends on the terms of the statute under construction.

tagline: Jagdish Pandey vs The Chancellor University Of ... on 17 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: the appellant was appointed as a lecturer in 1952 of a non - government college. both appointments were approved by the university of bihar, bhagalpur and ranchi ( amendment ) act 13 of 1962 came into force in april 1962, s. 4 of which provided that every appointment, dismissal, etc. of any teacher of a college not belonging to the state government affiliated to the university made.

tagline: Employers Of Firestone Tyre And ... vs Their Workmen on 22 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: driver hidayatullah, m. vaidyialingam, was entrusted with tyres for delivery at various addresses and he failed to account for two tyres. after investigation, a domestic enquiry was held and the minutes submitted to the driver to show cause why he should not be dismissed. the operator showed cause but manager ordered his dismissal.

tagline: State Of Madras vs A.Habibur Rehman Sons (With ... on 30 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: india's constitution, by art. 286, imposes four bans upon the legislative power of states to impose sales tax. clause ( b ) prohibited the imposition of tax on sales in the course of import into or export out of india. clause prohibits all state from imposing a tax on the sale of goods where such sale took place.

tagline: State Of Mysore vs S. R. Jayaram on 23 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: state of mysore vs. respondent jayaram date of judgment in india. india's government appoints him to another post - state government's power under r. 9 ( 2 ) of the karnataka recruitment of probationers'rules, 1959. the list of successful cardi - dates in order of merit is published.

summarized_judgment: clause ( d ) of sub - s. ( 2 ) of s. 8 fixed shares of relatives. clause would apply, mutatis mutandis, to a divided divided family. sub -s ( 3 ) would apply to a partition among other coparceners in a joint family. clause :'if there were both a mother and step - mother, all of them jointly, and the term'son '

tagline: Sunder Lal vs Paramsukhdas on 25 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: the appellant and his lessee filed a compromise petition before the civil judge dismissed the respondent's applications. the response was a'person interest'within the meaning of s. 3 ( b ) of the act, but the replyent withdrew lessee's share of the compensation amount in execution of his decree.

tagline: State Of Bihar & Ors vs Subodh Gopal Bose & Anr on 22 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: state of bihar & ors vs. respondent no. 1 acquired tenancy rights in five plots in the villages of biknaur and samahuta. claim based mainly on certain entries in custom - sheets prepared at the time of the cadastral survey in 1913 under s. 102 of the bihar tenancy act, 1885.

tagline: State Of Kerala vs Cochin Coal Co. Ltd., Cochin on 31 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: cochin general sales tax act, m. e. 1125, was inserted in the act to bring the act into line with art. 286 of the constitution as it stood, and imposed a ban on inter - state sales after march 31, 1951, unless parliament provided under art.

tagline: Jagdev Singh vs State Of Jammu And Kashmir on 14 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: petitioners detained under r. 30 ( 1 ) of the defence of india rules, 1962, under orders passed by the state government in march 1965. their detention was continued from time to time after review under s. 30a. but without observing rules of natural justice had to be complied with.

tagline: Smt. Kalawati vs Bisheshwar on 17 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: the u. p. zamindari abolition and land reforms act, 1951 was enforced from july 1, 1952. in 1959, k withdrew from the suit. k and the appellant filed a suit for respondent's eviction in 1959. the appeal must be allowed. the sale in favour of an appellant was valid and not void.

tagline: Electrical Manufacturing Co. Ltd vs D. D. Bhargava on 30 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: vaidyialingam, c. a. hidayatullah, m. bhargava, vishishtha citation,. c., filed complaint against the appellant under s. 5 read with s. 6 of the imports & exports act, 1947 before the magistrate first class delhi. appellant filed an application requesting the magistrate not to take cognizance of the case.

tagline: The Remington Rand Of India Ltd vs The Workmen on 11 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: section 17 ( 1 ) of the industrial disputes act, 1947, makes it obligatory on the appropriate government to publish the award within 30 days of its receipt. but, the provision in the section as to time, is merely directory and not mandatory. the award did not cease to be enforceable, so where the government received the award.

tagline: Municipal Council, Raichur vs Amar Chand Prasanna Etc on 1 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: the standing committee of raichur municipal council resolved to levy octroi with effect from april 1, 1966. on october 27, 1965, the resolution inviting objections from the public was published ; no objections were received. the resolution was read, heard and confirmed unanimously unanimously approved the resolution.

tagline: Dhara Singh vs District Judge, Meerut & Anr on 18 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: the appellant filed an election petition challenging the district judge's order was dismissed. the original respondent had a third preference recorded in his favour and a second preference in favour of another candidate who was eliminated at one stage. the new petition was challenged by a judge who dismissed it, saying the second respondent should have been declared elected.

tagline: Collector Of Akola & Ors vs Ramchandra & Ors on 30 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: the land owned by the respondents were requisitioned by the first appellant under the act for a public purpose viz. the supreme court accepted the objection and quashed the order. the words for any public purpose in s. 5 ( 1 ) are wide enough to include any purpose of whatsover nature.

tagline: Ravindra Nath vs Raghbir Singh & Anr on 4 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: by an election petition filed on may 10, 1966, the appellant challenged the election of the first respondent held on march 28, 1966. on october 7, 1966 the date fixed for the respondents to appear before the tribunal and answer the claims made in the election petition.

tagline: Treogi Nath vs The Indian Iron & Steel Co. Ltd on 3 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: workmen were entitled to half wages from a certain date to the date they resumed duty. they applied for determination of the amount due to them under s. 33c ( 2 ) of the act. but the high court dismissed the petition, saying the appeal must fail. the case is expected to be heard at the supreme court next month.

tagline: Gopi Kanta Sen vs Abdul Gaffur & Ors on 11 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: first respondent was not a thika tenant within the definition therefore of given in the act. in 1949 the original act was passed by the munsif in 1949. the high court remanded the case to the subordinate judge for trying the case in light of the amended act.

tagline: Village Panchayat Of Kanhan Pipri vs Standing Committee, Zila ... on 17 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: the appellant panchayats taxes and fees rules 1960, rr. 3 & 4 followed by collection of octroi limits under r. 21 by collector. the application was rejected as it was considered time - barred under r's. 124 ( 5 ) of the act to be filed within 60 days of the publication of the notice.

tagline: Anandram Jivraj Gagle vs Premraj Mukandas & Ors on 31 August, 1967
summarized_judgment: appellant filed an appeal against the appellant for redemption of a mortgage. appellant appealed that the court ought to have directed the commissioner to deduct the rent received towards principal and interest within six months. the appeal was dismissed and a second appeal in the high court failed.

tagline: Andhra Sugars Ltd. & Anr. Etc vs State Of Andhra Pradesh & Ors on 29 September, 1967
summarized_judgment: the petitioners were sugar factories in andhra pradesh. they filed writ petitions under art. 32 of the constitution of india. the state government had power by notification to tax purchases of canes for use, consumption or sale in a sugar factory. under s. 21 of the act the state had power to purchase canes from canegrowers in conformity with the directions of the cane commissioner.

tagline: Tribhuvandas Purshottamdas ... vs Ratilal Motilal Patel on 5 September, 1967
summarized_judgment: trustees sought to set aside the sale under 0. 21, r. 89 of the code of civil procedure. they deposited five per cent of the purchase money for payment to the auction purchaser and claimed that the mortgagee agreed to give them time for payment of the mortgage amount. the order of the high court should be set aside and that of the district court restored.

tagline: C. A. Rajendran vs Union Of India & Ors on 29 September, 1967
summarized_judgment: petitioner was a class iii employee of railway board secretariat service. he claimed promotion to the post of a section officer's section officer. but he was advised that there was no consti tutional compulsion to make reservations for scheduled tribes in class i and ii services. but there were no reservations at 12 - 1 / 2 % and 5 - 1 % of vacancies were provided.

tagline: Anandji Haridas & Co. (P.) Ltd vs S. P. Kushare, S. T. O. Nagpur & Ors on 28 September, 1967
summarized_judgment: india's bombay sales tax act passed in 1953. in 1953, s. 11a was added to the act. under s. 10 ( 1 ) of the provinces and berar sales tax acts,. r. 32 - 30 days notice for submitting explanation - notice giving shorter period - validity.

tagline: State Bank Of Bikaner & Jaipur vs R.L. Khandelwal on 6 September, 1967
summarized_judgment: judgment bhargava, j. khandelwal, was employed as a clerk by the bank of jaipur ltd. between 1953 and 1953. the award of the tribunal was published in the gazette of india dated 20th april, 1953. it is known as the sastry award, laid down the scales of pay for various classes of employees in the banks.

tagline: Management Of Bangalore Woollen, ... vs The Workmen & Anr on 18 September, 1967
summarized_judgment: vaidyialingam, c. a. hidayatullah, m. bhargava, vishishtha citation, was the workmen & anr. in 1955 the application of the appellant's establishment was approved under s. 19 ( 6 ) of the industrial disputes act. in 1961, the state government again referred to the industrial tribunal an industrial dispute between appellant and workmen.

tagline: Indian Steel & Wire Products Ltd vs State Of Madras on 11 September, 1967
summarized_judgment: indian steel & wire products ltd. and india's indian steel and wire products were not sold. the order, 1941, supplies effected on orders of steel controller whether'sales'were conclusive. the orders were in respect of goods not yet manufactured in the state of madras so as to become taxable.

tagline: Dr. Bool Chand vs The Chancellor, Kurukshetra ... on 4 September, 1967
summarized_judgment: the appellant filed a petition seeking a writ in the nature of mandamus to quash the order of may 8, 1966. appellant was compulsorily retired from the service for misconduct by an order of the president in february 1963. in the meantime the chancellor passed an order in exercise of the power under clause 4 ( vi )

tagline: Lakshmi Rattan Engineering Works ... vs Asstt. Commr. Sales Tax, Kanpur & ... on 12 September, 1967
summarized_judgment: an appeals court granted special leave to appeal without exhausting remedies of revision and reference provided in the act. the court granted a special leave of appeal to the assistant commissioner of sales - tax, but it was not accompanied by the challan showing the deposit of tax. an earlier version of this article stated that the u. p. sales tax act had been paid.

tagline: Sonawati & Ors vs Sri Ram & Anr on 21 September, 1967
summarized_judgment: the respondents purchased the land in dispute from the bhumidhars statute, but'p'claimed to be in possession of the land and a dispute was raised under s. 145 cr. p. c. land reforms act 1 of 1951. s. 20 ( b ) person recorded as occupant'in 1356 fasli to be adhivasi requirements of section.

tagline: Abdul Husein Tayabali & Ors vs State Of Gujarat & Ors on 20 September, 1967
summarized_judgment: the state of gujarat and ors was granted a notification under section 4 of the land acquisition act, 1894, on august 28, 1965. in supersession of that notification, the appellants challenged the notification by writ petitions but these were dismissed by the high court. in the appeal to this court, it was contended on behalf of the company requesting the government to acquire the appial's land.

tagline: Lt. Commander Pascal Fernandes vs The State Of Maharashtra & Others on 28 September, 1967
summarized_judgment: the clerk applied to the court praying that he should be made an approver and examined as a prosecution witness. the appellant filed a revision in the high court, but the prosecution said it had no objection to the grant of pardon to the clerk and that it even welcomed it. the judge, acting under s. 8 ( 2 ) of the criminal law amendment act, tendered a conditional pardon to him.

tagline: The Sindhu Resettlement ... vs The Industrial Tribunal Of ... on 13 September, 1967
summarized_judgment: appellant's subsidiary company was placed at the disposal of appellant - corporation. the company's services were terminated and he was paid retrenchment compensation. the appellant corporation claims the dispute was confined to compensation. but the state government had no jurisdiction to refer the dispute to the industrial tribunal.

tagline: S. Sanyal vs Gian Chand on 14 September, 1967
summarized_judgment: homeowner shah, j. c. sikri, m. shelat purchased the house and filed a suit for eviction of the appellant. but high court, in revision, held a decree in ejectment limited to that portion of the house. the order of the high court was without jurisdiction and should be set aside.

tagline: National Conduits (P) Ltd vs S. S. Arora on 1 September, 1967
summarized_judgment: petition under ss. 433 and 439 of the companies act, 1956 for compulsory winding up of a company. the court is bound forthwith to advertise the petition. if the petition is admitted, it must be advertised. petition is still open to the company to move the court in interest of justice or to prevent abuse of the process of court.

tagline: Kanti Lal Babulal vs H. C. Patel on 29 September, 1967
summarized_judgment: the appellants were directed to refund amounts collected by them from their purchasers in respect of these sales by way of tax, failing which the amount would be forfeited under s. 12a ( 4 ) of the bombay sales tax act was void being violative of art.

( 4 ) parliament imposes a prohibition upon every member of a. recognised association against entry into a contract on his own account.

tagline: Balwant Singh And Anr. vs L.C. Bharupal, Income-Tax ... on 27 November, 1967

[ 1967 ].

summarized_judgment: the first appellant was convicted under s. 324 ipc for shooting and injuring pw 1, at the instigation of the second appellant. the trial court and high court refused to examine the defence of the appellants on ground their version of the complaint by accused - if permissible.

tagline: P. S. L. Ramanathan Chettiar & Ors vs O. Rm. P. Rm. Ramanathan Chettiar on 4 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: request wag made for repayment in 1944 and a suit for recovery declared in 1946 for rs. 11, 459. the high court in appeal reversed the order of the sub - judge holding that money entrusted to plaintiffs'father being a deposit with a banker was not payable until there was a demand for it. high court ruled that the judgment - debtors had made no attempt in the trial or before appeal court.

tagline: Tukaram G.Gaokar vs R. N. Shukla & Ors on 8 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: in september 1966 customs authorities seized certain contraband gold under s. 120 b of the indian penal code read with s. 135 of the sea customs act. the appellant along with certain persons was charged before. the high court rejected these contentions, but granted a certificate to appeal.

tagline: State Of Andhra Pradesh & Anr vs P. Sagar on 27 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: by an order of the state government, andhra pradesh issued on july 29, 1966, 20 % of the total number of seats for admission to medical colleges in the state were reserved, for members of the backward classes described in a list prepared by the government. in an earlier case as being violative of art. 15 ( 4 ) of the constitution had been declared invalid by the high court. it was argued that the state had adopted the same list of backward classes with slight modifications.

tagline: State Of Kerala vs P. P. Hassan Koya on 19 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: court disapproved method adopted by land acqusition officer. land acquisition officer determined compensation payable to persons interested. case could not be departed from merely because the receiver in whom the jenmi rights we're vested failed to raise an objection to the quantum of compensation awarded to him.

tagline: G. Narayana Raju vs G. Chamaraju & Others on 19 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: hindu joint family - hotch potch - self acquisition when acquires characteristics of joint family property, concurrent finding that business is separate. supreme court will not interfere under hindu law that a business standing in the name of any joint family member is a joint family business even if that member is the manager of the joint family. but it must be established that there was a clear intention on the part of the coparcener to waive his separate property.

tagline: State Of Madhya Pradesh vs Ranojirao Shinde & Anr on 21 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: madhya pradesh abolished cash grants act, 1963 to abolish cash grants, but provided for the payment of certain compensation to the grantees - respondents challenged the vires of the act before the high court. in appeals by certificate, this court ruled that the act is either violative of 31 ( 2 ) or art.

tagline: Shah Dhansukhlal Chhaganlal vs Dalichand Virchand Shroff And ... on 1 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant was a tenant of the respondent. he was given a notice asking arrears of rent and permitted increases under the bombay rents hotel and lodging house rat - as control act, 1947. the high court dismissed his revision petition. he appealed to this court and urged that ( i ) he was entitled to the benefit of s. 12 ( 1 ) of the act and that ( ii ) even if s. 18 ( 3 ) ( 3 ( 1 ] was applied he was not liable to be eiected.

tagline: Gorantla Thataiah vs Thotakura Venkata Subbaiah & Ors on 19 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: the will was not executed in a sound disposing state of mind and was therefore not legally valid. v died when he was just 10 years old and lived along with his mother, in the - house of the first defendant who was his maternal uncle. v was in a normal condition on the date of the execution of the will and subsequent to that date.

tagline: Kollipara Sriramulu vs T. Aswathanarayana & Ors on 4 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: in 1940, the firm filed a suit to evict the first respondent from the leased land. appellant no. 1 was impleaded as a defendant. in 1950 the firm sued the firm for evicting the company and for accounts. but the high court decided in his favour. in appeal, the court decided against respondingent no 1.

tagline: T. K. Lakshmana Iyer & Ors vs State Of Madras & Ors on 26 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: inams were granted by hindu king for performance of services at temple. the inam grants included melwaram and kudiwaram rights. they filed another suit asking for a declaration that the aforesaid order passed by the collector was a nullity. the high court decided against the plaintiffs except as regards dasi inams.

tagline: S. N. Bose vs State Of Bihar on 26 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: hegde was an assistant medical officer in a railway hospital at gaya. he had certain privileges ordinarily available to gazetted officers he was only a non - gazetted class iii officer. he was convicted for offenses tinder s. 161 i. p. c. and's. 5 ( 2 ) read with s. 4 ( 1 ) of the act, which was granted by the chief medical officer of railway hospital.

tagline: State Of Kerala vs Cochin Chemical Refineries Ltd on 26 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: a mortgage deed was executed by the respondent company and one of its directors in favour of the state of kerala. it was provided inter alia by the terms of the deed that the state grants a loan of a sum of rs. 2. 5 lakhs to the company, which would supply to the state 3, 000 tons of ground -, nut cake within a specified period and make deliveries in accordance with instructions to be given by the state.

tagline: Tika Ram & Sons Ltd. Etc vs The Commissioner Of Sales Tax ... on 22 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: the commissioner of sales tax u. p. sales tax act was amended by act 8 of 1954, ss. 2 ( h ), explanation ii ( ii ) and 11 - scope of explanation - if ultra vires - when commissioner has right to ask for reference to high court jurisdiction of revising authority to refer and of high court to decide constitutional validity of provisions of act.

tagline: Motilal Jain vs State Of Bihar & Ors on 27 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: hegde was detained under s. 3 ( i ) and s. 4 of the preventive detention act for indulging in black - marketing of essential commodities. he was supplied with an order detailing a number of grounds in support of his detention. in one of the & rounds viz., cl. ( a ) of the order.

tagline: Ram Charan & Ors vs State Of U.P on 1 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: the statements of eye witnesses to a murder were recorded under s. 164, criminal procedure code. a certificate was appended to each of the statements to the effect. the statement did not follow from the endorsement that any threat was given to the witnesses or that it might be used against him.

tagline: Nagar Mahapalika Varanasi vs Durga Das Bhattacharya & Ors on 4 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: v, ix and ix - licence fees from rickshaws and rickshaw drivers - if in the nature of tax - on their licence fees were not commensurate with the services and advantages rendered or provided by the appellant. the high court, on appeal, dismissed the suit, saying that the fee charged was not for rendering any services but was in nature of a tax.

tagline: Bhupendra Singh vs The State Of Punjab on 5 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant lived with his father a in a house adjoining that of g. when g intervened, appellant's father raised a'lalkara'asking appellant to finish him off. in appeal, the high court dismissed the appeal and confirmed the sentence of death. high court rejected the defence and convicted appellant of g's murder.

tagline: Lakhan Lal And Others Etc vs The State Of Bihar And Others Etc on 26 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: bihar agricultural produce markets act, 1960, and bihar agricultural market rules, 1962, before issuing necessary notifications for regulating purchase and sale of certain items of agricultural produce and for establishing a market for them in the gaya area of the. state. under s. 18 ( ii ) of the act no person can do business as a trader - or other operator in the notified agricultural produce in a market except under a licence granted by the market committee on payment of the licence fees.

tagline: Raja Dhruv Dev Chand vs Harmohinder Singh & Anr on 1 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant obtained lease of land in punjab and carried on agricultural operations in it. the appellant was granted a lease on agreed terms. but the high court reversed the decision and said the lease failed. appellant's claim was decreed but high court overturned the decree. the court said that if any material part of the property is not destroyed or rendered substantially unfit, the lessee cannot use the land for purposes.

tagline: Godhra Borough Municipality vs Godhra Electricity Co. Ltd on 20 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: india's bombay municipal boroughs act, 1925,'s 73 rules 4 and 5'rate'leviable under s. 73 on lands and buildings to be taxed under r. 4 ( 1 ) on basis of capital value - english law relating to'rates'and'relevance of - contractors'method of evaluation recommended - data in company's balance sheet. indian law and practice as to levy of rates was not relevant in indian context.

tagline: Kirpal Singh Duggal vs Municipal Board, Ghaziabad on 26 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant collected toll while appellant's trucks passed through toll barrier. appellant applied to the municipality for refund within six months of payment. in appeal the civil judge decreed the claim only for the amount paid after december 13. the appellant then applied for refunds to the court. the judge and high court ruled that by the rules framed under the act, the court ruled it was a condition precedent.

tagline: Ayodhya Prasad Vajpai vs State Of U.P. & Anr on 13 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant was elected pramukh of a kshettra samiti and his term of office was co - terminus with that of the samiti. his writ was dismissed in high court challenging the notifications was dismissed. ayodhya prasad vajpai is seeking to take the case to the high court.

tagline: Niranjanlall Agarwalla vs Union Of India on 7 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant wrote a letter to chief commercial manager ( claims and refunds ) of the railway within six months from the date of delivery of goods for carriage as required by s. 77 of the act before amendment by act 39 of 1961, claim in value of goods short delivered. appellant's letter addressed to the chief commercial boss could not be treated as the notice required.

tagline: Nath Singh And Others vs The Board Of Revenue And Others on 21 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: in 1945 one r who was the thekadar of the proprietary rights of a village, sued the appellants and the respondents for their ejectment under section 171 of the u. p. tenancy act. the lekhpal removed the entries in favour of the respondents from the records for the year ending 1358 f on the ground that there was no sub - letting and the entries were not correct.

tagline: Ishwardas vs Maharashtra Revenue Tribunal & ... on 13 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: vaidyialingam, c. a. hidayatullah, m. bachawat, r. s. grover, was the managing trustee of a public charitable trust maintaining a dharamshala. he filed an application under the provisions of the bombay tenancy and agricultural lands act, xcix of 1958 before the naib district districtdar. the application was rejected by the high court.

tagline: Fort Gloster Industries Ltd vs Sethia Mercantile (P) Ltd on 19 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant and the respondent wore both members of the east india jute and hessian exchange ltd., * ad were bound by its rules - and regulations framed under s. 11 of the forward contracts ( regulation ) act 74 of 1952 for regulating and controlling forward contracts in the jute trade. brokers sent a sold note on behalf of the appellant.

tagline: Iman Ali & Anr vs State Of Assam on 28 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellants were convicted by the court of sessions for an offence punishable under s. 396 of the indian penal code. they were held to have shot dead two inmates of a house in which along with others they had gone to commit dacoity. the high court gave notice to both them to show cause why the sentence of death should not be enhanced to death.

tagline: United Commercial Bank Ltd vs Okara Grain Buyers Syndicate Ltd. ... on 4 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: the respondent a syndicate with its registered office in montgomery in undivided punjab, had deposited certain amount with the appellant - bank and obtained a fixed deposit receipt. no account was opened in the bank's books in the name of the district magistrate and under the conditions of deposit it was repayable on demand on due date.

tagline: Kishanchand Narsinghdas Bhatia vs State Transport Appellate ... on 28 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: order of the appellate authority was confirmed by the high court in a writ petition. state transport appellate authority renewed stage carriage permit in favour of appellant. the appellant was entitled to preference in the matter of renewal on facts established in the present case. it was contended that appellant acquired a 1966 - model bus which would have been equally serviceable.

tagline: Lajwanti vs Lal Chand And Ors on 22 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellants premises in east punjab factories ( control of dismantling ) act 1948, s. 3 - whether bars execution of delivery of possession. the premises was allowed. both parties appealed. appellate court took the view that the machinery and spare parts were lying practically in all rooms, and the locking of the factory would result in its closure.

tagline: Union Of India (Uoi) vs Ramesh Cotton Mills Ltd. on 21 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: appeal by certificate against the high court dated 11th october, 1978. the plaintiff's suit was dismissed by the trial court but on appeal. the appeal is without merit and is, accordingly, dismissed with costs. the court was fully justified in decreeing the plaintiff ’ s suit.

tagline: Mohd. Usman vs State Of Bihar on 12 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant, a manufacturer of fireworks, was convicted under s. 5 ( 3 ) of the indian explosives act as he had allowed minors to work in the manufacture of fireworks thus contravening r. 16 of the explosives rules. if there is a breach of a rule, it has to be ascertained in each case whether the rule relates to activities mentioned in el. ( a ) or el.

tagline: State Of Gujarat vs Chinubhai Gopaldas on 13 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: state of gujarat v. 66 and acquittal of person charged with offence under s. 66 ( b ) of the prohibition act. the state appealed, held the order of confiscation of remaining bottles. the order was not proved that the 1500 and odd other bottles con - tained intoxicants.

tagline: Chief Comnissioner, Delhi And Ors vs Chadha Motor Transport Co on 4 March, 1968
summarized_judgment: india's chief commissioner, delhi issued a writ under s. 68 ( 2 ) of the motor vehicles act, 1939. the respondent was engaged in the business of collecting, forwarding and distributing goods carried by public carriers in delhi. the act requires agents to take out licences before it can be made for the purpose of carrying into effect the provisions of the act.

tagline: Dhulabhai And Others vs The State Of Madhya Pradesh And ... on 5 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: madhya bharat sales tax act ( 30 of 1950 ) was imposed and collected from appellants. they filed suits, for refund of the tax on the ground that it was illegally collected from them being against the constitutional prohibition in art. in appeal, the high court declared the notices to be offensive to art.

tagline: Gopal, Krishnaji Ketkar vs Mahomed Haji Latif & Ors on 19 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant claimed that a plot of land belonged to him and not to the trust of his manager. the high court when the matter went before it held that the plot belonged to his trust. the appellant said the plot must be held to be the property of the trust. it is not a sound practice for those desiring to rely upon a certain state of affairs to withhold valuable documents.

tagline: State Of Madras vs N. K. Nataraja Mudaliar on 18 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: state of madras vs. respondent filed a petition under art. 226 of the constitution. india, arts. 301, 302, 303 and 303 are required to be exempt from state law of sales tax. india's education department says it's not aware of the state's interest.

tagline: Jang Bahadur Singh vs Baij Nath Tiwari on 26 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: the respondent moved the high court for holding the appellant guilty of contempt of court. the appeal must be allowed. an authority holding an inquiry in good faith in exercise of the powers vested in it by statutory eegulations is not permitted. if he obtains a stay order, a wilful violation of order would of course amount to contempt.

tagline: R.H. Bhutani vs Miss Mani J. Desai & Ors on 23 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant occupied an office cabin in bombay on leave and licence from respondent no. 1. in an application under s. 145 of the code of criminal procedure passed a preliminary order on june 20, 1966 recording his satisfaction that a dispute existed. the magistrate passed the order without calling for a police report, merely on the basis of the appellant's allegations.

tagline: Laxman Kalu Nikalje vs The State Of Maharashtra on 5 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant was convicted under s. 302 ipc and was punishable under the second part of s. 304 ipc as culpable homicide not amounting to murder. the case fell within the third part of the s. 299 ipc. the appellant and his wife's brother - the decreased - were quarrelling about the time of his wife ’ s going with him - when appellant whipped out a knife.

tagline: State Of Bihar, Etc vs Kapil Singh, Etc on 18 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: two miscreants rushed at her and another killed her in the house. she called out to the child but did not cry out of fear, and continued lying on her cot till dawn. her statement was recorded but she refused to disclose names of the culprits as her mother had forbidden her.

tagline: Boothalinga Agencies vs V. T. C. Poriaswami Nadar on 22 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant entered into a contract to sell certain goods to the respondent which he was importing under'actual users'licence terms. under the terms of the licence sale of the goods entailed only an administrative penalty, the sale could not be held to be prohibited by law.

tagline: P. V. Jagannath Rao & Ors vs State Of Orissa & Ors on 16 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellants were chief ministers and ministers of the respondent state. they filed writ petitions for setting aside the notification, but the high court dismissed them. the state government issued a notification to inquire into and report on the matters. but it was contended that an inquiry for mere collection of facts unrelated to any future course of action or legislative policy does not fall within the purview of s. 3 of the act.

tagline: Raj Kumar Mohan Singh & Ors vs Raj Kumar Pasupatinath Saran ... on 19 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: transfer of property act, s. 43, applies only when transfer is for consideration. in 1946 he executed a will under which his widow j was directed to adopt a son as soon as possible. the court of wards was to manage the estate tiff a male successor could take over the management.

tagline: Prem Raj vs D.L.F. Housing & Construction ... on 4 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: first respondent objected that appellant had claimed the agreement to be void and inoperative could not in the same suit pray for specific performance of the agreement. the trial court rejected the preliminary objection, but the high court said the suit must'fail so far as - the relief of specific performance was concerned '

tagline: Statesman (Private) Ltd vs H. R. Deb & Ors on 2 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: the first respondent held the office of sub - deputy collector and was vested with magisterial powers. in 1959 he was appointing the presiding officer of a labour court and he gave an award against the appellant. since 1940 he was appointed a presiding officer. the judicial officers protection act, is intended to protect civil judges alone but also magistrate.

tagline: Keshavlal Jethalal Shah vs Mohanlal Bhagwandas & Anr on 2 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: petition filed by the respondent in 1958 for a decree in ejectment, arrears of rent and permitted increases. in appeal under s. 29 of the bombay rents, hotel and lodging house rates control act 57 of 1947. the high court may, for the purpose of satisfying itself that a decision in appeal was according to law.

tagline: Sudhir Chandra Nawn vs Wealth-Tax Officer, Calcutta & ... on 23 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: the petitioner moved under art. 32 for a writ to quash an order of assessment and penalty and notices of demand for recovery of tax for the years 1959 - 60, 1960 - 61 and 1961 - 62 under the wealth tax act, 1957. it was contended that ( i ) wealth tax is chargeable only on the accretion of wealth during the financial year ; ( ii ) since the expression " net wealth " in s. 3 includes non - agricultural lands and buildings of an assessee and power to levy tax on land and buildings ; and ( iv ) s. 7 ( 1 ) of the act was ultra

tagline: Seth Loon Karan Sethiya vs Ivan E. John And Ors. on 25 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: judgment hegde, j. 1, is the state bank of jaipur to be hereinafter referred to as " the bank " other respondents are not interested in the decision in this appeal. the court in execution first appeal no. 26 of 1961 on its file. the appellant was indebted to the bank.

tagline: Bhalchandra Alias Bapu & Anr vs State Of Maharashtra on 11 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellants were convicted under ss. 304a and 337 i. p. c. in appeal to this court, appellant's claim that criminal liability could not be imposed upon them under the act of the explosion. the company was found at the scene of an explosion that took place in the factory where they were working.

tagline: Amrit Lal Goverdhan Lalan vs State Bank Of Travancore & Ors on 11 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant executed a letter of guarantee in favour of the bank guaranteeing the liability of the borrowers in respect of the account upto a limit rs. 100, 000 was found due to the bank from respondents 2 to 6. the bank filed a suit against them and appellant and the suit was declared.

tagline: Balammal & Ors. Etc vs State Of Madras & Ors.Etc on 23 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: madras city improvement trust act 16 of 1945 repealed and replaced by act 37 of 1950 - cl. 6 ( 2 ) of schedule deleting provision for statutory solatium in s. 23 of 1950 and under s. 16 of the acts were to be deemed to have been taken under the new act. the schedule of the 1950 act deleted and repealed and repealed by provisions of the act. section 73 of the schedule would not be payable to those whose land was acquired.

tagline: Bhanuprasad Hariprasad Dave ... vs The State Of Gujarat on 19 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: a postcard written by r to a lady requesting her to fetch r was made over to the second appellant. the first appellant was arrested and anthracene powder was found on his person. the appellants were tried tinder ss. 161 ind 165a ipc and ss. 5 ( 1. 2 ) and 5 ( 2 ) of the 2. 5.

tagline: Hydro (Engineers) Pvt. Ltd vs The Workmen on 30 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: the last of such awards fixed revised wage scales taking into consideration the cost of living index. the dispute was referred to the industrial tribunal and the tribunal passed an award. the tribunal reduced the existing qualifying period, of 10 years to 8 years in cases where a workman died, resigned or retired.

tagline: Chief Settlement Commissioner, ... vs Om Parkash & Ors, Etc on 5 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: the east punjab refugees ( registration of land claims ) act 12 of 1948, s. 2 ( d ) - definition of'displaced person'in para 2 ( f ) of notification issued under rules made under rules. on the partition of india, the land in pakistan originally owned by n and after his death by his sons had to be abandoned. the chief settlement commissioner relied on para. 17 of " tarlok singh's land resettlement manuals "

tagline: State Of Maharashtra Etc vs Madhavrao Damodar Patilchand ... on 10 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: the maharashtra state agricultural lands ( ceiling on holdings ) act, 1961, was passed for securing the distribution of land to subserve the common good by imposing a ceiling on the holding of agricultural land. in proceedings under the act, large areas of land held by the mills were declared surplus. the validity of the act was challenged on the following grounds.

tagline: Bashira vs State Of U.P on 19 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant was charged with the offence of murder under s. 302 ipc. the trial was held at the high court in the 1957 high court. it was contended that the appointment of counsel deprived appellant of adequate legal aid and that be would be deprived of his life in breach of his right under art.

tagline: Maganlal Chhotalal Desai vs Chandrakant Motilal on 22 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant was a tenant in the respondent's house on a contractual rent of rs. 125 per month. appellant filed a suit claiming possession on the ground of non - payment of rent and mesne profits. he filed a lawsuit claiming rent was not in arrear and should be treated as paid by adjustment or deduction.

tagline: Ramanlal Gulab Chand Shah Etc vs State Of Gujarat & Ors., Etc on 19 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: indian government may renounce management when it is satisfied that management of the land should not be taken over by the state. the state of gujarat and ors should be allowed to take over the land's management of any land on the ground that full and efficient use of land had not been made for purposes of agriculture for two consecutive years.

tagline: Jai Lal vs Delhi Administration on 30 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant was a railway employee and often lost his temper and had altercations with other clerks in the office. in october 1960 he was found to be suffering from a mental illness as he exhibited symptom of acute schizophrenia and showed disorder of thought, emotion and perception of external realities. on the morning of november 25, he returned home and was marked absent.

tagline: S. K. Ghosh And Anr vs Union Of India & Ors on 2 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: petitioners were promoted from the postal superintendents service class 1 to the time scale of class i service. petitioners challenged the two orders in a petition under art. 32 of the government's orders were not based on any rule or applicable principle. the government justified its orders on the grounds that the order of 30th january 1957 was not given effect to.

tagline: Raj Kumar vs Union Of India on 18 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant filed a writ petition in the'high court for quashing the orders of india's government and india. appellant wrote letters to india withdrawing his resignation and intimated acceptance to the state government. in the absence of any law or statutory rule governing the conditions of his service, to the contrary, may justify an assertion that the resignation had not been accepted.

tagline: Loonkaran Sethiya vs State Bank Of Jaipur & Ors on 25 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant was indebted to the respondent bank in favour of the bank. appellant's objections were over - ruled by the, executing court as well as high court. the appellant objected to the execution of a decree which he had obtained in his favour. he executed a power of attorney in favor of bank giving it authority to execute decree.

tagline: Jambu Rao Satappa Kocheri vs Neminath Appayya Hanammannaver on 10 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant agreed to sell to the respondent 41 acres of jirayat land in bangalore, but failed to execute a conveyance. appellant filed a suit for a decree for specific performance of the agreement and possession of the land. in appeal, the high court granted a decree of specific performance.

tagline: Bunna Prasad And Ors vs The State Of U.P. & Anr on 24 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: m. shelat, j. m. bhargava, was granted a stay of the proceedings on december 20, 1963. but he made an application supported by a document purporting to be an affidavit stating that the high court had admitted his writ and had stayed further proceedings before the court was set aside.

tagline: State Of Bihar & Anr vs Maharaja Pratap Singh Bahadur on 11 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: the state of bihar stopped payment of malikana allowance on the ground that it was a proprietary interest which had vested in the state. in 1958 the state stopped payment because it was an proprietary or intermediary interest. the application was made under s. 3 of act 1950 followed by a notification unders. india's president said the state's right to malikana was not intermediaries.

tagline: Ajaib Singh vs Joginder Singh on 30 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: joginder singh was acquitted of the charge under ss. 193, 195 and 120b ipc - filed by successor - in - office of magistrate - validity. police act ( 5 of 1860 ) s. 42 - appellants con - tended that prosecution for offences under ss'193 and 195. i. p. c. ; ( ii ) ;. ( 2 ) ; ; ;. the f. s. ;. f. c ;. and no other.

tagline: State Of Gujarat And Anr. Etc vs Mehboob Khan Usman Khan Etc on 11 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: vaidyialingam, c. a. hidayatullah, m. ( cj ) was the deputy commissioner of police, gujarat city served notices in the two appeals. each of the notices contained allegations, inter alia, to the effect that the respondents consumed eatables from places of public entertainment without payment.

tagline: Karnesh Kumar Singh & Ors vs The State Of Uttar Pradesh on 15 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: the ten appellants were convicted under ss. 302 and 201 both read with s. 149 of the i. p. c., mainly on the evidence of four eye - witnesses who were members of the family of the two murdered persons. the high court confirmed the convictions and sentences.

tagline: Govind Sahai vs The State Of U.P on 30 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: vaidyialingam, c. a. ramaswami, v. mitter, was a member of a political party. the second respondent moved the court for vacating the injunction, in which the second appellant filed an affidavit stating the expulsion of an, member who initiated a suit. the appellants were guilty of contempt of court.

tagline: P.V. Jagannath Rao And Ors. vs State Of Orissa And Ors. on 30 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: shri satyapriya mohanty minister is planning bd. 23 - year - old was the first minister to take charge of the country's education. he was the second minister of the year to be held in the same country. he is the youngest minister to be elected to the state of uttar pradesh.

tagline: Union Of India vs M/S. Khas Karanapura Colliery Ltd on 15 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: the respondent was a lessee of 1401 bighas of land and was carrying on mining operations on the land for winning coal. the appellant - government issued a writ under s. 4 ( 1 ) of the coal bearing areas act, 1957, giving. notice of the government's intention to prospect for coal in 1200 bighas.

tagline: Triloki Nath & Anr vs State Of Jammu & Kashmir & Ors on 23 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: petitioners filed a writ petition claiming that the respondent state discriminated against them in the matter of promo ( ion ) to the gazetted cadre of the education department on grounds of religion and place of residence - when protected by art. the expression'class'is not used as synonymous with'backward class'or'backward community '

tagline: Jotish Chandra Chaudhary vs The State Of Bihar on 26 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant, who had a large family, took over and carried on the family business. appellant filed an application for the addition of his three sons as parties and also. filed an affidavit, as required by the court, giving the respective dates of birth of his sons as june 9, 1954 instead of december 12, 1951.

tagline: Shiromani & Ors vs Hem Kumar & Ors on 4 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: indian law allows larger share of family property to eldest son - - outmoded custom loses legal force. appellant no. 2 accepted lesser share of the properties than was due to her and her son was executed as a result of coercion by respondent no. 1. the trial court decided against appellants who by special leave came to court.

tagline: Dhanki Mahajan vs Rana Chandubha Wakhatsing & Ors on 11 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: a usufructury mortgage of their land in favour of the appellant and certain others was liable for the entire debt due under the mortgage. the debt adjustment board and appellate court held that the respondents were not'debtors'under s. 2 ( 6 ) ( i ) of the act as their total liability ex - ceeded rs. 25, 000 and therefore they were not entitled to the benefit claimed.

tagline: State Of Gujarat Etc vs Vakhtsinghji Sursinghji Vaghela ... on 8 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: vakhtsinghji sursinghji vaghela & ors filed claims before the high court. india's state of gujarat appeals to a high court's power to interfere with tribunal's order and to give directions. the court had also expressed concerns about river beds, tanks and wells and wells.

tagline: Sheonath Prasad & Ors vs State Of Bihar on 30 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: the first appellant's premises were raided by the superintendent of commercial taxes in purported exercise of his powers under s. 17 of the bihar sales tax act, 1947. the appellants were convicted and sentenced to two years'r. i. for it. high court found that the searches, search and seizure were illegal ; the search was made in the course of an investigation.

tagline: K. M. Kanavi vs The State Of Mysore on 18 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: india's bombay municipal boroughs act, 1925, makes it an offence if a retiring president is issued to hand over charge of his office. the state of karnataka acts, which means it can't be exhaustive of authorities who could make directions for initiation of such proceedings. supreme court dismisses revised application against the order of conviction.

tagline: Baidyanath Prasad Srivastava vs State Of Bihar on 30 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: judgment c. a. vaidialingam, j. 1. on behalf of the sixth - accused appellant herein. the appellant was a mukhtear, practising at sitamarhi. there were certain formalities, to be gone through, in the matter of obtaining the loans, under that act.

tagline: Bulchand Chandiram Of Bombay vs Bank Of India Ltd., Fort, Bombay on 19 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant was a citizen of pakistan and had come to india on june 6, 1950 on a temporary permit. in 1947 he was granted a domicile certificate and since then he continued to reside in bombay. the appellant took another loan of rs. 1, 25, 000 from the hyderabad bank on security of his property and personal security of himself and his wife.

tagline: Mahesh Bhagat vs Ram Baran Mahto & Ors on 11 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: a thika patta b was a mortgage and not a usufructory mortgage. b settled plots in the village with the predecessors - interest of the defendants. the second settlement was for 5 years from 1352 to 1356 fasli. b could not execute a lease in favour of any tenant for any term extending beyond the term of tenure.

tagline: Municipal Committee, Khurari vs Dhannalal Sethi & Ors on 30 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant committee refused to pay the refund mainly on the ground that the respondents had failed to produce receipts of duty paid on the foodgrains. the first and second respondents exported the identical goods out of the - municipal area and there - upon applied for refund of octroi duty.

tagline: Baidya Nath Prasad Srivastava vs State Of Bihar on 30 April, 1968
summarized_judgment: vaidyialingam was a mukhtear practising in bihar. he along with others had the identity of certain persons on loans under the agriculturists loan act, 1884. the appellant's plea was that he had made the attestation on the assurance of one r. the sessions judge acquitted all the accused.

tagline: Ishwar Singh Bindra & Ors vs The State Of U.P on 2 May, 1968
summarized_judgment: the inspector of drugs, agra region, filed a complaint in 1963. they filed a petition under s. 561a of the criminal procedure code in 1964. but the label showed constituents to be three drugs found in pharmacopoeias prescribed under the act, 1940. as the drug fell within the mischief of s. 17 ( e ) of the act. it must be deemed to be misbranded.

tagline: Laxman Balkrishna Joshi vs Trimbak Bapu Godbole And Anr on 2 May, 1968
summarized_judgment: the first respondent filed a suit against the appellant for damages for negligence towards his patient. the patient's condition deteriorated and at 9 p. m. be died at the hospital in poona 200 miles away, in a taxi after a journey of 11 hours. the first patient was given some treatment in the operation theatre and the patient was taken to the hospital.

tagline: Kalinga Tubes Ltd vs Their Workmen on 3 May, 1968
summarized_judgment: the workers'union was present during all that time but never made any effort to persuade the assembled workmen to leave the premises. a letter was written to the chief inspector of factories declaring a closure of the factory. the staff were not allowed to leave and no ingress or egress was allowed even refreshments.

tagline: Dr. Devendra M. Surti vs State Of Gujarat on 2 May, 1968
summarized_judgment: india's act, 79 of 1948, s. 2 ( 4 ) rule, 23 ( 1 ) - doctor's dispensary was prosecuted for non - maintenance of a register of employees under r. 23. section 2 has used words of very wide import and'grammatically'it may even include consulting room where a doctor examines patients with the help of a solitary nurse or attendant.

tagline: S. Rajagopal vs C. M. Armugam & Ors on 3 May, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant filed his nomination papers at the 1967 general election. he defeated respondent no. 1 who thereupon filed an election petition under s. 81 of the representation of the people act 1951. the high court held on the facts that the appellant had become a christian in 1949.

tagline: Hadibandhu Das vs District Magistrate, Cuttack & ... on 2 May, 1968
summarized_judgment: district magistrate, cuttack, served an order made in exercise of power under s. 3 ( 1 ) of the preventive detention act, 1950 directing appellant be detained on various grounds. on january 28, 1968 the state of orissa revoked the order and issued a fresh order of detention on the grounds inter alia.

tagline: Ishwarlal Girdharlal Parekh vs State Of Maharashtra And Ors on 1 May, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant was tried for the offence of entering into a conspiracy to cheat the income - tax - authorities in respect of the income tax assessment of a firm. appellant came to this court by special judge and high court rejected these contentions. the appellant said :'if the necessary allegations are established, the defendant must have a money value or market value in the hands of the person cheated '

tagline: Shiv Raj Singh vs Delhi Administration on 1 May, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant accused the uncle and aunt of having disposed of an illegitimate child and demanded a bribe. he was prosecuted and convicted for offences under s. 5 ( 2 ) of the prevention of corruption act and s. c. the high court sentenced him to 2 years r. i. in appeal.

tagline: Harcharan Singh vs Mohinder Singh & Ors on 1 May, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant filed his nomination paper for a seat to the lok sabha of a constituency different from the one in which his name was included as a voter. the application for a certified extract on the reverse of which was recorded a certificate, containing relevant entries from the voters'list. but under s. 36 ( 4 ) appellant is enjoined not to reject the nomination paper unless defect substantial to reject nomination.

tagline: Amrit Lal Ambalal Patel vs Himatbhai Gomanbhai Patel & ... on 3 May, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant was the successful candidate in the 1967 state legislative assembly elections. the election of the appellant's nomination paper was liable to be rejected under s. 36 ( 2 ) of the act. in appeal to this court, the high court set aside the election on the ground that appellant had not qualified to fill the seat as he was less than 25 years of age.

tagline: Ashiq Miyan And Ors vs State Of Madhya Pradesh on 1 May, 1968
summarized_judgment: vaidyialingam, c. a. ramaswami and ors. were convicted under s. 120b i. p. and s. 9 ( a ) of the opium act. appellants'plea that they were living separately and that one a had thrown the bundle, was rejected by the courts below.

tagline: State Of Punjab And Ors vs Bhai Ardaman Singh & Ors. Etc on 3 May, 1968
summarized_judgment: certain tenants of land applied to the collector, sangrur and bhatinda. they sought an order for restoration of possession under s. 43 of the pepsu tenancy and agricultural act 8 of 1953. the commissioner confirmed the orders on the ground that substantial justice had been done by the subordinate revenue authorities.

tagline: Govardhan Dass & 8 Ors vs Smt. Sitabai on 3 May, 1968
summarized_judgment: central provinces tenancy act, 1883 - mortgage or'sir'lands, were acquired by the mortgagee in 1898. the appellants were not entitled to claim possession of her rights in the land, which was allowed to remain with the mortgagors. in 1940 one of the owners of respondent was declared insolvent and his share in the property mortgaged purchased by mortgagee. in - pursuance of the decree, mortgagee purchased the share of's'including his rights in ‘ sir ’ land.

tagline: Orient Paper Mills Ltd vs Union Of India on 3 May, 1968
summarized_judgment: the finance act of 1961 raised the, excise duty payable under item 17 ( 4 ) of the first schedule to the central excises and salt act, 1944. an appeal to the collector and a revision were rejected on the ground that the collector rejected the claim. appeals must therefore be allowed and orders of the central government as well as the collector.

tagline: Ishwar Singh Bindra & Ors vs The State Of U.P on 2 May, 1968
summarized_judgment: the inspector of drugs, agra region, filed a complaint in 1963. they filed a petition under s. 561a of the criminal procedure code in 1964. but the label showed constituents to be three drugs found in pharmacopoeias prescribed under the act, 1940. as the drug fell within the mischief of s. 17 ( e ) of the act. it must be deemed to be misbranded.

tagline: Laxman Balkrishna Joshi vs Trimbak Bapu Godbole And Anr on 2 May, 1968
summarized_judgment: the first respondent filed a suit against the appellant for damages for negligence towards his patient. the patient's condition deteriorated and at 9 p. m. be died at the hospital in poona 200 miles away, in a taxi after a journey of 11 hours. the first patient was given some treatment in the operation theatre and the patient was taken to the hospital.

tagline: Kalinga Tubes Ltd vs Their Workmen on 3 May, 1968
summarized_judgment: the workers'union was present during all that time but never made any effort to persuade the assembled workmen to leave the premises. a letter was written to the chief inspector of factories declaring a closure of the factory. the staff were not allowed to leave and no ingress or egress was allowed even refreshments.

tagline: Dr. Devendra M. Surti vs State Of Gujarat on 2 May, 1968
summarized_judgment: india's act, 79 of 1948, s. 2 ( 4 ) rule, 23 ( 1 ) - doctor's dispensary was prosecuted for non - maintenance of a register of employees under r. 23. section 2 has used words of very wide import and'grammatically'it may even include consulting room where a doctor examines patients with the help of a solitary nurse or attendant.

tagline: S. Rajagopal vs C. M. Armugam & Ors on 3 May, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant filed his nomination papers at the 1967 general election. he defeated respondent no. 1 who thereupon filed an election petition under s. 81 of the representation of the people act 1951. the high court held on the facts that the appellant had become a christian in 1949.

tagline: Hadibandhu Das vs District Magistrate, Cuttack & ... on 2 May, 1968
summarized_judgment: district magistrate, cuttack, served an order made in exercise of power under s. 3 ( 1 ) of the preventive detention act, 1950 directing appellant be detained on various grounds. on january 28, 1968 the state of orissa revoked the order and issued a fresh order of detention on the grounds inter alia.

tagline: Ishwarlal Girdharlal Parekh vs State Of Maharashtra And Ors on 1 May, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant was tried for the offence of entering into a conspiracy to cheat the income - tax - authorities in respect of the income tax assessment of a firm. appellant came to this court by special judge and high court rejected these contentions. the appellant said :'if the necessary allegations are established, the defendant must have a money value or market value in the hands of the person cheated '

tagline: Shiv Raj Singh vs Delhi Administration on 1 May, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant accused the uncle and aunt of having disposed of an illegitimate child and demanded a bribe. he was prosecuted and convicted for offences under s. 5 ( 2 ) of the prevention of corruption act and s. c. the high court sentenced him to 2 years r. i. in appeal.

tagline: Harcharan Singh vs Mohinder Singh & Ors on 1 May, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant filed his nomination paper for a seat to the lok sabha of a constituency different from the one in which his name was included as a voter. the application for a certified extract on the reverse of which was recorded a certificate, containing relevant entries from the voters'list. but under s. 36 ( 4 ) appellant is enjoined not to reject the nomination paper unless defect substantial to reject nomination.

tagline: Amrit Lal Ambalal Patel vs Himatbhai Gomanbhai Patel & ... on 3 May, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant was the successful candidate in the 1967 state legislative assembly elections. the election of the appellant's nomination paper was liable to be rejected under s. 36 ( 2 ) of the act. in appeal to this court, the high court set aside the election on the ground that appellant had not qualified to fill the seat as he was less than 25 years of age.

tagline: Suresh Koshy George vs The University Of Kerala & Ors on 15 July, 1968
