summarized_judgment: kerala university act, 1957, is framed by syndicate delegating power to vice - chancellor to hold inquiries on malpractices during examinations - rules not followed - if inquiry invalidated. appellant challenged the order by a writ petition under article 226 contending that the rules framed by the syndicate. the impugned order was invalid inasmuch.

tagline: Sanghi Jeevaraj Ghewar Chand & Ors vs Secretary, Madras Chillies, ... on 16 July, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellants were entitled to claim bonus dehors the act through industrial adjudication under the industrial disputes act, 1947, or other corresponding laws. the court is justified in looking into the history of the legislation and the statement of objects and reasons when it is not for the purpose of construing the act.

tagline: Hiralal Agrawal, Etc vs Rampadarath Singh & Ors., Etc on 15 July, 1968
summarized_judgment: the owner of a certain land executed a sale deed on 9th october 1964 conveying the land to the first respondent and the sale deed was tendered. on 26th november, he annexed to his application the seller's application the certified copy of sale deed. on the same day, the seller ordered possession to be given to the appellant under s. 16 ( 3 ) ( ii ) and r. 19 of the bihar land reforms.

tagline: State Of Punjab vs Sat Pal Dang & Ors on 30 July, 1968
summarized_judgment: the punjab legislative assembly was in session but it was put in a state of inaction by the adjournment. the order of the governor was caused to be printed in the state gazette the same day by the chief secretary under the business rules. the governor, therefore on 11th march prorogued the assembly under art.

tagline: Chaturbhuj. Panda & Ors vs The Collector, Raigarh on 23 July, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellants were dissatisfied with the amount, so it was referred to the district court, which enhanced it. justice - looking into documents not part of record, and without giving opportunity to the other parties to rebut the conclusions reached on the basis of documents. the high court was wrong in disallowing the 15 % allowance permitted by s. 23 ( 2 ) and directed the parties to bear their own costs.

tagline: Debabrata Bandopadhyay vs The State Of West Bengal & Anr on 2 July, 1968
summarized_judgment: hidayatullah, m. ( cj ) was convicted for a contravention of the fertiliser control order read with s. 7 ( 1 ) of the essential commodities act. the magistrate recommended its acceptance of bond in such form and by such authority whether constituted contempt of court of sessions.

tagline: Ram Kisto Mandal And Anr vs Dhankisto Mandal on 15 July, 1968
summarized_judgment: her husband's reversioners filed a suit challenging this exchange as well as certain other transfers. high court gave two reasons for not allowing the plea to be raised for the first time before it. the high court held that the, aforesaid exchange of land was a valid transaction and that the defendants could have shown if the exchange was invalid.

tagline: Amalgamated Electricity Co vs Municipal Committee, Ajmer on 25 July, 1968
summarized_judgment: ajmer electric supply co. applied under s. 3 of india's bombay act, to the chief commissioner, for imposing the surcharge. act, 1946, was extended to ajmer metwar commissioner to issue notifications levying. ajme'r electric supply company was formed under the indian electricity act, but the court set aside the decree.

tagline: Konappa Rudrappa Nadgouda vs Vishwanath Reddy & Anr on 18 July, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant challenged his election by a petition on the ground that he was a partner in a firm which had two contracts with the state government. he was disqualified from being a candidate under s. 9a of the representation of the people act, 1951 and his election was void. appellant claimed he was entitled to be elected as votes cast in favour of the first respondent must be regarded as thrown away.

tagline: Raghunath Dass vs Union Of India And Anr on 26 July, 1968
summarized_judgment: notice under s. 80 was signed by raghunath dass mulkhraj. the appellant was the sole proprietor of a business carried on by him under the name and style of m / s. he had clearly indicated that he'signed it as the proprietor of the business. but the high court wrongly held that the notice was invalid.

tagline: Krishna Ballabh Sahay And Ors vs Commission Of Enquiry & Ors on 18 July, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellants unsuccessfully filed a writ petition in the high court. appellant's application was made after 5 years of his entering upon his arrival. the app was issued by the governor after five years of entering upon the office of the congress ministry. the governor is to continue to hold office'despite the expiration of his term '

tagline: Narbada Prasad vs Chhaganlal And Ors. on 30 July, 1968
summarized_judgment: judgment hidayatullah, c. j. 1. the appellant received 9622 votes as against the second respondent who obtained 8030 votes. the election petition was based on two broad facts on which the judgment of the high court has been rested. the case was not accepted, but accepted by the returning officer.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs Gurunath V. Dhakappa on 23 July, 1968
summarized_judgment: a deed dated august 26, 1957, thirteen persons agreed to carry on business in partnership. g. v. dhakappa was appointed manager of partnership on a remuneration of rs. 500 per monsoon. the firm was registered and the total share of profits allocated to the firm. the high court recorded on this question the answer the answer.

tagline: Bibi Aisha & Ors vs Bihar Subai Sunni Majlis Avaqaf & ... on 24 July, 1968
summarized_judgment: 3rd respondent had produced the original deed along with the return filed by him before the waqf board. the case fell under s. 65 ( a ) of the evidence act and so the copy was admissible in evidence to show the properties in dispute were waqfs act, 1948.

tagline: State Of Gujarat vs Acharya Shri Devendraprasadji on 26 July, 1968
summarized_judgment: india's acharya shri devendraprasadji was acquitted by the high court. he was convicted by the magistrate under ss. 37 and 67 of the act. the charity commissioner can, under s. 69, call for a " statement " from a trustee of a public trust.

tagline: Abdul Rahiman Khan vs Sadasiva Tripathi on 15 July, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant's tenders to carry out certain contracts with the state of orissa were accepted but final contracts were not executed on behalf of the governor. appellant filed an election petition for setting, aside the election of the respondent on the ground that the appellants nomination paper was improperly rejected.

tagline: P.C.K. Muthiah Chettiar & Ors vs V.E.S. Shanmugham Chettiar & Anr on 26 July, 1968
summarized_judgment: c was owner of five original shares in a rubber estate in goa after his death in 1912. the appellant and the first respondent transferred his remaining 21 / 2 shares to the defendant on receipt of 18, 000 dollars as consideration. the high court rejected a claim that he was entitled to all the original five shares and for accounts.

tagline: Nirshi Dhobin & Ors vs Dr. Sudhir Kumar Mukherji And Ors on 30 July, 1968
summarized_judgment: rajasthan tenancy act and transfer of property act s. 117 - - lease of agricultural land including homestead - - was invalid under the provisions of the latter act. supreme court ruled that the high court was justified in leaving the view. high court in further appeal left the view taken in earlier cases.

tagline: Umrao Singh vs Darbara Singh & Ors on 25 July, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant was defeated by the first respondent in the general election of 1967 to the punjab lok sabha. the appellant challenged the election on the ground that he was disqualified from being chosen as a member of the assembly because he was holding an office of profit under the state government.

tagline: Konappa Rudrappa Nadgouda vs Vishwanath Reddy And Anr. on 19 July, 1968
summarized_judgment: judgment m. hidayatullah, c. j. 1, was the election petitioner. the election was held in february 1967, during the last general elections. there were seven candidates who withdrew leaving the seat to be contested by the appellant and the first respondent hereafter.

tagline: Narbada Prasad vs Chhagan Lal And Ors on 30 July, 1968
summarized_judgment: the election of the appellant to the madhya pradesh legislative assembly from khategaon constituency challenged on two grounds. the candidate whose nomination paper was rejected was not registered as a voter in the electoral roll of that constituency but to a different constituency. the trial judge of the high court allowed the petition on both the grounds.

tagline: Standard Motor Union Pvt. Ltd vs State Of Kerala & Ors on 30 July, 1968
summarized_judgment: state of kerala and ors approved scheme in form ii for nationalization of certain routes after complying with the provisions of ss. 68c and 68d of the motor vehicles act, 1939. the appellant challenged validity of the scheme on the grounds that scheme was a complete exclusion scheme and should have been in form i.

tagline: Sham Sunder vs Union Of India & Ors on 15 July, 1968
summarized_judgment: the general manager of northern railway published a writ petition in a court. the petition was published after considering 152 persons, i. e., four times the number - of existing and anticipated vacancies plus 25 % for unforeseen vacancy. the panel of 38 enquiry - cum - reservation clerks for selection to the posts of reservation supervisors. it was ordered to be operated only in respect of the first 24 persons and the names of the remaining persons.

tagline: Kuchwar Lime And Stone Co vs M/S. Dehri Rohtas Light Railway ... on 15 July, 1968
summarized_judgment: a quantity of coal was booked by a colliery to the appellant company carriage to banjari station on the respondent railway's line and the freight on the consignment was to be paid. but the company declined to take delivery of a part of the consegnment which reached bannedjari on november 12, 1954. it filed a suit against the company claiming demurrage for 202 days.

tagline: Jeewanlal (1929) Ltd. vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, West ... on 25 July, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant - company started negotiations with a bank for securing overdraft facilities for the purpose of its business and in that connection had to incur an expenditure of rs. 35, 800. the amount so spent was claimed by the appellant company as a permissible deduction in proceedings for assessment of income - tax for 1952 - 53.

tagline: Kumar Shri Digvijaysinghji ... vs Manji Savda And Ors. on 23 July, 1968
summarized_judgment: on february 17, 1948 the grant was recorded in the " hak patrak " of the virpur state. the land in kharedi are the subject - matter of dispute in this litigation. the grant is accepted subject to the liability of the grantee ( a ) to see that no cultivator shall be evicted from the land.

tagline: Gaya Rai vs State Of Bihar on 28 July, 1968
summarized_judgment: three appeals nos. 117 of 1969, 129 of 1968 and 208 of 1968 by the accused were tried in sessions trial no 143 of 1965 by the sessions judge of shahabad. the government appeal no. 59 of 1967 before the high court was accepted against them as rajkumar rai and deodhari rai. they along with several others were acquitted in the session trial.

tagline: Kumar Shree Digbijaysinhji vs Nanjisavdas & Ors on 23 July, 1968
summarized_judgment: india granted certain agricultural lands for self - cultivation after eviction of tenants. in 1947 the government of india declared the appellant to be a girasdar for purposes of the act subject to the provisions of s. 18 statute of limitations. the state of saurashtra government questioned the grant but the government recognized it as having been lawfully made to appellant.

tagline: Mental Box Co. Of India Ltd vs Their Workmen on 20 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: in a dispute between the appellant and its workmen over the processing of bonus act, 1965, the company disputed the amount of depreciation, development rebate and direct taxes deducted by the company while working out the available surplus. the company contended that certain amounts deducted on account of provisions for gratuity - treatment of interest on capital reserve attributable to revaluation of assets.

tagline: Central Bank Of India Ltd., New ... vs Shri Prakash Chand Jain on 20 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: the respondent was an employee of the appellant. after a domestic inquiry in respect of alleged misconduct he was dismissed. as an industrial dispute was pending an application was made to the industrial tribunal under s. 33 ( 2 ) of the act, 1947. the enquiry was perverse and therefore it did not give its approval the order of dismissal.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs M/S. B.M. Kharwar on 13 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: india's assistant charity commissioner, bombay, held an enquiry under s. 19 of the bombay public trusts act, 1950. the nasik branch of the principal shringeri math situated in the state of karnataka was a place of religious worship within the definition of the definition in s. 2 ( 9 ) of the act. the high court allowed an appeal and set aside the order of the assistant commissioner.

tagline: Deccan Merchants Co-Operative ... vs Dalichand Jugraj Jain And Ors. on 29 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: judgment sikri, j. 1, is directed against its judgment allowing the writ petition filed by the firm, m / s. dalichand jugraj jain, first respondent before us. the original owner executed an agreement by which he leased the entire ground floor of building nos. 195 to 197. clause 6 of the maharashtra co - operative societies act, 1960 ( xxxii of 1960 ) act.

tagline: Bank Of Bihar Ltd vs Damodar Prasad & Anr on 8 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant - creditor lent money to the first respondent on the guarantee of the second respondent. the appellant challenged this direction until the creditor has exhausted his remedies against the surety. in appeal, the high court dismissed the appeal, saying the direction must be set aside.

tagline: J.P. Jani, Income-Tax Officer, ... vs Induprasad Devshankar Bhatt on 20 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: a notice under s. 148 of the 1961 - act may be issued for reopening the assessment. the respondent was assessed to income - tax for the assessment year 1947 - 48. the aim was to reopen the assessment in 1947 but the time for reassessment was enlarged from 8 years to 16 years.

tagline: Babu Ram Prakash Chandra ... vs Antarim Zila Parishad Muzaffar ... on 2 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: antarim zila parishad muzaffarnagar subjected appellant to circumstances and property tax for 1959 - 60 the appellant filed a writ petition in the high court contending that amending act no. 1 of 1960 could not continue the act of 1958 because the latter had already expired on 31st december, 1959.

tagline: Laxmipat Singhania vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, U.P. on 30 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: judgment shah, j. 1. atherton west and company ltd., kanpur were not " substantially interested " in section 23a of the indian income - tax act, 1922. the income tax officer ordered in exercise of the power of the company of its previous year as reduced by income tax and super - tax payable.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs Devi Prasad Vishwanath Prasad on 1 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: ruling shah, j. 1, declined to rely upon the books of account of the assessee. the income - tax officer also found in the book of account an entry dated january 15, 1945, of a deposit of rs. 20, 000 in the name of messrs. the high court directed the tribunal to submit a statement of case on the question.

tagline: Maharashtra State Road ... vs Shri Balwant Regular Motor ... on 22 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: the order was challenged by private operators in writ petitions and the high court directed that, pending the disposal of the writ petitions, status quo should be maintained by. the r. t. a., on september 11, 19'65, upon such assurance and after hearing the parties, directed that the appellant had not made any application for these routes.

tagline: State Of Kerala vs Haji K. Haji K. Kutty Naha & Ors. Etc on 13 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: kerala buildings tax act, 1961, was levied on the basis of floor area only and no classification was attempted. high court in writ petitions filed by the present respondents held the charge to be invalid because of violation of the equality clause of the constitution. the validity of a taxing statute is open to question on the ground that it infringes the fundamental rights of the law.

tagline: J.K. Woollen Manufacturers vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, U.P on 2 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: the assessee claimed deduction from its assessable income paid to v at the rate of 25 % of profits. v was appointed to manage its affairs and given a total remuneration of rs. 24, 000 / - per annum - - as well as commission of 121 / 2 % - - was paid at of the profits, and the commission paid was 25 % as the profits exceeded the figure stipulated.

tagline: State Of Punjab vs Brij Lal Palta on 26 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: judgment a. n. grover, j. 1. appeal by special leave against the high court quashing the proceedings pending against the. respondent. the main allegations made by the respondent were that he was induced by shibbu ram mittal to part with a sum of rs. 25, 000 / - was alleged to have been paid over to om parkash gupta director and secretary of the company.

tagline: K. Venkateswara Rao And Anr vs Bekkam Narasimha Reddi & Ors on 13 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: the election of the first respondent to the andhra pradesh legislative assembly at the general election hold in 1967 was challenged by the appellants in an election petition. the first responseent paid a bribe to one r who had also filed nomination papers, in order to secure his withdrawal as a candidate.

tagline: Mussamiya Imam Halder Bax Razvi vs Rabari Govindhai Ratnabhai & Ors on 21 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: bombay tenancy and agricultural lands act was amended by amending act 13 of 1956 which came into force on august 1, 1956. under s. 32, 70, 85 and 88 - suit land under management of court of wards - tenancy created during such management - tenant if became statutory owner on'tillers'day '

tagline: Cricket Club Of India Ltd vs The Bombay Labour Union & Another on 7 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: cricket club of india ltd. was organised with the primary object of promoting and encouraging sports and games. a preliminary objection was taken on behalf of the club that it was not an'industry'in s. 2 ( j ) of the act, 1947, to the industrial tribunal, maharashtra. the club was involved in a dispute between the appellant cricket club ltd. and the workmen.

tagline: Gujarat Electricity Board vs Girdharlal Motilal And Anr on 6 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant held a licenee granted by the government of baroda under the indian electricity act, 1948. the impugned notice did not require the licensee to sell the undertaking. the high court held the notice on the respondent to the effect that in exercise of the powers granted on it by virtue of. 71 of the electricity act.

tagline: Mohan Raj vs Surendra Kumar Taparia & Ors on 12 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: one of the candidates who had withdrawn and who was not made a party to the election petition, was declared elected. the appellant offered bribes to voters, but appellant gave bribes. one of them was a candidate who has withdrawn - code of civil procedure ( act v. of 1908 ) and the other four candidates were made parties.

tagline: Baladin Ram vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, U.P on 21 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: the assessee was assessed in 1944 - 45 for the income of its previous year ending october 30, 1943. the accounting year of the firm ended on april 1, 1944 and did not show any income as share of profit in the firm nor was mention made in the return of the partnership. the assessment of income escaping assessment - applicability of s. 34 ( 1 ) - is based in the original assessment.

tagline: Estate Of The Late A.M.K.M. ... vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 22 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: karuppan chettiar's son, muthukaruppan, and grandsons formed a hindu undivided family. in the course of assessment proceedings for 1949 - 50 it was claimed on behalf of the family. the appellate assistant commissioner recorded the partition under section 22a of the income - tax act.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs Pangal Vittal Nayak And Co. P. Ltd. on 22 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appeals are brought by special lease by the commissioner of income - tax kerala. the assessee is a member of an association for speculation in coconut oil. it also speculates on its own, but no such purchase or sale is made through the association in the name of that particular person.

tagline: Ishwar Lal And R.B. Suraj Narain ... vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 28 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: shri ishwar lal, hereinafter referred to as " the assessee " he received for the financial year 1948 - 49 by way of director's fee a sum of rs. 1, 200. this remuneration was paid to an assessee in pursuance of a resolution.

tagline: Income Tax Officer, Distt. ... vs Shri Mani Ram Etc on 20 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: the respondents flied returns for the year 1953 - 54 and were provisionally assessed on 14 - 10 - 1954. regular assessment was made on 27 - 2 - 58 for the next four succeeding years the respondents filed returns, and for all the years the regular assessments under s. 23 of the income tax act, 1922 were made after 27. in addition he applied the provisions of s. 18a ( 9 ) and imposed a penalty for each year of assessment.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, U.P vs Jagannath Mahadeo Prasad, Etc on 2 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: a high court held in favour of the assessee on the basis of a reference. he claimed his share of the loss'from one of the firms in which he was a partner, as a set off against profits from other business. the proviso says losses in business are not to be taken into account when permissible.

tagline: Gujarat Electricity Board vs Shantilal R. Desai on 6 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: india's indian electricity board purports to exercise its powers under s. 7 of the indian electricity act. the appellant corporation was formed and succeeded to the rights and liabilities of the bombay state electricity board. a writ petition in the high court in which he challenged the right of appellant to purchase his undertaking.

tagline: Dewaji vs Ganpatlal on 6 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant was not the respondent's tenant for the year 1951 - 52, and dismissed the appeal. the appellant contended that he continued to be a tenant for a year, and that the civil court had no jurisdiction to eject him. in second appeal, a single judge of the high court held that in view of the 1953 - 52 case.

tagline: Chandra Prakash vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, U.P. on 21 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: section 10a could not be applied to the present case of section 5 of the act. section 5a was referred to in favour of the assessee and against the revenue. but the high court is discharged and the answers returned by the court are discharged. the appeal is requested with costs and the answer returned by high court.

tagline: Bidya Deb Barma Etc vs District Magistrate, Tripura, ... on 6 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: the petitioners were arrested and detained on february 11, 1968 under the preventive detention act, 1950 by the orders of the district magistrate, tripura. they challenged their detention on the following among other grounds of detention. the order was not made'forthwith'as soon as may be'in s. 3 ( 4 ), meaning of - - detention whether mala fide - - grounds of detainees supplied in english.

tagline: Commissioner Of Sales Tax, U.P vs Dr. Sukh Deo on 19 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: the respondent was a medical practitioner in uttar pradesh and maintained a dispensary from which medicines were issued to his patients according to his prescriptions. the order was confirmed by the appellate and revisional authorities, but the high court decided in favour of the respondingent.

tagline: State Of Assam And Another vs Deva Prasad Barua & Another on 14 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: a general notice of demand was issued under s. 19 ( 1 ) of the act. the respondents filed writ petitions under arts. 226 and 227 challenging the assessments for that year and the subsequent year. the high court allowed petitions holding, inter alia, that as the income received in the year 1954 - 55 had not been assessed in the financial year.

tagline: Daffadar Bhagat Singh & Sons vs The Income-Tax Officer, A-Ward, ... on 22 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant firm filed a return of the assessment year 1952 - 53. it was prayed that a writ of prohibition directing income tax authorities not to proceed with the assessment for the year 1952. the application under section 26a of the act was rejected under articles 226 and 227 of the constitution.

tagline: Assistant Controller Of Estate ... vs Nawab Sir Mir Osman Ali Khan ... on 23 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant's decision of the high court on the second point was erroneous. it is urged that the appellant had not taken action on mere change of his opinion. it was held that the word " information " in section 34 ( i ) ( b ) included information as to the true and correct state of law.

tagline: Balchand vs Income-Tax Officer, Sagar on 19 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant was assessed to pay tax on his income for the assessment years 1945 - 46 and 1946 - 47 under s. 23 ( 3 ) of the 1922 - act, 1922. the appellant filed a reassessment in the high court for quashing the notices dated june 24, 1959 and march 14, 1963 but the petition was dismissed.

tagline: Paokai Haokip vs Rishang & Ors on 12 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: in an election to a parliamentary constituency, having 2, 19, 554 voters. of these 4, 168 votes were declared invalid. the appeal must succeed. a judicial commissioner ordered fresh poll in these polling stations. in appeal by the returned candidate, this court has ordered a fresh poll.

tagline: State Of Rajasthan And Anr. vs Karam Chand Thappar And Brothers ... on 27 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: ' the assessee'has its head office at calcutta and a branch office at jaipur. under a contract dated september 2, 1948, with the equitable coal company. the high court accepted a writ quashing the order of assessment of the sales tax officer. the state of rajasthan has appealed to a high court for determination of certain oilier questions.

tagline: J.B. Advani And Co. (P.) Ltd. vs R.D. Shah, Commissioner Of ... on 22 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: the order dated april 24, 1965, was made by the commissioner 01 income - tax, bombay, on an application under section 33a ( 2 ) of the indian. income tax act, 1922, was dismissed or, the ground that it was out of lime and no satisfactory explanation had been given for delay. jute prices started falling heavily heavily heavily in 1953, at different rates.

tagline: Ragho Prasad Gupta vs Shri Krishna Poddar on 23 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: one lakhan lal obtained from the ramgarh raj a settle - ment in respect of. 08 acre of land in plot no. 439, khata no. 125 in village ramgarh. the appellant filed an application praying that the award be set aside and the suit be dismissed.

tagline: Bharat Nidhi Ltd vs Takhatmal & Ors on 7 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant - bank agreed to finance the contracts undertaken by m. and to advance monies against his bills for supplies under the contracts. m made a bill, endorsed it in favour of appellant for collection, and handed it over to appellant. a pay order is revocable mandate and the payee no interest in the fund.

tagline: Kapurchand Shrimal vs Tax Recovery Officer, Hyderabad & ... on 14 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: kapurchand shrimal moved a petition in the high court of andhra pradesh challenging his detention on the ground that he was not a defaulter. the petition was rejected by the tax recovery officer who directed the arrest and detention in prison of the family for non - payment of tax.

tagline: Kamaraju Venkata Krishna Rao vs The Sub-Collector, Ongole And Anr on 8 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant claimed certain property comprised in an inam which was abolished by virtue of the andhra inams ( abolition & conversion into ryotwari ) act 36 of 1956 should be registered in his name. object of assuming the inam was granted for a charitable purpose, the same could not be considered a charitable institution.

tagline: State Of Madras vs M/S.K.C.P. Ltd on 20 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: india's respondent company carried on business of manufacture and sale of machinery parts. as the furnaces were found unsuitable they were sold at a profit. but the high court allowed a revision petition on the view that it was impossible to hold that sale was a business activity or it was actuated by the profit motive.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs K. B. Kalikutty And Anr on 2 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: an appeals court dismisses an appeal over the sale of buses. they had been plied for part of the year but were sold. the court also dismissed an appeal taking the view that the buses were plied by the assessee. the high court said the profit on the sale was taxable under the said provision.

tagline: Union Of India (Uoi) vs Brijlal Purshottamdas on 30 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: the respondent consigned 10 bales of staple fiber yarn to the southern railway at pudukad for carriage to shalimar on the bengal nagpur railway at the owner's risk rate. the high court held that the notices under section 77 of the indian railways act, 1890 and section 80 of the code of civil procedure were not properly served.

tagline: Banaras State Bank Ltd. vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 13 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: two question were referred to by the high court of allahabad under section 66 ( 1 ) of the indian income - tax act, 1922. there is no dispute that securities held by the appellant bank were issued by the indian states of travancore and cochin. but section 8 does not use the expression " government securities "

tagline: L.R. Ganapathi Thevar vs Sri Navaneethaswaraswami ... on 1 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant claimed an'occupancy right'in the properties and pleaded that he could not be evicted in view of the protection afforded by s. 6 of madras estates land act 1 of 1908. the appellant was the owner of the suit properties in 1945 and 1946 and sued for their possession on various grounds. the high court allowed an appeal holding that as the case fell within the scope of s. 8 ( 5 ) of the act.

tagline: Workmen Of Orient Paper Mills ... vs M/S. Orient Paper Mills Ltd on 13 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: dispute over bonus pay was referred to the tribunal in october 1962. there were no comparable industries in the same line of business. but there were three collieries, a steel plant, a cement factory and an aluminum company in the region were comparable with the resportdent. a dispute about bonus payable for the years 1962 - 63 and 1963 - 64. a revision of minimum wage in the respondent - mills was justified.

tagline: The State Of Rajasthan vs The Mewar Sugar Mills Ltd., ... on 26 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: judgment v. ramaswami, j. 1, did not file any quarterly return of sales for the assessment years 1955 - 56 and 1956 - 57 as required by the rajasthan sales tax act ( act no. xxix of 1954 ), hereinafter referred to as the'act'and ‘ act ’

tagline: Commissioner Of Sales Tax, Indore vs Mohammad Hussain Rahim Bux on 28 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: judgment a. n. grover, j. 1. the common question on which appeals by special leave depends relates to the applicability of article 286 of the constitution of india read with article 264 before amendments made by the constitution ( viith amendment ) act. vindhya pradesh had been included in the list of part c states in the schedule in the constitution.

tagline: Kalva Suryanarayana vs Income-Tax Officer, A-3 Ward, ... on 23 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant and d. sayappa paid their shares of the tax but m. veeraiah and h. siddappa failed to pay their shares which were rs. 1, 646 ( o. s. ), and he total income was apportioned among the four earners in proportion of their respective shares.

tagline: Chockalinga Sethurayar And Anr. vs Arumanayakam on 28 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: rangayya sethurayar died in 1886 leaving behind his wife karuthammal. he had no issues but he was bringing up his brother's son. he executed a will on june 25, 1884 ( exh. a - l ) under which he constituted a trust in respect of his properties for the purpose of carrying on the water supply charity and dwadesi kattalal.

tagline: G.E.C. (P) Ltd. Naini, Allahabad vs The Labour Court, Allahabad on 5 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: vaidyialingam, c. a. shelat, j. m. bhargava, vishishtha and six workmen were given a warning. the second strike was held to be illegal by an enquiry officer and six of the workmen who were dismissed for taking into account such warning cannot be upheld. the labour court held on the facts that the company had given the warning.

tagline: Charity Commissioner, Bombay vs Administrator Of The Shringeri ... on 13 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: shringeri math is not liable to be registered under the bombay public trusts act 1950. the high court found the following facts relating to the nasik math, a sanyasi he generally names the houses with temples as " maths " the court also found that the properties at nasik panchvati are known as properties of shringeris.

tagline: State Of Gujarat vs Jetawat Lalsingh Amarsingh And ... on 7 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: judgment k. s. hegde, j. 1, was the bhayyat of the jagir of ghantoil. that question is an appeal by special leave. the thakore went in appeal against the said judgment when the appeal was pending. the court of first instance decreed the suit in favour of the first respondent.

tagline: Bharat Nidhi Ltd. vs Takhatmal (Decd. By His Legal ... on 7 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: judgment bachawat, j. 1. m. r. malhotra was working as a contractor to the military and other authorities. the appellant - bank agreed to finance the contracts and to advance monies. he was authorised to sue for, recover and receive the monies due in connection with the contracts.

tagline: Indian Oxygen Ltd vs Their Workmen on 5 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: the indoxco labour union, jamshedpur, made joint application to the government referring certain disputes to the industrial tribunal. two of the demands were ( 1 ) payment of overtime to office staff should be 1 / 2 times the ordinary wage. and if the overtime exceeded 48 hours per week should be paid.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, West ... vs Durga Prasad More on 22 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: ruling shah, j. 1. durga prasad more - - was assessed by income - tax officer, calcutta, to tax under indian income tax act, 1922. the high court recorded their answer on the second question in favour of the commissioner and no appeal has been filed against the order of high court.

tagline: State Of Gujarat vs Jetawat Lal Singh Amar Singh & Ors on 7 August, 1968
summarized_judgment: under s. 14 ( 1 ) of the bombay merged territories and areas ( jagir ) act, 1954. first respondent was entitled to enjoy lands free of assessment and right to receive cash allowance from jagirs as jiwarak ( maintenance ) the first responder enjoyed the gharkhed lands without the liability to pay assessment.

tagline: Income Tax Officer vs M.K. Mohammed Kunhi on 11 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: certain amounts were imposed as penalty upon the assessee under ss. 271 and 255 - amount imposed as penalties on assessee - appeal to appellate tribunal - tribunal's power to grant stay of recovery of penalty pending appeal. there is no provision in the act or the income - tax appellate court rules, 1963, granting expressly such a power to the tribunal.

tagline: Delhi Cloth & General Mills Co., ... vs Workmen And Ors. Etc on 27 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: in the delhi region there are four textile units, and the s. b. m., the b. c. and the a. s. are under one management. since 1940 they had a common retirement benefit scheme with a scale of gratuity. the tribunal in its award framed two schemes relating to the payment of grituity.

tagline: Shakuntala Devi Jain vs Kuntal Kumari And Ors. on 5 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: judgment bachawat, j. 1 filed an application for execution of a final decree in a partition suit. the appellant filed objections under section 47 of the code of civil procedure by an order dated january 20, 1967 the subordinate judge, delhi, dismissed the objections. the appeal was registered as execution first appeal no. 86 of 1967.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, U.P vs M/S. Madan Gopal Radhey Lal on 6 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: the assessee received from those companies, at different times, bonus shares proportionate to equity holding - sale of bonus shares. a trader may acquire a commodity in which he is dealing, for., his own purposes, and hold it apart from the stock - in - trade of his business.

tagline: Hansraj Gordhandas vs H. H. Dave, Assistant Collector Of ... on 27 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant was a dealer in cotton fabrics on powerlooms owned by members of the cooperative society. the appellant entered into an agreement with a registered cooperative society for weaving yarn supplied by him into cotton fabrics owned by its members. the central government was empowered to exempt excisable goods from the whole or part of duty payable on such goods.

tagline: Som Datt Datta vs Union Of India And Ors on 20 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: the petitioner, a second lieutenant in the army, was involved in a dispute between two groups of soldiers on september 1, 1965. in 1965, the matter was reported to the civil police at the local police station. the complaint was made by an army officer who had been involved in an altercation with two groups.

tagline: Satish Kumar & Ors vs Surinder Kumar & Ors on 27 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: surinder kumar & ors vs. respondent partitioned immovable property exceeding the value of rs. 100. the arbitrator applied under s. 14 of the indian arbitration act, 1940 to the court for making the award a rule of the court. indian registration act ( 16 of 1908 ), s 17 ( 1 ) ( b ) - - award in respect of immovable properties.

tagline: Lakshmiratan Cotton Mills Co. ... vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 3 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: the order was confirmed by appellate assistant commissioner and appellate court. the facts which give rise to the reference require to be stated in some detail. the division of the company was held in equal moities by members of two family of singhanias and the family of guptas.

tagline: Caltex (India) Ltd vs Bhagwan Devi Marodia on 26 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant made the request for renewal of the lease 12 days after the time fixed. appellant had built a service station for petroleum products of immense utility to the public of the station. the app was denied bail and the app's appeal was upheld. the court upheld the appeal, and the decision was upheld in appeal.

tagline: State Bank Of India vs Rajendra Kumar Singh & Ors on 25 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant made an application under section 517 ( 1 ) of the code of criminal procedure asking for the delivery of the currency notes to it on the ground that the second respondent had received the said notes without knowledge or suspicion of their having been involved in the commission of an offence.

tagline: Management Shahdara (Delhi) ... vs S.S. Railway Workers' Union on 18 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: act 36 of 1956, ss. 6 and 10 ( 2 ) modifications allowed by the respondent. appellate authority allowed some modifications. in appeal, to this court under art. 136 of the constitution, appellant objected to four modifications, which were not reasonable or fair. appellant should give reasons and communicate them to workmen even in cases of discharge simpliciter.

tagline: Bibhuti Bhusan Das Gupta And Anr vs State Of West Bengal on 16 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: bachawat's advocate was examined under s. 342 at the close of the trial and the accused was convicted. in a defamation case, at the time of the accused's appearance. was dispensed with by the magistrate under. s. 540 - a cr. p. c. his advocate was found guilty of misdemeanor charges.

tagline: Union Of India vs Salween Timber Construction ... on 25 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant argued that the terms of the contract did not require the respondent to tender for inspection an. amount in excess of the contracted quantity, that. the claim was in detinue relating to an involuntary bailment and not in relation to. anything done in the contract or in connection with the contract it should be referred to arbitration.

tagline: P.N. Krishna Iyer vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 3 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: shah j. 1. p. n. krishna iyer - hereinafter called " the assessee " set up in 1923 a motor transport business in the former state of travancore. he purchased 100 shares of the company of the face value of the rs. 100 each.

tagline: C.R. Nagappa vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax on 4 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: judgment shaha, j. 1. c. r. nagappa executed on april 14, 1955. under each deed of trust a portion of the income was to be utilised immediately for the benefit of the beneficiary. india's high court of karnataka recorded answers to the questions.

tagline: Rev. Father W. Proost And Ors vs The State Of Bihar & Ors on 13 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: the st. xavier's college was established by the jesuits of ranchi. it was affiliated to patna university in 1944. the college was open to non - catholics and all non - catholic students received a course of moral science. petitioners in the present petition claim the college is a constitutional right guaranteed to minorities by art.

tagline: Vijay Cotton & Oil Mills Ltd vs The State Of Gujarat on 11 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: the government took possession of certain land belonging to appellant under s. 6 ( 1 ) and declared possession of the land was needed for public purposes. in 1949 the government built some buildings on the land and decided to acquire the land compulsorily. in 1947, the government made an appeal and set aside the order of the district judge. but the high court allowed the appeal to set aside an order of a judge.

tagline: M/S. Jaipur Udyog Ltd. & Anr vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 24 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant filed writ petitions in the high court for quashing orders of the income - tax officer for each of the three years. appellant was not entitled to deduct the aggregate amount of losses as claimed by it during the previous years and allowed only a much smaller sum as loss which could be carried forward from the earlier years.

tagline: Third Income-Tax Officer, ... vs M. Damodar Bhat on 6 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: petition under article 226 of the constitution challenged validity of a notice under s. 226 ( 3 ) of the income - tax act, 1922. it was contended on behalf of the respondent that both the assessment order and appellate order had been made under the influence of the act.

tagline: Oriental Investment Co. (P) Ltd vs Commissioner Of Income Tax, ... on 10 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: supreme court rejected application under s. 66 ( 1 ) of the income tax act, 1922 for a reference of the following questions of law - appropriate farm for such questions. high court refused to make the reference and the high court dismissed the application. supreme court ruled that the question as to what were the characteristics of the business of dealing in shares or that of an investor was a mixed question of law.

tagline: Sahu Rajeshwar Nath vs Income-Tax Officer, C-Ward, ... on 4 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant sold away his share in the partnership to one ram chander, son of nathmal das, in which he held 12 / 53 share. appellant's writ petition was dismissed by certificate from allahabad high court in 1964. it was stated that appellant had ceased to be a partner at the time of the assessment and was not liable to pay the income tax assessed upon the patient.

tagline: Bengal Chemical & Pharmaceutical ... vs Its Workmen on 16 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: the bengal chemical and pharmaceutical works ltd. entered into an agreement with its workmen about dearness allowance. in 1957, the company's appeal was dismissed and the workmen appealed against the award to this court. the company and workmen'appealed to the court against the said award. in 1962 the award was fixed by an award of the fifth industrial tribunal.

tagline: Manager, M/S. Pyarchand ... vs Omkar Laxman Thange & Ors on 27 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant - firm had a number of factories including one at kamptee in vidharba. the factory was registered under the c. p. and berar shops and establishments act, 1947. assistant commissioner dismissed the application holding that respondent no. 1 was not an employee of the factory but was employed in the head office.

tagline: Workmen Of The Indian Leaf Tobacco ... vs Management Of The Indian Leaf ... on 27 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: the indian leaf tobacco development co. ltd. was carrying on the business of purchasing, handling and selling tobacco. in 1962, it gave notice that 8 out of 21 depots would be closed down. an industrial dispute was raised by the workmen and the demands off workmen. the closure is stoppage of p art of the activity or business of the respondent.

tagline: Hari Chand Aggarwal vs Batala Engineering Co, Ltd on 24 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: the additional district magistrate of batala in the punjab acting under s. 29 of the act passed. order requisitioning shop belonging to the respondent was occupied by the appellant as a tenant. appellant challenged the order of retrisition in a writ petition without success.

tagline: Management Of Churakulam Tea ... vs Workmen And Anr. on 3 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant owns the churakulam tea estate in kottayam, kerala state. the company used to enter into agreements, with the representatives of the workmen, from time to time, for the payment of bonus. there is no controversy that appellant paid for nine years, i. e., from 1947 to 1951 and 1953 to 1956.

tagline: Mansukhlal And Brothers vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 3 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: an appeal by the bombay high court in a reference made under section 66 of the income - tax act, 1922. an appellate assistant commissioner in appeal held that only rs. 24, 000 be treated as concealed income. a penalty of rs. 62, 000 was imposed within the maximum limits provided by section 28 ( 1 ) ( c ) of the act.

tagline: Juggi Lal Kamlapat vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, U.P. on 4 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: shri shri shri lakshmipat singhania 17 % in second place. shri shri was also in contention to win first major title in the united states. he is the latest in a string of celebrities to be involved in the scandal. he has been linked to a move to the u. s. for the past two years.

tagline: Mohd. Usman Military Contractor, ... vs Union Of India, Ministry Of ... on 26 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant entered into contract with india's government of india. contract contained arbitration clause for supplies made under contract. appellant's appeal was dismissed by high court as incompetent in so far as it challenged order under s. 8 and 20 of the arbitration act, 1940.

tagline: Hardeodas Jagannath vs State Of Assam & Ors on 27 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: india extended the assam sales tax act, 1947 to the administered area in shillong under s. 4 of the extra provincial jurisdiction act ( 47 of 1947 ) as amended by act 6 of 1958 s. 30. in appeal to the high court, a dealer may appeal against an order of assessment or penalty.

tagline: Vishwanatha Reddy vs Konappa Rudrappa Nadgouda And ... on 13 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: vishwanatha reddy was declared elected to the assembly from the yadgiri constituency at the poll held in february 1967. in appeal, high court rejected the petition saying reddy was disqualified from standing as a candidate for election. the appeal is now before us for consideration of the question whether it is open to this court.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs Abdul Hai Azim Ullah on 5 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: appeals are by certificate from allahabad high court, which arise out of assessment of tax made for the assessment years 1952 - 53, 1953 - 54 and 1954 - 55, in an income - tax reference. the shops came into possession of the assessee by virtue of a registered agreement dated january 2, 1947.

tagline: H.L. Sud, Income-Tax Officer, ... vs Tata Engineering & Locomotive Co. ... on 6 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: the respondent received from the income - tax officer notices if demand under s. 29 of the indian income tax act, 1922, was issued. in 1961 - 62, the income tax officer issued a notice to the respondingent under. s. 43 of the india. nonresident firm - liability of agent of the firm - whether notice should be given each year.

tagline: Bhagwan Das vs Paras Nath on 27 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant was a tenant of the respondent in respect of a shop in agra, uttar pradesh. the state government revokes the permission granted by the commissioner under s. 3 ( 3 ) of the act. the order of the district magistrate is revoking permission by order u / s 7 ( f )

tagline: Municipal Corporation Of Delhi vs Kishan Das & Another on 19 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: the commissioner of the appellant ( municipal corporation of delhi ) issued a writ petition in the high court praying for a direction to the corporation to accord the sanction. the application was approved by the delhi development authority but the commissioner could decline sanction if there was a contravention of s. 336 ( 2 ) or s. 340 of delhi municipal corporation act, 1957.

tagline: Municipal Corporation, Indore vs Shri K.N. Palshikar, Indore on 6 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant corporation in accordance with road widening scheme sought to acquire some of the land belonging to the respondent.'respondent was not satisfied with the compensation offered by the appellant or awarded by the arbitrators, and under 8. 387 ( 4 ) and ( 5 ) of the act, indore. appellant in reply submitted that the compensation was too low.

tagline: Rajputana Trading Co. Ltd. vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, West ... on 5 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: judgment grover, j. 1, is appealing a judgment for the calcutta high court. he says the sum of rs. 78, 749 can be said to be arising from speculative business. the assessee was deemed to be the profits and gains of business under section 10 ( 2a ) of income tax act.

tagline: Harnath Singh vs State Of Madhya Pradesh on 27 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant was put up for identification by witnesses in a test identification parade. appellant tried for the offence under s. 395 at the indian penal code, and convicted. the appellant's appeal to the high court failed in this high court case. he recorded further statements made by the witness after he had purported to identify the accused.

tagline: V. Sanjeevaraya Mudaliar vs N.A. Raghavachary on 19 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant was allowed inter alia to boil and dry paddy on the said land and he was also allowed to erect a temporary shed for keeping the paddy on condition that while vacating the land he would dismantle the same. the court reversed the decree of the trial court but the high court restored it.

tagline: The Chairman, Brooke Bond India ... vs Chandranath Choudhary on 3 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: judgment j. m. shelat, j. 1. appeal is against the order by which the labour court, patna, set aside the order of discharge from service passed by the appellant - company against the respondent and which also directed his reinstatement. the company was also appointed by an agreement m / s. hari bhagat at kathmandu as its wholesalers. the said agreement provided that wholesalers would have to deposit with the company a sum of rs. 20, 000 / - that they would be paid commission at 3 %.

tagline: Joshbhai Chunibhai Patel vs Anwar Beg A. Mirza on 13 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant challenged the respondent's election to the gujarat state assembly in february 1967. it was alleged that a car was hired or procured by the return candidate and on the date of the poll it was used for free conveyance of three ladies to the polling booth. there was also a prayer that a general recount was wrongly disallowed by the high court.

tagline: Vidya Sagar Joshi vs Surinder Nath Gautam on 13 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant applied for a congress ticket for election to the legislative assembly. the appellant contested the election against the respondent who was the official congress nominee and incurred the penalty of forfeiture. appellant was denied the congress ticket and he filed his return of election expenses. the high court held in favour of the election petitioner.

tagline: Lakhi Prasad Agarwal vs Nathmal Dokania on 6 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant's election petition was challenged by appellant in an election petition. the appellant was accused of corrupt practice of " undue influence " under s. 123 ( 2 ) of the representation of the people act 1951 ; ( 3 ) and ( 4 ) aforesaid pamphlet was alleged to have been issued by the respondent and supporters in which reference was made to the call of two muslims.

tagline: Commissioner Of Wealth-Tax, ... vs Smt. Muthukrishna Ammal on 6 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: court ruled that the interest of the respondent in the salt pans was not an asset within the meaning of s. 2 ( e ) and the value of the lessee under each lease was precarious in any year by notice from either party - if an " asset " to be included in the replyent's net wealth. the case was confirmed by the appellate assistant commissioner.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs The Union Of Tile Exports, ... on 10 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: the assessee firm carried on business at bangalore in the state of bangalore. it was appointed as the sole selling agent for certain areas in bangalore in respect of tiles and ridges manufactured by the principal at feroke in british india. the high court said the entire profit accrued or arose within the meaning of el. ( a ) of sub - s. ( 1 ) of the income - tax act, 1922 s. 42 ( 3 ) of india.

tagline: Konappa Rudrappa Nadgouda vs Vishwanath Reddy & Anr on 13 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant challenged respondent's nomination before returning officer on the ground that the respondent was disqualified under s. 9a of the representation of the people act, 1951. no general notice was given to the electorate about the disqualification. appellant's application was rejected.

tagline: Jaimal & Anr vs Financial Commissioner, Punjab & ... on 25 September, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellants were not entitled to apply under s. 18 of the act. the final authority under the act, held that the'appellant's was not entitled. the original act was held in the high court of punjab security of land tenures act, 1953. it was not intended to confer any rights on the sub - tenant. the word'landowner'is defined in s. 2.

tagline: J.K. Steel Ltd vs Union Of India on 18 October, 1968
summarized_judgment: union of india date of judgment day of judgment in india on june 24, 1962. iron and steel products made from imported steel rods. in the tariff act, 1934 was amended and two notifications nos. 70 and 77 were issued in exercise of the powers granted by r. 8.

tagline: Romesh Chandra Mehta vs State Of West Bengal on 18 October, 1968
summarized_judgment: the accused were charged with some offenses under s. 120 - b indian penal code read with s. 167 ( 81 ) of the import and export control act, 1947. statements made by the accused to an officer of customs in an enquiry. the alleged confessional statements made to him were inadmissible under art.

tagline: Assistant Collector Of Customs & ... vs U.L.R. Malwani And Anr on 16 October, 1968
summarized_judgment: the accused persons charged with having entered into a conspiracy at bombay and other places in the beginning of october 1959 or there about for the purposes of smuggling smuggled foreign goods into india. some of the goods seized were seized after the enquiry was held by the customs authorities.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income Tax, ... vs Patiala Flour Mills Co. Pvt. Ltd., ... on 6 October, 1968
summarized_judgment: the respondent - assessee claimed in its assessment to tax for the assessment year 1970 - 71 that the amounts of deficiency under sec. 801 for the current as well as past assessment years were liable to be adjusted against the profit of rs. 1, 51, 011 / - earned by its cold storage plant during the assessment years 1967 - 71.

tagline: Nani Gopal Mitra vs The State Of Bihar on 15 October, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant, who was employed as a railway guard on the eastern railway, was found in possession of pecuniary resources disproportionate to his known sources of income. in 1958, appellant was found guilty of appellant under s. 5 ( 2 ) of the act and then. retrial of the appellant.

tagline: Illias vs Collector Of Customs, Madras on 31 October, 1968
summarized_judgment: customs authorities have invested with powers of a police officer in matters relating to arrest, investigation and search. under ss. 107 and 108 were sought to be given in evidence at the trial. under s. 107, the officers were charged with various offences relating to transport of gold. the statements were inadmissible by reason of s. 25 of the evidence.

tagline: Bahadur Singh & Anr vs Muni Subrat Dass & Anr on 16 October, 1968
summarized_judgment: award was signed by the arbitrators, the tenants, and m, and it was approved by the landlord. the award was passed in contravention of the delhi and ajmer rent control act, 1952 and was void ; and the landlord could not execute the decree. the court pronounced judgment according to the award and decree followed.

tagline: Rattan Lal & Co. & Anr vs The Assessing Authority & Anr on 29 October, 1968
summarized_judgment: the act was amended by the legislatures of the two states by act 7 of 1967 and 14 of 1967 respectively. in a writ petition, the petitioners contended that the position had not altered at all even after the amendments and the act were to be levied. the state of the punjab and haryana act were not competent to amend retrospectively an act passed by the composite state.

tagline: Lalta And Ors vs State Of Uttar Pradesh on 25 October, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellants were convicted for forgery and abetment of forgery. the court then filed a complaint against the appellant's for the offence. the promissory note was dismissed on the ground that the executant's thumb impressions on blank forms were of a date later than that of that.

tagline: Sampat Prakash vs State Of Jammu & Kashmir & Anr on 10 October, 1968
summarized_judgment: the petitioner was detained by the district magistrate under the jammu and kashmir preventive detention act, 1964. in 1959 the period of 5 years in art. 35 of the constitution of india, in 1959, continued the detention without reference to advisory board. the president of india under art. 370 is power of president to extend immunity of state laws even if fundamental rights are infringed.

tagline: The State Of Maharashtra vs Himmatbhai Narbheram Rao And Ors. on 15 October, 1968
summarized_judgment: " section 366 " is removal of the contents of all receptacles and depots. section 369 and carcasses of dead animals deposited in any of the matters specified in the said sections. the commissioner shall provide or appoint in proper and convenient situations public recupacles, depots and places.

tagline: Dhani Devi vs Sant Bihari & Ors on 18 October, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant came into possession of all his transport vehicles. the appellant's husband was one of the applicants for a stage carriage permit. the application was allowed by the transport minister in revision under s. 64a of the motor vehicles act 1939. a person in possession of a transport vehicle is not entitled to a permit as a matter of right.

tagline: Arjan Singh And Anr vs The State Of Punjab And Ors on 8 October, 1968
summarized_judgment: pepsu tenancy and agricultural lands act xiii of 1955 came into force on 30th october 1956 in view of provisions of the act. the principal act was amended in 1956 by the inclusion of chapter 4a which provided for the government taking over the surplus lands in the hands of a land owner. in certain specified cases no transfer or other disposition of land effected after 21st.

tagline: Hind Trading Company vs Union Of India & Anr on 28 October, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant imported 1, 65, 000 pieces chinese dollars from tibet through sikkim state under two reserve bank import licences. applications were made for permits to allow goods to cross frontier. application no. 34 related to the lot marked'h. d.'and the other'h '

tagline: Mahadeo vs Shantibhai And Ors on 15 October, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant was disqualified from being a candidate as he held certain offices of profit under government. appellant held office by his enagagement on the basis of a letter of appointment dated february 6, 1962 addressed to him by'the chief commercial superintendent of the railway and his reply thereto whereby he accepted certain obligations and was required to discharge certain duties.

tagline: Rama Shankar Singh & Anr vs Mst. Shyamlata Devi And Ors on 10 October, 1968
summarized_judgment: defendants 5 to 7 and 13 leased forest rights in theft villages to defendants 1 and 2 at an annual rental. defendant 3 was transferee of a portion of lessees'interest from defendant 1. the defendants could claim at the rate of 61 / 2 % per annum only. defendant 2 died and heirs were substituted as defendants 2 and 2.

tagline: Workmen Of Shri Bajrang Jute Mills ... vs Employers Of Shri Bajrang Jute ... on 31 October, 1968
summarized_judgment: the central wage board was constituted for devising a wage structure based on the principle of fair wages payable in the jute industry. the board selected 20 mills from west bengal and 9 mills from the rest of the region as representing a cross - section of the industry. a fairly small mill in andhra pradesh was considered'as a comparable unit with two larger mills '

tagline: Motibhai Fulabhai Patel & Co vs M/S. R. Prasad And Ors on 30 October, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellants were tobacco merchants in baroda in gujarat state and were holding central excise licence in forms l - 2 and l - 5 for the purpose of storing, selling and processing duty paid tobacco. when they had filed their reply, the collector held them guilty of contravening rule 40 levied on them a penalty of rs. 2, 000 as well as the duty payable under the law.

tagline: Union Of India & Ors vs K. Rajappa Menon on 7 October, 1968
summarized_judgment: india's union of india & ors vs. respondent filed a writ petition in the high court. a show cause notice was served stating that the respondent should be dismissed from service. appeal must be allowed to give detailed reasons for confirming finding established at departmental enquiry.

tagline: The Premier Automobiles Ltd vs S.N. Shrivastava & Anr on 10 October, 1968
summarized_judgment: petition under s. 156 read with s. 210 of the indian income - tax act, 1961. by this notice the petitioner was called upon to pay advance tax as agent of a non - resident infringes the equality clause of the constitution of india, art. 32 of the. indian income tax act. no order for payment of advance tax can be made against an agent of non - residents.

tagline: Union Of India vs Jai Narain Misra on 31 October, 1968
summarized_judgment: act : arbitration - award based on mistake may be struck out if'separable'rupees twenty - two thousand two hundred and ninety two, annas five were to be paid as the amount of security deposit made by the union of india. high court allowed'appeal and set aside the award on the ground that it was vague and uncertain.

tagline: Purshottam Das vs Smt. Raj Mani Devi on 30 October, 1968
summarized_judgment: the respondent obtained permission to institute a suit from the rent control & eviction officer under s. 3 ( 1 ) of the u. p. ( temp. ) control of rent and eviction act 1947. when the state government set aside the commissioner's order and gave leave to the respondingent to file suit after 4 months of the order.

tagline: State Of Maharashtra vs Mumbai Upnagar Gramodyog Sangh on 15 October, 1968
summarized_judgment: shah, j. c. mitter, g. k. hegde and 385 of the bombay municipal corporation act, 1888, amended by act 14 of 1961. first respondent was the owner of a stable of filch cattle in bombay. the owner lost his property in the carcasses and'it became the property of the corporation '

tagline: Almohan Das And Ors vs State Of West Bengal on 25 October, 1968
summarized_judgment: magistrate committed the accused to stand trial for offences under s. 120b read with sections 409, 477a i. p. c. before the court of sessions. a revision application against the order of committal was rejected in limine by the high court. if there is no evidence on which a charge could be framed against the appellants.

tagline: Sk. Piru Bux & Ors vs Kalandi Pati Rao & Ors on 29 October, 1968
summarized_judgment: hindus filed a suit against the appellants who were muslims for a declaration that hindus had the right to take out religious processions with appropriate music along the roads and highways in the villages. the first appellate court held that the respondents were bound by the compromise, but that the restriction was necessary to enable them to say their prayers in the mosques.

tagline: Dattaraya S/O Keshav Tawalay vs Shaikh Mahboob Shaikh All & Anr on 24 October, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant obtained a decree for possession of certain lands in a pre - emption suit which he brought against the respondents. the appellant deposited the purchase price 3 days after the date fixed stating that he couldn't deposit in time as he fell ill. appellant wanted a second appeal to the high court and pending disposal of appeal the respondents prayed for stay of the execution order.

tagline: Ramu Gope And Ors vs State Of Bihar on 29 October, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellants and one h were tried on the charge that on july 2, 1962. they formed an unlawful assembly and in prosecution of the common object of the unlawful assembly i. e., to rescue their cattle which had damaged the maize crop of one b. they made an assault on persons resisting the rescue causing injuries.

tagline: Surja vs Hardeva And Ors on 17 October, 1968
summarized_judgment: repellant a tenant of. the respondent l. a. m. bachawat. applied. for purchase of the land cultivated by him under s. 18 of the punjab security of land tenures act, 1953 alleging that he had been in possession of the. land for more than six years and the land was outside the reserved area of the - land - owner. the commissioner has now gone into question whether commissioner's report was acceptable or not on merits.

tagline: Mohan Meakin Breweries Ltd vs Commissioner Of Excise, Bihar & ... on 17 October, 1968
summarized_judgment: petitioner was a company manufacturing indian made foreign liquor in bihar. it imported foreign liquor into the state of bihar from himachal pradesh and uttar pradesh for sale of its products at patna and ranchi depots on payment of duty at the then current rate. the company challenged the demand in a writ petition under art. 32 of the act.

tagline: Badri Prasad vs State Of Madhya Pradesh & Anr on 11 October, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant entered into a contract in respect of certain forests in jagir, madhya pradesh. under el. 1 of the contract, he was entitled to cut trees of more than 12 inches girth. after the passing of the abolition of proprietary rights ( estates, mahals alienated lands ) act, 1950 a notification was issued.

tagline: Nlrbhay Singh vs State Of Madhya Pradesh on 30 October, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant was tried for causing the death of his mother by inflicting injuries with a spear. appellant's appeal against conviction under s. 304 part ii dismissed by high court in limine. the appellant appealed against the order acquitting appellant of the offence of murder.

tagline: Tilokchand Motichand & Ors vs H.B. Munshi & Anr on 22 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: petitioners filed a writ petition in the high court and contended that the sales tax officer'forfeited the sum under s. 21 ( 4 ) of. the bombay sales tax act, 1953, by order dated march 17, 1958. the petitioners claim they defrauded customers and so were not entitled to relief even if there was a violation of fundamental rights.

tagline: Purtabpore Co. Ltd vs Cane Commissioner Of Bihar & Ors on 21 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: purtabpore co. ltd. vs. respondent was a sugar mill situated in u. p. near the border of bihar state. in 1966 the cane commissioner, bihar passed an order under el. 6 ( 1 ) of the order reserving the said area of 208 villages for the appellant for the seasons 1966 - 67 and 1967 - 68.

tagline: J.K. (Bombay) (P) Ltd vs New Kaiser-I-Hind Spg. & Wvg. Co. ... on 22 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: shelat, j. m. bhargava, vishishtha vaidyialingam, c. a. and a. citation. the company submitted a scheme for the sanction of the high court. it would execute a second legal mortgage of its fixed and other assets in favour of the creditors.

tagline: Pushkar Mukherjee & Ors vs The State Of West Bengal on 7 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: in petitions for the writ of habeas corpus under art. 32 of the constitution for release from detention under orders passed under s. 3 ( 2 ) of the prevention of detention act, held under the act. if any of the grounds furnished to the detent are found to be irrelevant or vague.

tagline: Tarapore & Co., Madras vs M/S. V/O Tractors Export, Moscow ... on 26 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant opened a confirmed, irrevocable letter of credit with a bank in india for the entire value of the equipment. appellant complained that the performance of the machinery was not efficient and filed a suit seeking an injunction restraining the respondent from realising the balance of amount payable under the letter.

tagline: Durga Prashad vs Chief Controller Of Imports & ... on 22 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant applied for import licence to import certain goods. application was issued in 1959 for only a part of the value applied for. he filed appeals and exhausted all the remedies under para 85 of the order relating to export promotion scheme. high court dismissed the petition in limine but granted certificate under art. 133 ( 1 ) of the constitution was filed after great delay.

tagline: Union Of India & Ors vs M/S. Rai Bahadur Shree Ram Durga ... on 19 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: in 1965, the dy. collector of customs issued a notice to the respondents calling upon them to show cause why a penalty under s. 167 ( 8 ) of the sea customs act, 1878, should not be imposed on the basis that the respondents gave in the prescribed form false specifics supported by false evidence.

tagline: Perspective Publications (P) ... vs State Of Maharashtra on 19 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: grover, a. n. benchmarker, was the editor, printer and publisher. the article contained insinuations that there was a connection between a loan of rs. 10 lacs, granted to a firm in which the judge's brother was a partner, and the judgment m the defamation case. in appeal, it was contended that in the article no aspersion was cast on the integrity of the judge nor was imputation of dishonesty made.

tagline: Commissioner Of Sales Tax, Madhya ... vs Madhya Pradesh Electricity ... on 26 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: board constituted under the electricity supply act, 1948, supplied and distributed electricity to consumers, it also supplied water free and the electricity board was making a pro - rata charge of conversion of water into steam. the board also agreed to re - imburse the board for the loss sustained on account of the mills not taking full demand of steam.

tagline: Parry & Co. Ltd vs P.C. Pal & Ors on 27 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: west bengal industrial disputes rules, 1958, rr. 77 ( 1. 2 ) and proviso - notice given 2 days prior, if provisor applies. the company served notices on some of the employees for retrenchment to take effect two days afterwards. the tribunal held that a good case for retrinchment was not made out and ordered reinstatement. but the tribunal did not accept the manager's evidence.

tagline: M.C. Verghese vs T.J. Ponnan & Anr on 13 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: first respondent wrote letters to his wife who is daughter c the appellant. the letters contained defamatory imputations concerning the appeasement. the court of session set aside the order but high court restored it. if the case was to proceed and'the wife'should appear as a witness.

tagline: Bai Radha vs State Of Gujarat on 20 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant was convicted for offences punishable under ss. 3 and 4 ( 1 ) and 4 ) of the suppression of immoral traffic in women and girls act. provisions of s. 15 were disregarded during investigation - - no prejudice to accused - - effect on trial. court has to weigh the evidence where there has been such non - observance of the provisions.

tagline: Malkiat Singh & Anr vs State Of Punjab on 8 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: in 1955, the central government promulgated the punjab paddy ( export control ) order prohibited the export of or attempt to export paddy from any place outside the state of punjab except under a valid permit. no offence has been committed by the appellants nor was there an attempt to commit an offence of export.

tagline: Parsram And Anr vs Shivchand And Ors on 28 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant no. 2 was a mochi and not a member of the chamar caste mentioned in item 9 of the constitution ( scheduled castes ) order, 1950, was issued under art. 341 - president's power under - caste specified in his order only to be treated as scheduled classes. it was also urged that the return officer had accepted the nomination paper of appellant.

tagline: R.M. Seshadri vs G. Vasantha Pai on 29 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant was elected to the madras legislative council from the madras district graduates constituency. his election was challenged by the respondent, his nearest rival candidate by an election petition alleging. a large number of cars had been employed for conveyance of voters to the polling booths in violation of s. 123 ( 5 ) of the representation of the people act, 1951. the original order passed by the high court ruled that the. appellant elected in his place.

tagline: Virji Ram Sutaria vs Nathalal Premji Bhanvadia And Ors on 4 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: oath was taken by candidate for election to the legislature in january 1967. 173 of the constitution in the irish version of the relevant form set out in the third schedule to the constitution. in an election petition it urged that the term " raiya sabha " was equivalent to " legislative assembly " the state of gujarat has no legislative council of the state.

tagline: State Of Andhra Pradesh vs Kokkiliagada Meerayya And Anr on 28 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: proceedings were instituted under s. 107 cr. p. c. against four persons including the two respondents and an order was made against them under 112. the court of session in appeal confirmed the conviction but the high court set it aside holding that on the principle of " issue estoppel "

tagline: Management Of Fertilizer ... vs The Workmen on 15 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant granted ad hoc bonus for good performance to workmen. for the next year, appellant offered to pay only the statutory bonus under the bonus ordinance and act. appellant agreed to pay bonus for the third year, strictly in accordance with the payment of bonus ordinance, which had come into force.

tagline: Security & Finance (P) Ltd. & Anr vs Dattaraya Raghav Agge & Ors on 8 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: a hire - purchase agreement was entered into between appellants and respondent no. 1 for doing transport business. when the arbitrator made an award after recording the evidence of the appellant's respondents nos. 1 and 2 filed an application under s. 3 contempt of court act.

tagline: L.D. Healy vs State Of Uttar Pradesh on 27 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant was prosecuted for offences under s. 161 i. p. c. and s. 5 ( 1 ) ( d ) ( 2 ) read with s. 4 ( 2. 2 ) sanction for prosecution obtained from commercial superintendent and fresh proceedings commence. sanction was obtained from the chief commercial superintendent of police and in fresh proceedings for the same offences.

tagline: K.M. Viswanatha Pillai vs K.M. Shanmugam Pillai on 25 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: the high court of madras is directed against its judgment and decree modifying the decree passed by the district judge. a motor bus no. mdh 662 fell to the share of the plaintiff in the name of the defendant in whose name the vehicles were also acquired. in 1953, the six brothers entered into a partition of the properties belonging to the joint family.

tagline: Guruji Shrihar Baliram Jivatode vs Vithalrao & Ors on 19 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant was returned from the rajura constituency maharashtra state assembly in february 1967. the appellant had made false statements about the personal character and conduct of the first respondent and was guilty of corrupt practice within the meaning of s. 123 ( 4 ) of the representation of the people act, 1951. the high court allowed the election of appellant who appealed to this court.

tagline: Agra Electric Supply Co. Ltd vs The Labour Court, Meerut & Anr on 8 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: vaidyialingam, c. a. shelat, j. m. bhargava, vishishtha citation, and agra electric supply co. both applied for certain reliefs against its employer. the high court dismissed the application as not having been prosecuted for the default of appearance of a party.

tagline: Shashibushan Prasad Misilra & Anr vs Babuji Rai & Ors on 27 November, 1968
