summarized_judgment: plaintiffs obtained settlements of certain land owned by a deity in village siripur majrahia in bihar. the contesting defendants owned lands in the villages of kazi dumra and shankarpur which were separated by a river. high court dismissed the appeal as against the deity as a respondent who is not necessary party - appeal.

tagline: Board Of Directors Of The South ... vs N.K. Mohammad Khan, Etc on 25 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: the appellant company was taken over by the government of madras. all the property and assets of the company became vested in the madras government. the company and the electricity board raised preliminary objections to the jurisdiction of the labour court. the court ruled that the workmen were entitled to retrenchment compensation under s. 25f.

tagline: Virjiram Sutaria vs Nathalal Premji Bhavadia And Ors. on 4 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: " i will bear true faith and allegiance to the affirm constitution of india as by law established and that i will uphold the sovereignty and integrity of india " " i, a b... b., do swear in the name of god - -. i will. uphold. the sovereignty of india, " he says.

tagline: Prabhakar V. Sinari vs Shanker Anant Verlekar on 29 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: a private complaint was filed against the appellant who was a deputy superintendent of police. appellant came to the spot, threatened and assaulted him, and suggested to the hawkers to enter upon the load, then threatened to assault him. the judge ordered that the complainant be asked to obtain the required sanction before prosecuting him.

tagline: Kushro S. Gandhi & Ors vs N.A. Gajdar & Ors on 27 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: the high court had no jurisdiction to decide any other point of the case. it was contended that the defendants committed a tort against the plaintiffs by conspiring and preventing the plaintiffs from being elected to the office of trustees of the association. high court held there was a deficiency and granted time to the plaintiffs to make good the deficiency.

tagline: Workmen Of Indian Express (P) Ltd vs The Management on 26 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: the workmen of indian express were appointed under the designation of copy holders and an order in 1959, issued by the management. a dispute arose whether the two workmen should be treated as proof readers and the executive committee of the delhi union of journalists decided to take up their case and initiated conciliation proceedings.

tagline: K. Manick Chand And Ors. vs Elias Saleh Mohammed Sait And Ors. on 3 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: judgment bhargava, j. 1. khanmull, his legal representatives are the appellants in the present appeal. both these mortgages were executed by three brothers, ahmed saleh, mohamed sait and ammenabai and haneefabai impleaded as defendants 6 and 7 in their capacity of purchasers of the equity of redemption from the mortgagors.

tagline: Akhtar Alam vs The State Of Bihar on 12 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant was the head clerk to the executive electrical enginear of the state electricity board. he was convicted under s. 5 ( 2 ) of the prevention of corruption act or s. 21 ( 12 ) i. p. c. and therefore a public servant'within the meaning of that section and also of s. 2 of the. indian penal code. high court's appeal against the conviction was dismissed by the high court.

tagline: Ram Prakash And Ors. vs The State Of Uttar Pradesh on 7 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: the three appellants were convicted under section 302. they were sentenced to death for the murder of ganeshi lal on july 19, 1966. the high court rejected their appeal and has confirmed the sentence of death. the case is alleged to have happened in front of the house of rikhi lal.

tagline: B.C. Mohindra vs The Municipal Board, Saharanpur on 20 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant was asked to execute and complete an agreement in favour of the respondent. the appellant's bid was accepted at auction by bidder and board board chairman. a meeting of the respondingent board was also held in which the bid was rejected. the court found that there was a list of bidders at auction signed by winning bidder.

tagline: Bhima And Ors. vs State Of Haryana on 20 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: judgment grover, j. 1. appeal by special leave from a judgment of the punjab and haryana high court. the appellants were tried under section 302, 325 and 323 read with section 34 of the indian penal code by the additional sessions judge rohtak for having injured phusa on january 29, 1966.

tagline: Malkiat Singh And Anr. vs The State Of Punjab on 28 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: appellant malkiat singh admitted that he was driving the truck. the truck was loaded with 75 bags of paddy weighing 140 maunds. it is alleged that the consignee sawan ram and chiranji lal were prosecuted. the case of the punjab high court is brought, by special leave.

tagline: State Of Andhra Pradesh vs Yedla Perraya on 4 November, 1968
summarized_judgment: the driver and the other person were convicted for offences under ss. 35 and 36 of the andhra pradesh forest act, 1882. they were convicted under the act 11 of 1963. the sessions court set aside the order of confiscation in appeal and the high court confirmed the order.

tagline: State Of Gujarat vs Dr. R.B. Chandrachud on 19 November, 1968

tagline: V. Venugopala Ravi Varma Rajah vs Union Of India & Anr on 26 February, 1969

summarized_judgment: the assessee entered into an agreement to purchase a land for rs. 6 lakhs. he did not have resources to buy land even worth a lakh nor could cultivate the land himself. he divided the land into 23 plots and found purchasers for 22 of these plots.

summarized_judgment: judgment j. c. shah, j. 1, is a public limited company carrying on the business of manufacturing and selling asbestos cement sheets and other products. the company sent goods to outstation customers by railway under railway receipts with freight to pay. the order passed by the high court of andhra pradesh and the order was restored.

tagline: R. Obliswami Naidu vs Addl. State Transport Appellate ... on 17 February, 1969

summarized_judgment: the appellant company, which was incorporated in 1946, purchased and installed machinery from time to time valued at rs. 75 lacs. in respect of its assessment to, income tax for certain years, it was allowed'normal depreciation'in, excess of the amount permissible under proviso ( c ) to s. 10 ( 2 ) of the income tax act, 1922.

tagline: Deputy Commissioner Of ... vs Dhanalakshmi Vilas Cashew Co. on 18 February, 1969
summarized_judgment: two appeals by certificate from the judgment of the kerala high court involve a common question of law. the facts in c. a. no. 804 of 1967 may alone be stated. the respondent was assessed under the general sales tax act, 1125 ( act 11 of 1125 ) ( state of kerala )

tagline: Jindas Oil Mill & Ors vs Godhra Electricity Co. Ltd on 26 February, 1969
summarized_judgment: in 1956 the supply act of 1948 was amended. by s. 57a ( 1 ) of the'act'the government could fix rates for supply of electricity and under cl. 1 of the schedule vi a licensee could reduce the rates for keeping the profit at a reasonable level. under the amended schedule vi, the licensee shall adjust his charges cl.

tagline: Workmen Of Sur Iron And Steel Co. ... vs Sur Iron And Steel Co. (P) Ltd. And ... on 3 February, 1969
summarized_judgment: an industrial dispute relating to the lock - out and closure of a factory arose between respondent no. 1, messrs sur iron & steel co., shramik union ( hereinafter referred to as'the company'three issues were framed by the government of west bengal and referred for adjudication to fifth industrial tribunal.

summarized_judgment: m / s. palampadam plantations ltd., kottayam, kerala's. 2 ( viii ) of the kerala general sales tax act, 1963. in order to fall within the definition, a person must sell goods produced by him by manufacture, agriculture, horticulture or otherwise.

summarized_judgment: appeal is brought by a certificate on behalf of the commissioner of income - tax from the judgment of the calcutta high court dated september, 1963. halash chand rampuria, the assessee, was dissatisfied with the order of the income tax officer in dealing with the interest income for the year 1940 - 41 and the matter was referred to the high court.

summarized_judgment: appellant is the sole trustee of the estate of the late mr. f. e. dinshaw. the appellant owns a plot of land at manchubhai road in malad. greater bombay municipal corporation issued a notice to appellant under section 167 of the act informing appellant. appellant was a banking company incorporated in the united kingdom.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, West ... vs Allahabad Bank Limited on 14 February, 1969

tagline: The Tata Engineering And ... vs S.C. Prasad And Anr. on 11 March, 1969
summarized_judgment: the industrial tribunal directed the company to start a new high school as soon as possible. the company bad removed their names from its rolls on the ground that they had abandoned their employment. the tribunal gave an elaborate award and held that the said enquiries were not properly held, that they suffered from.

summarized_judgment: the appellant was appointed as welfare officer by the indian aluminium co., ltd., calcutta, respondent no. 4 ( hereinafter referred to as the company ) at its hirakud factory in its personnel department with effect from 1956. the company informed the labour commissioner, orissa, that the company was a welfare officer.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs M/S. Kirkend Coal Company on 12 March, 1969
summarized_judgment: the respondent was a firm on which penalty under s. 28 ( 1 ) ( c ) of the indian income - tax act, 1922 was imposed by the income tax officer in respect of the assessment year 1948 - 49. in reference the high court held that penalty could be imposed upon the original firm constituted in the account year relevant to the. assessment year before the trial.

summarized_judgment: m / s. soorajmull nagarmull & anr filed suits against the collector of customs and the union of india claiming refund of excess customs duty levied on spindle oil imported into india. the court also found the notice to be defective inasmuch as it asked for payment towards income tax and penalty.

tagline: V. P. Gopala Rao vs Public Prosecutor, Andhra ... on 7 March, 1969

tagline: Giasi Ram And Ors. vs Ramjilal And Ors. on 11 March, 1969

tagline: Praduman Kumar vs Virendra Goyal (Dead) By L. Rs on 11 March, 1969
summarized_judgment: the tenants claimed relief against forfeiture of their tenancy rights under s. 114 of the transfer of property act and deposited in court an amount less than the amount due. the tenants filed a suit for eviction of the tenants and for payment of the arrears of rent and compensation.

tagline: Beohar Rajendra Sinha & Ors vs State Of M.P. & Ors on 11 March, 1969

tagline: Mohammad Ismail vs Nanney Lal on 7 March, 1969
summarized_judgment: the u. p. ( temporary ) control of rent & eviction act, 1947, restricts the rights of landlords to institute suits for eviction of their tenants. the commissioner must ordinarily dispose of the application within six weeks. section 7 - f of the act confers revisionary powers on - state government in any case granting or refusing to grant permission.

tagline: Digyadarsan Rajendra Ramdassji ... vs State Of Andhra Pradesh & Anr on 26 March, 1969
summarized_judgment: petitioner challenged constitutional validity of ss. 46 and 47 as violative of his fundamental rights under arts. 14, 19, and under s. 46 was suspended from his office pending enquiry. he is to incur expenditure for the benefit of the institution of which he is the bead. if he cannot perform his duties either as a spiritual or a temporal head or cannot properly properly.

tagline: State Of Maharashtra vs Baishankar Avalram Joshi & ... on 10 March, 1969
summarized_judgment: state of maharashtra vs. respondent was dismissed by an order of inspector general of prisons in february 1955. he was suspended on the allegations that he committed certain acts of misappropriation and maltreatment of prisoners. a show cause notice was then issued to him to which he replied by a written statement. the state of bombay had, in the meantime, was reorganised.

tagline: Shri Vidya Prachar Trust vs Pandit Basant Ram on 21 March, 1969
summarized_judgment: the act was passed under s. 31 of the east punjab urban rent restriction act, 1934. it was intended to operate between debtors and creditors where difficulty in making the payment may arise in the debtor wishes to save himself from the consequences of the default as contemplated by s. 13 of the urban rent restrictions act.

summarized_judgment: goppulal vs. respondent - landlord let out to appellant four shops and later one let out two more shops. the appellant denied the subletting altogether, and denied the charge. the trial court reversed the court's decision, and the first appellate court upheld the decision.

tagline: Arati Paul vs The Registrar, Original Side, ... on 10 March, 1969

tagline: Ranjit Chandra Chowdhury vs Mohitosh Mukherjee on 17 March, 1969

tagline: Khem Chand Dayal Ji And Co. vs Mohammad Bhai Chand Bhai on 24 March, 1969
summarized_judgment: the appellants were to pay out of the agreed rent rs. 810 / - per month. under the agreement of lease the appial was to pay the rent of rs. 2, 171 / - - per - month. appellant's claimants agreed to pay municipal taxes and electricity charges.

summarized_judgment: judgment grover, j. 1, was the owner of the tank covering 9. 21 acres situate in khasra no. 403. section 3 provided for vesting of proprietary rights in the state and section 4 dealt with consequences of the vesting. but an inquiry was started in order to find out if conditions were satisfied.

summarized_judgment: judgment j. m. shelat, j. 1. appeal founded on a certificate granted by the high court of bombay. in the accounting year 1964 the appellant had 60 workmen on its roll. by a letter dated september 14, 1965 the workmen made a demand for 20 % bonus on their total wages for the year 1964, that being the maximum allowable under the payment of bonus act, 1965.

tagline: The State Of U.P. vs Kanwar Durgeshwar Dayal on 11 March, 1969
summarized_judgment: the respondent was a zamindar of village khaitha ghazipur in the district of sitapur. he looked at the record of rights for the year 1859 fasli where a total annual rental of rs. 612 - 2 - 6 from lakshmiji sugar mills meholi.

summarized_judgment: the geneva conventions act 6 of 1960 was passed by the indian parliament to enable effect to be given to the international conventions. india and portugal have both signed and ratified the conventions. there is no definition of the term'occupied'in the geneva convention but the convention applies under art. 47 and 49 if available to portuguese nationals in goa - court's power to give remedy.

tagline: Western U.P. Electric Power & ... vs State Of U.P. & Anr on 7 March, 1969
summarized_judgment: the appellant hold a licence under s. 3 ( 2 ) of the indian electricity act, 1910 as amended by the indian power act. the 3rd respondent made complaints to the state government that the supply of electrical energy was inadequate and fluctuating. state government order dated december 26, 1961 under's 3. 2 ( 2. 2 ) ( e ) ( 1 ) of india arts. 14 and 31, and licencee under. 1 of 2. 1 ) licencee's property without compensation.

tagline: Shaik Mohammed Umar Saheb vs Kaleskar Hasham Karimsab And Ors. on 13 March, 1969
summarized_judgment: judgment 1 is an appeal by special leave from an order of the bombay high court dismissing in limine an application under articles 226 and 227 of the constitution. the counting of votes took place with regard to ward no. 25 on june 4, 1967. the facts are as follows. 2. on june 3, 1967 election of councillors to the sangli city municipality was held under.

tagline: Muddada Chavannna vs Sri Sri Sri Kodandrama Swami Varu on 19 March, 1969
summarized_judgment: judgment shah, j. 1, is seeking to recover rent in respect of an area measuring 45 - 00 acres of inam land in urlam zamindari now in the state of andhra pradesh. the land belonged to two deities - - sri kodandarama swami varu and bala sasisekhara swami. the suit was resisted on the plea that the lands were not personal inam lands.

summarized_judgment: judgment a. n. grover, j. 1, is appeal by special leave from a judgment of the punjab high court. the appellant, who is the owner of the suit premises inducted as a tenant labha mal arora, now deceased. the facts may be succinctly stated.

tagline: Nityananda M. Joshi & Ors vs Life Insurance Corporation Of ... on 25 April, 1969
summarized_judgment: applications fell squarely within s. 33c ( 2 ) of the industrial disputes act, 1947., for computing in terms of money, the benefit of holidays, and for recovering the amount. the labour court dismissed applications insofar as the claim was for a period beyond three years, on the ground that applications were barred under art.

tagline: Assistant Commissioner Of Urban ... vs The Buckingham & Carnatic Co. ... on 11 April, 1969
summarized_judgment: madras urban land tax act was struck down on the ground that it violated art. the act was challenged by a writ petition and the impugned act. the writ was challenged in a writ appeal by the high court. it was challenged over the use of a tax on urban land at the rate of 0. 4 %.

tagline: Baldevdas Shivlal & Anr vs Filmistan Distributors (India) ... on 29 April, 1969
summarized_judgment: filmistan distributors ( india ) ( p ) ltd. & ors ( pj ) used to exhibit films in the said building. but in issue no. 12 raised the question whether the consent decree was estopped from leading evidence and asked the court to try more issues nos. 11, 12 and 13 as preliminary issues.

summarized_judgment: u. s. state electricity board under s. 6 of indian electricity act, 1910 - retrenchment compensation claimed by workmen. workmen of allahabad and lucknow were taken into the employment of the board without any break in continuity of employment. the company appealed to this court by special leave.

summarized_judgment: the appellants passed the pre - medical exam of the delhi university in april 1968. they applied for admission to the first year m. b. s. course at the maulana azad medical college in delhi was established by the government of india in 1958. the college prospectus contained certain rules relating to admission of students who made reservations of places in the college in favour of certain categories of students.

summarized_judgment: in october 1963, the respondent was the special correspondent of the appellant company and was entitled to car allowance, free telephone and free newspapers in addition to his basic salary and dearness allowance. on october 23, he accepted employment with another newspaper and claimed compensation for leave due to him. on november 21, he received a letter from appellant that appellant's rules did not permit any such compensation where an employee had resigned.

tagline: Indu Bhusan Bose vs Rama Sundari Devi & Anr on 29 April, 1969
summarized_judgment: the first respondent filed a suit for the appellant's eviction from the premises in barrackpore. in the plaint it claimed appellant was not entitled to the protection of the west bengal premises tenancy act 12 of 1956. it was claimed that appellant wasn't entitled to protection of land in genevament areas and the extension of the act to the cantonment area was ultra vires and void.

tagline: Mohd. Faruk vs State Of Madhya Pradesh And Others on 1 April, 1969
summarized_judgment: state government cancelled confirmation of bye - laws in 1948. it was contended on behalf of the respondent state that its power to rescind confirmation. if given a licence, no person may insist that he will be given licence to slaughter animals in slaughter - house. petitioner challenged constitutionality of the notification by a writ petition under art.

tagline: Union Of India, And Anr. vs R.S. Dhaba, Income-Tax Officer, ... on 7 April, 1969
summarized_judgment: order establishment - gazetted class ii servants promotion, transfer and posting of. shri ranjit singh dhaba promoted to officiate until further orders. order of the commissioner of income - tax d : april 8, 1953, is to the following effect from december 1, 1949.

tagline: Debesh Chandra Das vs Union Of India And Ors on 8 April, 1969
summarized_judgment: appellant joined the indian civil service in 1933 and was allotted to india'until'further orders'in 1964 he was appointed as secretary to the government of india " until further orders " the appellant challenged these orders by a writ petition under art 311 of the constitution on the ground that the orders were violative of art 311 ( 2 )

tagline: Management Of State Bank Of ... vs Vasudev Anant Bhide Etc on 24 April, 1969
summarized_judgment: vaidyialingam, c. a. shelat, j. m. bhargava, vishishtha citation and a... were parties to the sastry and desai awards published on march 26, 1953 and june 13, 1962 respectively. the two awards provided for the grant of allowance to head cashiers and a special allowance to supervisors.

tagline: Rt. Rev. Bishop S. K. Patro & Ors vs State Of Bihar & Ors on 2 April, 1969

summarized_judgment: the trial court convicted the respondents under s. 302 read with s. 149 and ss. 103, 99 - party of accused persons preventing theft from land by another group - causing death of two persons in attacking party - if unlawful assembly and committed offence. the court found that the land in question was in the possession of one of the respondents and that on the date of occurrence, the. victims committed thefts of fruits on the land.

tagline: State Of Orissa & Anr vs B. K. Mohapatra on 11 April, 1969
summarized_judgment: the indian police service ( regulation of seniority ) rules were framed and the appellant state constituted a committee under the draft rules. the committee prepared a list of officers'fit for trial to promotion posts'in the i. p. s. c. and the list was approved by the u. p in september 1951. in 1950, the all india services act, 1951, came into force and indian police.

tagline: State Of M.P. vs Kanhaiyalal on 21 April, 1969
summarized_judgment: judgment mitter, j. 1, is a public trust registered under the madhya pradesh public trusts act. by application dated march 5, 1962, respondent no. 4 applied for exemption in terms of the said provision stating the origin of the endowment. the government of madhya pradesh issued a notification dated may 22, 1963 reading as follows.

tagline: Rash Behari Chatterjee vs Fagu Shaw & Ors on 28 April, 1969
summarized_judgment: the appellant was not in actual possession of the property. they were convicted under s. 441 / 447 i. p. c. by the magistrate. the high court acquitted the respondents of the case land. but high court found that appellant wasn't in real possession but also be present.

tagline: S.M. Ram Lal & Co. vs Secretary To Government Of Punjab on 3 April, 1969
summarized_judgment: judgment shah, j. 1. s. m. ram lal & company appellants in woolen goods they purchase. the notified area committee of faridabad claimed to levy octroi on wool imported in wool. the court rejected the demand notice and challenged the validity of the demand. the application was moved under art. 226 of the punjab municipal act of punjab.

tagline: Pullangode Rubber And Produce Co ... vs Commissioner Of Agricultural ... on 24 April, 1969
summarized_judgment: an appeal was filed before an agricultural income tax appellate tribunal by the appellant company claiming that an amount of rs. 55, 708 received as an instalment of consideration payable under a deed dated february 19, 1962, was of the nature of capital and not income and was on that account not liable to be taxed. high court declined to answer question nos. 1 and 2, and on the third question answered by the high court.

tagline: Hari Nandan Sharan Bhatnagar vs S. N. Dixit & Anr on 25 April, 1969
summarized_judgment: the appellant entered the service of the u. p. legislative assembly in 1954 through a competitive examination held by public service commission of the state. in 1961 a vacancy occurred in the post of a superintendent in the same scale of pay as an appellant was appointed to the said post by the speaker of the assembly.

tagline: Raja Bajarang Bahadur Singh vs Jai Narain on 8 April, 1969
summarized_judgment: appellant took symbolical possession of the lands under ss. 60, 61 and 180 of the u. p. tenancy act, 1939. the appellant applied for restitution of lands before revenue court allows appeal court dismisses for default - plea that civil court had no jurisdiction to be permitted.

tagline: Krishnaji Dattatryaya Bapat vs Krishnaji Dattatryaya Bapat on 16 April, 1969
summarized_judgment: krishnaji dattatryaya bapat was dismissed by the high court last month. the respondent moved a petition under s. 115 of the code of civil procedure. thereupon the respondingent filed a revised petition under arts. 226 and 227 of the constitution challenging the same order of the appellate court.

tagline: Voleti Venkatarama Rao vs Kesapragada Bhaskara Rao & Ors on 15 April, 1969
summarized_judgment: the first respondent was r's adopted son. r was recognised by every member of the family as the adopted son of bhaskara rao & ors. in 1953, the appellant claimed to be the nearest heir of b filed a suit for recovery of possession of b's property contending that r was not competent to make the adop tion.

tagline: Abdul Gani Namthali vs Gulam Mohammad Paray on 17 April, 1969
summarized_judgment: judgment mitter, j. 1, is an appeal from a judgment and order of the high court of jammu and kashmir setting aside the election of the appellant, abdul gani namthali. the candidates of khan saheb assembly constituency were called upon to elect a member for the same under section 48 of the election petition.

tagline: Ratan Lal Shah vs Firm Lalmandas Chhadammalal & Anr on 15 April, 1969
summarized_judgment: the appellant alone appealed to the high court. m was impleaded as the'second respondent in the appeal'the appeal could not be dismissed on the ground that m was not served with the notice of appeal, nor. in view of the appeal, the appeal must be dismissed for want of prosecution.

tagline: Takhatray Shivdatray Mankad vs State Of Gujarat on 9 April, 1969
summarized_judgment: the appellant originally joined the service of the state of gujarat in 1934. in 1959 the bombay civil service rules were applied to person previously governed by saurashtra in 1956. in 1955, the old indian state was applied to a person governed by the government. but it was later laid down that they may be required to retire on reaching the age of 50 years.

tagline: Union Of India vs Jagjit Singh on 1 April, 1969
summarized_judgment: the respondent, who was appointed a sub - inspector of police, was reemployed from the date of retirement as a deputy superintendent of police. delhi police's superintendent, delhi police force, ordered the dismissal of the respondingent. the response was decreed and the decree was confirmed by the high court.

tagline: Maganti Subramanyan vs The State Of Andhra Pradesh on 17 April, 1969
summarized_judgment: the sixth respondent granted various pattas of his lands to his wife, to the appellant and others in november, 1944. a petition was filed in the district court by two ryots for a declaration that alienation of communal or forest lands was void. but a petition against this order was allowed by the high court which remitted the matter to the district judge.

tagline: State Of M.P. vs Mahant Kamal Puri on 17 April, 1969
summarized_judgment: mahant rajpuri died in 1919, succeeded by his follower tejpuri. the shrine of " basaiya mata " was founded in the year 1949. religious endowments and endowments were made by members of the public about mismanagement of the shrine properties and the worship.

tagline: Shrimati Lalithamma vs Subbanna on 9 April, 1969
summarized_judgment: judgment sikri, j. 1, declared his suit to the effect that " the appellant plaintiff aforesaid do recover possession of the suit schedule property from the respondent defendants " the high court ordered an enquiry in regard to mesne profits under order xx rule 12 ( c ), civil procedure code.

tagline: R.B. Subbaiyya vs The State Of Bihar on 28 April, 1969
summarized_judgment: appeal ib brought by a certificate under article 134 ( 1 ) ( c ) of the constitution from the judgment of the patna high court. the appellant committed criminal misconduct in the discharge of his duties as a public servant. if he habitually accepts or obtains or agrees to accept or attempts to obtain for himself or for others.

tagline: Cantonment Board, Meerut vs Naraindas & Anr on 9 April, 1969
summarized_judgment: cantonments act ( 2 of 1924 scr ), ss. 185 and 187 - kiosk over drain belonging to cantonment board - direction for removal 18 years after construction - competency of board. owner of shop constructed stone projection over the drain to facilitate approach to shop. but without permission, he put up a stone projection on the stone projection.

tagline: Raj Kumar Mohan Singh & Ors vs Raj Kumar Pasupatinath Saran ... on 29 April, 1969
summarized_judgment: the oudh estates act 1 of 1869 provided for the preparation of lists of taluqdars and grantees. upon the death of the widow of the deceased talusqdar, her adopted son, settlor, had so, long as the widow was alive no interest in the estate under ordinary hindu law.

tagline: Yuvraj Digvijay Singh vs Yuvrani Pratap Kumari on 2 May, 1969
summarized_judgment: the appellant married the respondent according to hindu rites on april 20, 1955. but the marriage was not consummated and neither party proved impotent. appellant filed an application before the district judge at delhi on march 15, 1960. he averred that his wife had an invincible repugnance to the act of consummation.

tagline: Lnanak Chand vs Shri Chandra Kishore Agarwala And ... on 20 May, 1969
summarized_judgment: appellant's four children filed an application under s. 488 of the criminal procedure code in september 1963 for an order requiring the appellant to pay maintenance. the application was dismissed but one filed by the respondents was allowed to pay them maintenance. it was argued on behalf of appellant that ( i'm. law ) was impliedly repealed by s. 4 of the hindu adoptions and maintenance act 78 of 1958.

tagline: Abdul Rajak Murtaja Dafedar vs State Of Maharashtra on 2 May, 1969
summarized_judgment: abdul rajak murtaja dafedar was convicted for the offence of murder in which he removed fish plates, nuts and bolts of a rail joint. he spent four days in judicial custody - and was not under the influence of the investigating agency. he was convicted of the offence in that he had removed the fish plates and nuts. in appeal to this court it was contended that confession was not voluntary because it was made after prolonged custody of about a fortnight.

tagline: Municipal Corporation Of Delhi vs Jagdish Lal Son Of Radhakishan & ... on 27 May, 1969
summarized_judgment: a complaint under s. 7 read with s. 16 of the prevention of food adulteration act, 1964 was filed against the respondent. the appellant corporation filed an application in the high court for special leave to appeal. the application was allowed. when the appeal came up for hearing a preliminary objection was raised by the respondingent.

tagline: Pankaj Kumar Chakrabarty And Ors vs State Of West Bengal on 1 May, 1969
summarized_judgment: petitioners who were detained under ss. 3 ( 1 ) and 3 ( 2 ) of the preventive detention act, 1950, made representations to the government. the petitioners filed a writ of habeas, corpus, challenging their detentions on the ground that the state government had failed to carry out its obligation.

tagline: State Of Madras vs Davar And Company Etc on 20 May, 1969
summarized_judgment: sales were effected after ships carrying the goods arrived in the madras harbour in the state of madras. the assessee entered into contracts for sale of timber to be imported from burma, to buyers. if the goods crossed the customs frontiers of india, they were therefore not liable to sales - tax tinder art.

tagline: Juggilal Kamlapat, Kanpur vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 31 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: the assessee firm purchased all the shares of a company at the ruling rates with borrowed money and very soon thereafter disposed of all of them at a profit. before the income - tax authorities the company had to pay for the amount borrowed for purchasing the shares was debited in its revenue account.

tagline: Rayala Corporation (P) Ltd. & Ors vs Director Of Enforcement, New ... on 23 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: two appellants were seized in a bank account in sweden instead of surrendering the foreign exchange to an authorised dealer as required by the act. the second appellant was the first appellant's managing director. a similar appellant is the only appellant in the u. s. history of the act, but it is not known if it was in existence.

tagline: Income-Tax Officer, Alleppey vs M.C. Ponnoose & Ors on 28 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: notification was made effective from april 1962 but prior to august 14, 1963. notification empowers the district district council to exercise powers of a tax recovery officer with retrospective effect. a petition under art. 226 of the constitution was filed challenging the, action of the district bench in appeal.

tagline: Income-Tax Officer, Special ... vs M/S. Seth Brothers And Ors on 15 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: income tax officer, special investigationcircle - b, meerut vs. respondent. he may seize books or documents and place marks of identification on them, and may remove them to the income - tax office. indian lncome tax act ( 43 of 1961 ), s. 132 of the income tax act, 1961.

tagline: V. Jaganmohan Rao And Ors. vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax And ... on 31 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: the assessee, who is the karta of a hindu undivided family, was assessed in that status for the relevant assessment years 1944 - 45, 1946 - 47. the purchase was made at a period when there was litigation between the sons of the vendor and the vendor in respect of the spinning mill.

tagline: A.K. Jain & Ors vs Union Of India & Ors on 25 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: appellants were the office bearers of a sugar concern. they had failed to pay to the sellers within the time prescribed the price of them. a complaint with the police was lodged against them under sub - rule 3 of rule 3. the order, 1955, read with s. 7 of the essential commodities act, 1955.

tagline: M..C. Chacko vs State Bank Of Travancore, ... on 23 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: state bank of travancore, trivandrum date of judgment. appellant's father executed deed giving away his properties to the appellant, and other members of the family. court declared suit against the debtor bank and also'against appellant limited to the property received by him fro.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs V. Jagan Mohan Rao & Ors on 31 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: the assessee purchased a spinning mill in 1941 from a vendor claiming to be its sole proprietor. the court decided that the property including the spinning mill was the self - acquired property of the vendor but was coparcenary property in which the sons had two thirds interest. the appellate assistant commissioner and the tribunal upheld the income - tax act, 1922.

tagline: Dyer Meakin Breweries Ltd. vs State Of Kerala on 31 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: the appellant - company is registered as a dealer in " indian made foreign liquor " under the kerala general sales tax act, 1963. it is the practice of the company to maintain a uniform " ex - factory price " in respect of each brand of liquor and liquor is sold at different centers.

tagline: State Of Kerala vs A.B. Abdul Khadir & Ors on 30 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: a. b. abdul khadir & ors filed a writ petition in the high court in kalvani stores v. state of kerala. the appellant - state made a demand on the respondent to repay the amount which had been refunded to respondent in accordance with aforesaid judgment.

tagline: Gita Devi Aggarwal vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, West ... on 31 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: appellant ( hereinafter referred to as " the assessee " married in 1961 and after marriage she started business in hessian and silver speculation. appellant moved high court under article 226 of the constitution for the grant of a writ. a rule nisi was issued by b. e. banerjee j. on july 20, 1964.

tagline: Dhian Singh vs Municipal Board, Saharanpur on 31 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: appeals court acquitted appellant in appeal by municipal board under s. 417 ( 3 ) code of criminal procedure ( act 5 of 1898 ) the appellant did not raise any objection as to the maintainability of the appeal. if the complaint was filed, it was competent for the municipal board to authorise the food inspector to file complaint.

tagline: Madan Raj Bhandari vs State Of Rajasthan on 29 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: the appellant was acquitted of abetting a woman who died in the attempt. he was charged with abetting the woman in the commission of the offence. high court erred in holding that rule laid down in gallu sah v. the state of rajasthan, [ 1959 ] r. 861.

tagline: State Of Orissa vs Chandra Sekhar Singh Bhoi Etc on 15 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: act 16 of 1960 - ch. iv containing ceiling provisions was amended by act 15 of 1965. new ceiling provisions substituted fixing compensation not at market value. section 1 ( 3 ) of act dealing with ceiling of holdings of land was not brought into force by notifications. but chapter iv of act amending act 13 of 1965 and substituted fresh provisions.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs Nalin Behari Lal Singha Etc on 25 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: the definition of dividend in s. 2 ( 6a ) is an inclusive definition and a receipt by share - holders which does not fall within the charge of tax. but the appellate assistant commissioner held that a part of the total amount distributed represented capital gains and not accumulated profits of the company.

tagline: T.G. Venkataraman Etc vs State Of Madras & Anr on 17 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: india's madras general sales tax act was amended by madras act 2 of 1968. but by notification under s. 17'palm jaggery'was exempted from tax'cane jaggery was exempt from tax. in appeal it was contended that the tax on'plantation'was discriminatory and violative of art.

tagline: Amarchand Sobhachand vs Commissioner Of Income Tax, ... on 29 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: supreme court will not interfere with finding of fact given by tribunal on facts. claim was disallowed by authorities under income tax act, 1922. appellants claimed allowance for rs. 268385 - 1 - 3. in return of income for assessment year 1953 - 54 appellant's allowance was a bad debt written off as irrecoverable.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax ... vs Mcleod & Co. Ltd. on 15 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: an order of the calcutta high court in income - tax reference no. 99 of 1966 passed on june 18, 1968. the appellate assistant commissioner disallowed the claim on the ground that the irregularities arose in connection with the fictitious transactions indulged in by the company which were detected by its auditors after investigation. a appellate court allowed the respondent's claim for deduction accepting deductions.

tagline: The Workmen Employed In B & C Mills, ... vs The Management Of B & C Mills, ... on 31 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: the dispute that was referred for adjudication related to the legality of the order passed by the management dismissing a worker, loganathan, from service. a charge - sheet, exhibit m - 8, was issued on october 18 1965 alleging that the worker committed certain acts which amounted to misconduct under standing order 13 ( d ) and though he was liable for summary dismissal, the management gave him an opportunity to state his defence to the charges.

tagline: State Of Kerala vs K.E. Nainan on 29 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: ruling a. n. grover, j. 1 appeals by special leave from the judgment of the high court of kerala involves a common question. he was conducting auction sales of cardamom having taken out a licence under section 9 of the act. the assessment years with which we are concerned in these appeals are 1955 - 56 and 1956 - 57.

tagline: Satyanarayana Modi vs The Controller Of Estate Duty, ... on 31 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: the receipts were renewed in the joint names of herself and s. j. c. after the death of p on february 15, 1956, the two receipts were encashed by s. s. the previous receipts were resentful and out of the amount realised a part was invested in the name of s in national savings certificates.

tagline: Management, Ghaziabad ... vs Its Workmen on 18 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: gratuity payable to a workman on termination of employment was to be calculated on the total wage packet of the workman. the tribunal also awarded dearness allowance at a flat rate for every 10 point rise in the cost of consumer price index. a departure may be made from the normal rule, if there by some strong evidence or precedent in the industry.

tagline: Ramchand (Dead) By Legal ... vs Thakur Janki Ballabhji Maharaj ... on 23 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: suit no. 41 of 1947 was filed in the court of the civil judge, mathura by thakur janki ballabhji maharaj. case of the plaintiffs was that the ruler of bharatpur built the temple at brindaban and installed the idol. ramchand was not performing the seva puja of the deity but failed to execute the agreement.

tagline: Jothi Timber Mart & Others vs Corporation Of Callcut & Another on 18 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: the state legislature was incompetent to enact section 126 of calicut city municipal act 30 of 1961. but this decision was reversed in appeal by a division bench. it was contended in appeal that the high court wrongly considered entry of timber into the city could only be for consumption, use or sale within the municipality.

tagline: Benaras State Bank Ltd vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 25 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: the appellant - bank ( assessee ) was a share - holder in a company that declared a dividend on july 25, 1949. the dividend was sought to be taxed in the assessment year 1950 - 51, but the assessee contended that dividend income was exempt from tax under s. 14 ( 2 ) ( c ), as it stood in the year of assessment ; and that it must be deemed to be eligible for tax.

tagline: Union Of India (Uoi) vs R.V. Sada Siva Murthy on 15 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: judgment shah, j. 1. r. v. sadasiva murthy respondent in this appeal was a " superior service " employee of the indian railway administration. he moved a petition in the high court of mysore for an order declaring that the railway administration was to continue him in service till he reached 60 years.

tagline: Fazal Hussain And Arshad Ahmad vs The State Of Jammu And Kashmir on 29 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: the first petitioner's detention under s. 3 ( 1 ) was illegal on the basis that no grounds of detention were served on him. it is the duty of the detaining authority to communicate grounds. if the case does not fall within the proviso to s. 8, it would not have the effect of rendering detention legal.

tagline: Ayesha Bibi vs Commissioner Of Wakfs, West ... on 15 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: the commissioner of wakfs, west bengal & ors, was joined as defendant to the suit. the commissioner made an application under s. 70 ( 4 ) of the act, 1934 forstriking off the name of the commissioner from the array of defendants. the complaint was made against respondents 2 to 4 who were the mutawalis.

tagline: Thakur Janki Ballabhji Maharaj & ... vs Thakur Janki Ballabhji Maharaj & ... on 23 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: thakur janki ballabhji maharaj & anr installed in temple at brindaban. it was alleged in the plaint temple was built by the ruler of bharatpur who had dedicated it to the deity. the high court rejected the defendant's plea based on s. 92 of the code of civil procedure.

tagline: Sardar Malojirao Narsinghrao ... vs State Of M.P. on 14 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: judgment mitter, j. 1, is the claim of the plaintiff - appellant to compensation for loss of his right to levy customs duty as a jagirdar of the former state of gwalior. the right in respect of which he claims compensation in this appeal was taken away.

tagline: State Of Assam vs Harisingh on 16 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: the first respondent offered a bid of rs. 6, 667 - 67 in october 1963. the fourth respondent safique uddin offered rs 6, 543 - 67 ps. the appeal was subject to an appeal to the conservator of forests. the high court of judicature for assam & nagaland has in a petition.

tagline: Jamnadas vs Smt. Radhabai on 14 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: judgment mitter, j. 1, rejects an appeal by defendant appellant. court dismisses an appeal and upholds the claim of the plaintiff - respondent to declaration of her title and for possession of the suit property. the facts are as follows a judgment and decree of the high court of madhya pradesh dismiss an appeal.

tagline: Ram Prasad Sharma vs The State Of Bihar on 30 July, 1969
summarized_judgment: the appellant was tried for an offence under s. 302 i. p. c. as well as for other offences in connection with an incident in which two persons were killed and several injured. in appeal the high court convicted appellant for causing the death of k. he died three days before the alleged incident.

tagline: Hindustan Steel Ltd vs State Of Orissa on 4 August, 1969
summarized_judgment: the appellant - company was erecting its factory buildings and other ancillary constructions through buildings contractors. the difference between the sale price and the cost price was a flat percentage of the cost of the product. the court agreed on the liability to pay tax, reduced the penalty, and the high court confirmed the tribunal's order.

tagline: Maula Bux vs Union Of India on 19 August, 1969
summarized_judgment: act ( 9 of 1872 ), s. 74 deposit of money as guarantee for due performance of contract for supply of goods - breach of contract. appellant filed suit for recovery of amount with interest. high court awarded'respondent a major portion of the amount deposited as damages '

tagline: Baijnath Kedia vs State Of Bihar & Ors on 28 August, 1969
summarized_judgment: hidayatullah, m. bhargava, vishishtha hegde, k. s. grover, a. j. m. patel, was the benchmarker for the entry. the corresponding entry under the government of india act, 1935 was entry 36, which also included mines and mineral development. entry 36 of list i entry under india act was declared by parliament by law to be expedient in the public interest.

tagline: Mackinnon Mackenzie & Co. Pvt. Ltd vs Ibrahim Mahommed Issak on 14 August, 1969
summarized_judgment: the new commissioner did not commit any error of law in reaching his findings and high court was not justified in reversing them. the words " in the course of employment " mean in the " course of work, " meaning that the seaman was dead and there was no evidence to justify the assertion that the death of the seaman occurred.

tagline: Ouseph Varghese vs Joseph Aley & Ors on 18 August, 1969
summarized_judgment: the plaintiff as original owner of the suit properties sold the same to the 1st defendant who was husband of the 2nd defendant. both parties have withheld facts from court. the case was filed for specific performance of the said oral agreement. the trial court granted the defendant a decree directing the defendant to execute a sale deed.

tagline: Lala Mata Din vs A. Narayanan on 25 August, 1969
summarized_judgment: the appellant's suit against the respondent for rendition of account and other reliefs was valued at rs. 5, 930 / - for purposes of court fee and jurisdiction. the appeal was filed in the high court the same day, but it was out of time. appellant also filed a revision against the order of the district court.

tagline: Jitendra Bahadur Singh vs Krishna Behari & Ors on 13 August, 1969
summarized_judgment: the first respondent challenged the election of the appellant to the lok sabha. he said only one counting agent of the defeated candidate was permitted at each table where three persons were counted simultaneously. he was the counting agent and had personal knowledge of the elected candidate. but he was not stated in the petition who the workers were and what was the basis of information.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs Shaila Behari Lal Singha on 21 August, 1969
summarized_judgment: the high court had to decide on the facts of each case whether any amount of salami was capital gain. high court asked whether the amount distributed to the assessee out of the amount attributable to salamis realised by the company for grant of leases of land was a receipt of'dividend'within the meaning of s. 2 ( 6a ) of the act.

tagline: K.C. Nambiar vs The Iv Judge Of The Court Of Small ... on 18 August, 1969
summarized_judgment: the high court dismissed the application of a writ of prohibition against the controller restraining him from proceeding with an application for fixation of fair rent. the court of madras said the fair rent for any non - residential building is to be fixed on the total cost of such building and under sub - s. 3 ( b )

tagline: Commissioner Of Wealth-Tax, ... vs Tungabhadra Industries Ltd., ... on 8 August, 1969
summarized_judgment: india's commissioner of wealth - tax was assessed for the assessment years 1957 - 58, 1958 - 59 and 1959 - 60. in computing the net wealth of the respondent on the respective valuation dates the wealth tax officer proceeded under s. 7 ( 2 ) ( a ) of the act and included the full value of the fixed assets as shown in balance - sheet and written down value of assets. appellate assistant commissioner confirmed the valuation but the income - tax appellate tribunal held in'favour '

tagline: Agra Electric Supply Co. Ltd vs Sri Alladin & Ors on 12 August, 1969
summarized_judgment: standing order 32 workedmen employed in the company in 1929, 1935 and 1937. standing orders were certified under the industrial employment act, 1946, and were brought into force. standing order has been certified long after these workmen were employed. stood order 32 provided 55 years as the age of superannuation in the appellant - company.

tagline: Budhan Singh & Anr vs Nabi Bux & Anr on 20 August, 1969
summarized_judgment: the appellants were granted over sixty years ago a village site by the ancestors of appellant's built their residential houses. in 1947 riots the respondents in order to seek safety fled from the village temporarily and came back in 1949. in 1951, the site was built on the aforesaid site, which was built in place of tenants'building - tenant returning - tenant.

tagline: Badri Pershad vs Smt. Kanso Devi on 26 August, 1969
summarized_judgment: a hindu, owning his self - acquired properties, died in 1947 leaving five sons and a widow. in 1950, an arbitrator was appointed for dividing the assets and liabilities among heirs. the words'possessed'and'acquired'in s. 14 ( 1 ) are used with the widest possible : meaning, so that, the'acquisition'can be in any manner.

tagline: Ahmed G.H. Ariff & Ors vs Commissioner Of Wealth Tax, ... on 20 August, 1969
summarized_judgment: a hanafi muslim created a wakf - alal - aulad and appointed himself as the sole mutwalli. the ultimate benefit in the case of complete intestacy was reserved for poor musalmans of sunni community deserving help on the question whether the right of the assessee was an asset assessable to wealth tax.

tagline: Kabul Singh vs Kundan Singh & Ors on 13 August, 1969
summarized_judgment: kabul singh vs. respondent challenged the election of the appellant on the ground that the vote of h should have been held to be void as his name was included in the electoral roll after last date for filing nominations. in the elections to the punjab legislative council from the local authorities constituency hegde, k. s. ray, a. n. citation, was declared elected.

tagline: Bhudan Singh And Anr. vs Nabi Bux And Anr. on 20 August, 1969
summarized_judgment: section 9 of the u. p. zamindari abolition and and reforms act, 1950 ( u. s. act 1 of 1951 ) came up for decision in this appeal by certificate. facts relevant for deciding this appeal are no more in dispute. section 9 deals with the buildings in the abadi.

tagline: Seth Badri Prasad vs Srimati Kanso Devi on 26 August, 1969
summarized_judgment: gajju mal had five sons, ganesh das, devi chand, narain das and ishar das. the first four were by his first wife, whereas the 5th son ishar. the court ruled that she was a limited owner of the property which had been given to her by the court.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax ... vs India Discount Co. Ltd on 7 August, 1969
summarized_judgment: a dealer in shares and securities purchased certain shares on which dividends were in arrears. the value of the shares represented the stock - in - trade of the assessee remained the same both in the opening and closing stocks. the high court said the amount was not liable to tax as it was merely a realisation of the capital.

tagline: Hira H. Advani Etc vs State Of Maharashtra on 13 August, 1969
summarized_judgment: the appellants and two others were prosecuted on a complaint by the assistant collector of customs, bombay for the offence of conspiracy and substantive offences. the accused were also convicted of certain other charges individually framed for conspiracy and offences committed under s. 167 ( 81 ) of the sea customs act and s. 5 of the imports and exports ( control ) act 1947.

tagline: Smt. Sitabai And Anr. vs Ramchandra on 20 August, 1969
summarized_judgment: judgment of madhya pradesh high court dated september 7, 1965 in second appeal no. 275 of 1962. 2. dulichand and bhagirath were brothers and the properties concerned are. the court held that defendant no. 2 became the son of plaintiff no. 1 in 1958 from the date of adoption and did not obtain coparcenary interest in joint family properties.

tagline: Chandrakant Kalyandas Kakodar vs The State Of Maharashtra And Ors on 25 August, 1969
summarized_judgment: writer and publisher of the story were convicted under section 292 i. p. c. on a charge of obscenity. the story was found guilty under section i of the case. it is the duty of the court to consider the article, story or book by taking an overall view of the entire work.

tagline: Jullundur Rubber Goods ... vs Union Of India & Anr on 25 August, 1969

summarized_judgment: the appellant filed writ petitions in the high court of rajasthan challenging the appointment of principals of three medical colleges affiliated to the university of rajasthan under art. they were defended on the basis of the proviso to sub - r. ( 4 ) of r. 30 of the constitution. the provision in ordinance 65 could not be accepted.

tagline: Kalianna Gounder vs Palani Gounder & Anr on 17 September, 1969
summarized_judgment: appellant agreed on july 4, 1956 to purchase lands from the respondents for rs. 2, 000 were paid as advance by appellant to the respondents was executed by both parties. court reversed the decree and decreed the suit. appellant and the appellant were liable to clear encumbrances on the land before executing the sale.

tagline: Mahal Chand Sethia vs State West Of Bengal on 10 September, 1969
summarized_judgment: appellant impugs the west bengal criminal law amendment ( special courts ) amending ordinance, 1965 as also act xxviii of 1965 which replaced the ordinance. the facts are as follows. eighty one persoa including the appellant had been charged with offences under sections 120 - b, 417 and 409 i. p. c.

tagline: Kshetra Gogoi vs State Of Assam on 19 September, 1969
summarized_judgment: petitioner was put in detention in pursuance of an order dated august 29, 1968. he presented a petition under art. 32 of the constitution for the issue of a write of habeas corpus. the order of detention was issued on august 28, 1968, a day before the expiry of the previous order.

tagline: Shankar Kerba Jadhav & Ors vs State Of Maharashtra on 8 September, 1969

tagline: Mohan Lal And Anr. And Raghbir ... vs Delhi Administration on 23 September, 1969
summarized_judgment: the high court of delhi allowed the state appeal and substantially rejected the appeal of raghbir sirgh. the trial judge acquitted, accused mohan lal and raj singh of all the offences with which they were charged. both were sentenced to life, under section 302 / 34, and sentenced to death under the murder charge.

tagline: Satya Charan Dutta vs Urmilla Sundari Dassi & Ors on 9 September, 1969
summarized_judgment: under ss. 15 and 16 of the hindu succession act, 1956, deal with rules regarding succession to the property of a female hindu. in class 11, there are ix entries and only in entries 11, 111 and iv the heirs are mentioned as against arabic numerals. if the intention was to give preference among the heirs specified in class i shall take simultaneously.

tagline: Mulshankar Ojha And Anr. vs Chunilal Ojha on 25 September, 1969
summarized_judgment: purshotta'm was a resident of halvad in the former indian state of dhrangadhara in kathiawar. his sons laxmishankar and narbharam moved to cuttack in orissa around the year 1905 and set themselves up in a business of brick making.

tagline: N.S. Rajabathar Mudaliar vs M.S. Vadivelu Mudaliar & Ors on 9 September, 1969

tagline: Ram Narain Mahto vs State Of Madhya Pradesh on 16 September, 1969
summarized_judgment: jagirdar executed a deed in 1949 in favour of the appellant for the sale of logs of a specified girth to be obtained from standing trees. the high court in appeal disallowed the claim, under items ( ii ) and ( iii ) and ) iii. the court ruled that it could not be enforced against it because of the vesting of the bark.

tagline: A.K. Gopalan And Another vs Noordeen on 15 September, 1969
summarized_judgment: first information report was lodged on sept. 23, 1967. the second appellant was the editor printed the statement of the first appellant. it was charged with contempt of court, but was later acquitted. the case is expected to last until the next day when police make a report under s. 173 cr. p. c.

tagline: Munni Devi & Anr vs Gokal Chand & Ors on 12 September, 1969

summarized_judgment: u. p. encumbered estates act, 1934, and a decree was passed under s. 14 ( 7 ) of the act in 1938. most of the debts were secured. on the application of landlords proceedings were taken under the u. s. 24 of the estates act. the recipients applied to recover the amount declared to them.

tagline: Dedh Nathu Raja (Dead) By L. Rs vs L. Angha Nathu Jamal (Dead) By L. Rs ... on 16 September, 1969
summarized_judgment: the states reorganisation act, 1956, merged part'b'state of saurashtra into the state of bombay and high court in part b state. the act was transferred to bombay high court - letters patent, cl. 15 - - judgment of single judge in first appeal appealable without certificate.

tagline: R.V.M. Neeladri Rao & Anr vs Board Of Revenue, Hyderabad & Ors on 23 September, 1969
summarized_judgment: appellants were the transferees of lease - hold rights granted by the owner of an impartible estate in respect of lands in the estate. but no interest was paid on the rent collected as rent till the termination of the lease period. the appellant's lease was terminated, the unexpired portion of its lease period being 26 years.

tagline: Jeewan Nath Wahal & Ors vs Sheikh Mahfooz Jan & Ors on 8 September, 1969

tagline: Sheo Lal And Ors vs Sultan & Ors on 15 September, 1969
summarized_judgment: shelat, j. m. ramaswami, v. m in 1935, rejected application relegating parties to suit in view of complicated questions of fact and law involved - - if art. 14 of the limitation act, 1908 applied for redemption of the mortgage in favour of m and granted a decree of redemption of november 1941.

tagline: Management Of Rashtradoot, ... vs Rajasthan Working Journalist ... on 22 September, 1969
summarized_judgment: dinesh khare claimed to be entitled as working journalist to get rs. 25 per mensem as interim relief with effect from 1 may 1964. the matter was brought to the notice of the labour department and the deputy labour commissioner. the government of rajasthan thereupon referred the matter to the labour court for adjudioation.

tagline: Kashmiri Lal vs State Of Uttar Pradesh on 2 September, 1969
summarized_judgment: appellant was convicted under s. 3 of the railway stores act, 1955. appellant's conviction was confirmed by the high court. he gave evidence and made a categorical statement that he could not say if the articles were auctioned in the market or not. the appellant, who was convicted, was convicted and sentenced to life in prison.

tagline: Sheolal And Ors. vs Sultan And Ors. on 15 September, 1969

tagline: Shamlal And Ors. Etc. vs Amarnath And Ors. on 17 September, 1969
summarized_judgment: high court in appeal came to conclusion that they are not entitled to succeed to the estate in question. the court answered the question in the affirmative but high court didn't say whether the daughters of a deceased son of a hindu woman are entitled to. shri bool chand's husband died in 2008 after he was adopted by his wife.

tagline: Estates Development Ltd vs Union Of India & Ors on 22 September, 1969
summarized_judgment: the appellant company purchased certain land in kapurthala in 1950. after partition of india, the company, on the basis of a sale deed, was allotted certain land. order of cheif settlement commissioner must be quashed on ground that there is no finding of the chief settlement commissioner.

tagline: State Of Assam And Anr. vs Biraja Mohan Deb And Ors. on 16 September, 1969
summarized_judgment: judgment grower, j. 1, quashed order of assistant director of public instruction. he was re - employed as a temporary lower division assistant in the office of the 0 c. 21. in addition to the pension which he was drawing, the salary scale was 60 - 4 - 80 - eb - 5 - 125.

tagline: Mangi Lal vs State Of Maharashtra on 9 September, 1969
summarized_judgment: appellant was convicted under el. 3 of the maharashtra foodgrains ( declaration of stock ) order, 1964. the appellant appealed unsuccessfully to the sessions judge. but the high court set aside the conviction and sentence under r. 125 ( a ) rule if ultra vires as contravening s. 114 evidence act. the only provision for forfeiture of juar - - defence of india rules.

tagline: The District Board Of ... vs Sri Hans Raj Gupta & Co. Pvt. Ltd. on 1 September, 1969
summarized_judgment: the respondent was allowed to hire kolhus and karhais to villagers living in muzaffarnagar district. a writ petition filed by the respondingent was granted in may 1961. the request was rejected by the district board. the case was the power of the appellant to make byelaws under section 174 ( 1 ) of the act.

tagline: Sham Lal & Ors. Etc vs Amar Nath & Ors on 17 September, 1969
summarized_judgment: the order of succession was outlined in yajnyawalkya's text as :'kinsmen take it, if she die without issue'a hindu widow, who was married in an approved form of marriage, died leaving stridhana which was not shulka.

tagline: Mangat Rai vs State Of Madhya Pradesh on 1 September, 1969
summarized_judgment: madhya pradesh general sales tax act 1958 ( 2 ), ( 3 ) and ( 4 ) power of search and inspection of account books could be open to inspection by the commissioner. if commissioner does so, he cannot be said to seize the account books. in the act, the inspector tried to prevent removal of the books in a clandestine manner by forcibly taking possession of them, the appellant used criminal force and was convicted under ss. 353 and 506 ( 1 ) of the act.

tagline: Nilkanth And Anr. vs The State Of Maharashtra on 1 September, 1969
summarized_judgment: judgment p. jaganmohan reddy, j. 1 : appeal by special leave is against the judgement of the bombay high court confirming the conviction of the appellants under sections 447 and 426 of the indian penal code but enhancing the sentences after giving notice to the app depots. they were charged and sentenced each of them to pay a fine of rs. 75 / - under section 143, in default to suffer rigorous imprisonment for 7 days.

tagline: Maganlal Bhikamchand Mehar vs Mulchand Jawarmal Nahar (Dead) By ... on 11 September, 1969
summarized_judgment: judgment shah, j. 1, reversed the decree passed by the high court and dismissed the plaintiff's suit. shah's appeal with certificate was partially but high court reversed. court reversed the decision, but the court reversed its decision and dismissed it. the dispute in that behalf was referred to arbitration for the civil court.

summarized_judgment: contract was entered into between appellant and the respondent in 1964 for sale of 200 bags of cone yarn. the appellant was not a member of the said chamber of commerce, but the response was on dispute between the parties and the directors of the court of arbitration of the indian chamber and ss. 5 and 11 or s. 30 of the act.

tagline: P. Hanumanthiah & Company vs Union Of India (Uoi) on 15 September, 1969

tagline: State Of Mysore vs S.V.G. Iyengar on 1 September, 1969
summarized_judgment: state of mysore v. g. iyengar date of judgment in 1956. india reorganisation act came into force, red the respondent was allotted to appellant - state. but in 1961, he was permitted 10 retire and all disciplinary proceedings were dropped altogether. but he was allowed 10 retires and all the disciplinary proceedings against him were dropped.

tagline: Govinda Pillai Gopala Pillai vs Ayyapan Pillai And Ors. on 24 September, 1969
summarized_judgment: judgment grover, j. 1, is an appeal by special leave from a judgment of the kerala high court. the facts may be briefly stated. ayyappan pillai was joined as a second plaintiff on the allegation that he had been assigned all the claims.

summarized_judgment: the income - tax officer held that the income was taxable because the land was leased for clear felling by the father of the appellant. the appellate assistant commissioner confirmed the assessment order. the appeal must be dismissed from the high court, which orders the court to submit to the court.

tagline: The Estates Development Ltd. (In ... vs The Union Of India (Uoi) And Ors. on 22 September, 1969
summarized_judgment: the appellant - company ( hereinafter ) was incorporated with its registered office in the city of jullundur dealing in sale and purchase of land as its substantial business. the land was located in village monanpura of district sheikupura, now in west pakistan. a sanad no k2 / 4 / 8 dated march 1950 was issued in favour of the company.

tagline: In The Matter Of Durga Show And Ors. vs Unknown on 2 September, 1969
summarized_judgment: three petitions under article 32 of the constitution are by three persons detained under the preventive detention act, on the ground that their detention was necessary in order to maintain supplies and services essential to the community. in the case of the detenu durga show in writ petition no. 205 of 1969, the facts given in the counter affidavit filed on behalf of the state government show that his representation was rejected by the government on 16th august, 1969.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax ... vs Daulatram Rawatmall on 10 September, 1969
summarized_judgment: penalty could be levied on the assessee under section 28 ( 1 ) of the indian income - tax act, 1922, for concealment of rs. 5, 00, 000 in the name of r. p. agarwal. the high court was not justified in dismissing the petition without recording any reasons.

tagline: Jalgaon District Central ... vs Pundalikrao Laxmanrao ... on 3 September, 1969

tagline: The State Of Madhya Pradesh vs Brijmohandas And Ors. on 1 September, 1969

tagline: Chunilal Kothari And Ors. vs Smt. Gopi Devi Mimani And Ors. on 19 September, 1969
summarized_judgment: judgment grover, j. 1, is an appeal by certificate from a judgment of the calcutta high court. in may 1953, meghraj kothari died in calcutta. in 1953, smt. gopi devi mimani filed a petition in the high court for grant of letters of administration to her estate be granted.

tagline: Nidamarthi Surayya And Anr. vs Parvathneni Ramakrishnaih And ... on 24 September, 1969
summarized_judgment: the land came to respondent 3 under a deed of settlement dated februarys, 1944 executed by her mother in her favour. on june 15, 1950 respondent, 3 and her husband executed an agreement for sale ( ex b - 9 ), in favour of respondent 2 and received rs. 5, 400 / - at the time of the sale deed and the balance of rs. 15, 000 / - - each.

tagline: Pandit Sadayatan Pandey vs Motilal Bandhu Sahu And Anr. on 11 September, 1969

summarized_judgment: the appellant company was assessed to excise duty on the consumption of " nitro - cellulose lacquer " produced by it. the company invoked revisional jurisdiction of the central government under s. 36 of the act. but no personal hearing was girven to the company.

tagline: Nathulal vs Phoolchand on 16 October, 1969
summarized_judgment: the appellant agreed in writing to sell a ginning factory in madhya pradesh and the agricultural land on which, it stood, to the respondent for a sum off rs. 43, 077. the land in question stood entered in the revenue records in the name of appellant's brother. appellant filed the present appeal with certificate but high court reversed the decision.

tagline: A. K. K. Nambiar vs Union Of India & Anr on 28 October, 1969
summarized_judgment: appellant was appointed to the indian police service in 1935. in 1956 he was posted as inspector - general of police for revision of police standing orders. appellant filed a writ petition in the high court at delhi and failed there filed an appeal in this court. the appellant's contentions that fell for consideration were ( i ) under sub - r. ( 1 ) of r. 7 of the all india service rules.

tagline: Coffee Board, Bangalore vs Joint Commercial Tax Officer, ... on 29 October, 1969
summarized_judgment: sale of coffee outside india is'in the course of export'from india. coffee is controlled under the coffee act 7 of 1942, to registered exporters. the coffee board has prepared a set of rules which prohibit the sale of goods. the government is not being a citizen who can enforce rights under art.

tagline: Rabindra Nath Bose & Ors vs Union Of India & Ors on 9 October, 1969
summarized_judgment: petitioners were recruited - as income tax officers class i grade ii by competitive examination and to make selection to it from existing class ii officers. petition is barred by laches - confirmed assistant commissioners of income - tax must not be disturbed by delayed appeal to fundamental rights. the government of india said it was necessary to re - organise the entire service of income. the main idea was to create class i cadre officers service and make selection from class ii.

tagline: Navalkha & Sons vs Sri Ramanya Das & Ors on 27 October, 1969
summarized_judgment: the company judge appointed commissioners for sale in accordance with the terms and conditions mentioned in his order. they applied to the judge for confirmation of sale, but before the sale in favour of the appellant was confirmed. a third person made an offer of a larger amount complaining that he couldn't make the offer earlier as there was no adequate publicity.

tagline: Oudh Sugar Mills Ltd., Etc. vs Union Of India (Uoi) And Ors. on 17 October, 1969

tagline: Chandramouleshwar Prasad vs Patna High Court & Ors on 7 October, 1969

tagline: Shree Hanuman Cotton Mills & Ors vs Tata Air-Craft Ltd on 28 October, 1969
summarized_judgment: the appellant paid rs. 2, 50, 000 on the date of the contract and it was agreed between the parties that the balance should be paid in two instalments. under cl. 9 of the respondent's terms of business were made part of the terms and conditions gov - erning the contract.

tagline: Remington Rand Of India Ltd vs The Workmen on 17 October, 1969

tagline: Dewan Singh vs Champat Singh & Ors on 17 October, 1969
summarized_judgment: the appellant filed a suit for passing a decree in terms of the award on november 1, 1956. the arbitrators made their award, on the basis of their personal knowledge. afp :'in whatever manner'they think. arbits must act in accordance with the principles of natural natural natural resources '

tagline: Workmen Of M/S. Delhi Cloth And ... vs Management Of M/S. Delhi Cloth And ... on 17 October, 1969
summarized_judgment: the tribunal held that the sangh should represent shibban lal workman without its being substituted for the union's union. the kapra karamchari sangh also filed a statement of claim on behalf of workman shibran lal through its general secretary along with an application for substituting a sangh in place of the union.

tagline: Kanbi Nanji Virji And Ors. vs The State Of Gujarat on 6 October, 1969
summarized_judgment: the high court accepted the appeal of a - 1 and a - 8 and acquitted them. the state was aggrieved by acquittal of the accused under the murder charge. both the state and the convicted persons went up in appeal against the judgment of the state.

tagline: State Of Bihar vs K. K. Misra & Ors on 29 October, 1969
summarized_judgment: court of patna struck down the second part of sub - s. ( 6 ) of s. 144. the order was open to review under sub - cls. and the same was revisable under s. 435 read with s. 439 of the code of criminal procedure. but after the process in the first five sub - sections of the order were completed he becomes functus officio.

tagline: Rajah Velugoti Kumara Krishna ... vs Rajah Velugoti Sarvagna Kumara ... on 28 October, 1969
summarized_judgment: rajah velugoti kumara krishna yachendravaru & ors. venkatagiri estate - linpartible by custom - impartible estates act, 1904 including estate in schedule - madras estates ( abolition and conversion into ryotwari ) act, 1948 and in alternative for maintenance in terms of an agreement entered into in 1889.

tagline: Sushila Kashinath Dhonde & Ors vs Harilal Govindji Bhogani & Ors on 17 October, 1969
summarized_judgment: vaidyialingam, c. a. shelat, j. m. dua, i. d. citation and the appellants were impleaded as defendants. but when the building was completed respondents 2 to 5 did not let out to person advancing money - suit for money advanced if necessary - meaning of words " any claim "

tagline: Kantilal Chandulal Mehta vs State Of Maharashtra And Anr on 10 October, 1969
