tagline: Sangat Singh vs Ch. Perma Nand Bahl And Ors. on 26 November, 1969
summarized_judgment: judgment j. c. shah, j. 1. for many years before 1955 appellant was a tenant of the government. a bid offered by respondents 1, 2 and 3 in this appeal was accepted by the government, but no certificate was issued. the appellant has appealed to the district court and in second appeal.

tagline: Ram Gopal And Anr. vs Alladia And Ors. on 27 November, 1969
summarized_judgment: the defendant is the appellant. he used for the possession of the suit properties after issuing a notice purporting to terminate the tenancy of the defendants ( respondents ) the case of the plaintiff is that the defendants are monthly tenants. the court reversed the decree and judgment of the courts below.

tagline: Om Prakash vs The State Of Haryana And Anr. on 24 November, 1969
summarized_judgment: judgment m. hidayatullah, c. j. 1, convicted under sub - rule of rule 125 of the defence of india rides, 1962 read with section 3 ( 1 ) of the gur ( movement control ) order could not be exported from punjab state to punjab state gur in truck no. pnr 6020.

tagline: Jain Bros. & Others vs The Union Of India & Others on 18 November, 1969
summarized_judgment: a notice under s. 22 ( 5 ) of the act of 1922, was served on the appellant, a registered firm, calling upon it to submit a return of the income for the assessment year 1960 - 61. a return was filed, but not within time. the high court dismissed the petition, saying it was invalid for the reason that the same income in the hands of both firm and partners could not be simultaneously subjected to tax.

tagline: Jayanarayan Sukul vs State Of West Bengal on 5 November, 1969
summarized_judgment: state of west bengal made an order under s. 3 ( 2 ) of the preventive detention act, 1950 for the detention of the petitioner. on june 7, 1969, the district magistrate approved the order of detention and sent the report to the state government. in june 1969 the petitioners were arrested and served with the grounds of detention on june 9, 1969.

tagline: State Of Punjab vs Satpal And Anr. on 24 November, 1969
summarized_judgment: tirath ram started a factory by the name of net ram in november 1957. the factory was manufacturing in the years 1958 - 59 tavas, chaff - cutter blades. the company continued under the same name till february 1962 when it began to employ 20 workmen. the old partnership was dissolved in 1962.

tagline: Board Of High School & ... vs Kumari Chittra Srivastava & ... on 20 November, 1969
summarized_judgment: kumari chittra srivastava and others date of judgment. appellant cancelled the result and no reference was made to the principal's letter in the appellant letter dated june 14, 1961. in the present case, impugned order imposed a penalty on the respondent as she was denied the fruits of her labour.

tagline: K.M. Viswanatha Pillai vs K.M. Shanmugham Pillai on 25 November, 1969
summarized_judgment: the appellant and the respondent practised fraud in contravention of as 41 and 60 ( 1 ) ( c ) of the motor vehicles act, 1939. appellant was the owner of 5 buses and the stage carriage permits were also obtained in the responseent's name. it was decreed by the lower appellate court, in respect of 4 buses.

tagline: Ram Kirpal Bhagat & Ors vs State Of Bihar on 13 November, 1969
summarized_judgment: ray, a. n. hidayatullah, m. mitter, g. k. reddy, was arrested at pakur railway station in the santhal parganas of bihar by two inspectors and a constable belonging to the central excise and customs intelligence work. two bags of clove & on duty were seized from the possession of nazir mian.

tagline: Narendrajit Singh Anr vs State Of U.P. & Anr on 21 November, 1969
summarized_judgment: the government of uttar pradesh issued a notification purporting be one under s. 4 ( l ) of the land acquisition act, 1894. the notification did not specify where the lands were needed. the appellants challenged the proceedings in high court on the ground, among others that the notification was invalid for non - compliance with the mandatory provisions of the as rendering the proceedings void.

tagline: Deb Dutta Seal vs Ramanlal Phumra And Ors. on 6 November, 1969
summarized_judgment: high court modified the interest to 6 p. c. per annum till suit and the same rate till realisation. the court granted a preliminary decree against the appellant and another and declared that the house at no. 35, paddapukur road, bhowanipore, stood charged and / or mortgaged in favour of the plaintiffs ( respondents before us ) for the due payment of rupees 92182 / 3 / 6, and future interest was allowed at the contracted rate.

tagline: General Manager, Eastern Railway ... vs Jawala Prasad Singh on 20 November, 1969
summarized_judgment: a railway servant was charged with misappropriation. he challenged the order in a writ petition. the high court quashed the order of dismissal on the ground that there was a violation of the principles of natural justice, because of the change in personnel of the inquiry committee.

tagline: Garib Das And Ors. vs Munshi Abdul Hamid And Ors. on 13 November, 1969
summarized_judgment: judgment g. k. mitter, j. 1, reversing judgment of subordinate judge, bhagalpur. tassaduk hussain executed and executed a deed of wakf on june 21, 1949. one of the deeds was to remain in possession of the house as mutawalli and his wife was to be the owner of the disputed house.

tagline: Hindustan Steels Ltd., Rourkela vs A. K. Roy & Ors on 18 December, 1969
summarized_judgment: the first respondent was appointed in 1958 as a skilled workman by the appellant company. he executed a bond to serve the company for five years in consideration of the company having borne expenses of his training. in 1960 he was served with an order by which his service was terminated. a petition for a writ of certiorari the high court upheld the order.

tagline: Sidramappa vs Rajashetty And Ors on 9 December, 1969
summarized_judgment: the appellant applied to the executing court to reopen the execution proceedings in respect of certain properties and to implead him as the legal representative of the owner of the properties, claiming that as the adopted son he was entitled to delivery of possession. the trial court dismissed the application holding that his remedy was by way of a separate suit.

tagline: S. L. Agarwal vs General Manager, Hindustan Steel ... on 19 December, 1969
summarized_judgment: hindustan steel ltd. was terminated purportedly in terms of his contract of employment. in a petition under art. 311, he claimed that the termination was wrongful inasmuch as it was by way of punishment and art. in appeal, the high court dismissed the'appellant's petition. the appellant contends that the post was entirely financed by the government.

tagline: Smt. Gunwant Kaur And Ors. vs Municipal Committee, Bhatinda ... on 4 December, 1969
summarized_judgment: judgment j. c. shah, j. 1, is an appeal against the high court of punjab dismissing in limine a petition filed by the three appellants in this appeal. the third appellant purchased from one hari ram a plot of land approximately 500 sq. ft. at bhatinda and applied for permission of the local municipal committee for constructing a house.

tagline: Champalal Binani vs The Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 4 December, 1969
summarized_judgment: the commissioner of income - tax west bengal issued a notice on october 28, 1963. three copies of the notice were sent to the assessee - - one addressed at no. 18 / c mathur sen garden lane, calcutta. the commissioner set aside the order and directed the inspector to make fresh assessments.

tagline: Arun Ghosh vs State Of West Bengal on 2 December, 1969
summarized_judgment: the order was made on june 2, 1969 and he was arrested the following day. the order states that it was made to prevent him from acting prejudicially to the maintenance of public order. but the order says there was no undue delay at any stage in dealing with the various aspects of his detention.

tagline: State Of Orissa vs Maharaja Shri B.P. Singh Deo on 1 December, 1969
summarized_judgment: the high court in exercise of its powers under section 29 ( iii ) of the orissa agricultural income - tax act ( to be hereinafter referred to as act. the assessment of the assessee under the act for the years 1952 - 1953 and 1953 - 1954. assistant collector of agricultural income tax, sambalpur, was unable to rely on the books.

tagline: Hindusthan Commercial Bank Ltd. vs Punnu Sahu (Dead) Through Legal ... on 1 December, 1969
summarized_judgment: the appellant moved the executing court under order 21, rule 90. his application was dismissed on the ground that he was not an interested party. the high court reversed the finding of the lower court that appellant wasn't an interest party. but at the same time, appellant had not complied with the requirements of rule 90, communist lawmaker varanasi.

tagline: Reform Flour Mills (P.) Ltd. vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 11 December, 1969
summarized_judgment: judgment j. c. shah, j. 1, rejected the application under section 66 of the indian income tax act. the high court has not delivered any judgment giving reasons for rejecting the application. order of high court is set aside and cases are remanded to high court to be dealt with.

tagline: State Of Madhya Pradesh And Ors. vs Shardul Singh on 2 December, 1969
summarized_judgment: judgment k. s. hegde, j. 1. scope of the constitution comes up for consideration in this appeal by certificate. the high court of madhya pradesh said the power of dismissal and removal referred to in article 311 ( 1 ) implies authorities mentioned in that article must alone initiate and conduct disciplinary proceedings.

tagline: Sudhir Kumar Saha vs Commissioner Of Police, Calcutta ... on 18 December, 1969
summarized_judgment: hegde, k. s. shah and others committed various offences on three occasions. he was detained under s. 3 ( 2 ) of the preventive detention act, 1950, with a view to preventing him acting in any manner prejudicial to the maintenance of public order. the act complained of against the petitioner can at best be considered.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs Lady Kanchanbai on 16 December, 1969
summarized_judgment: prior to the assessment year 1950 - 51 the assessee was assessed under the act, 1922 in the status of a non - resident hindu undivided family. prior to that year 1950 she was deemed to be a resident in the " taxable territories " and thus liable to be taxed in respect of income received in madhya bharat. the tribunal reversed the finding of the income tax officer and the high court.

tagline: Bengal Enamel Works Ltd vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, West ... on 9 December, 1969
summarized_judgment: appellant claimed amount paid to technical adviser as admissible allowances under s. 10 ( 2 ) of the income - tax act, 1922. appellant was doing the business of manufacturing enamelled ware, appointed technical adviser and board of directors resolved to pay him 15 % of gross annual profits as his remuneration.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs Rn. Ar. Ar. Veerappa Chettiar on 4 December, 1969
summarized_judgment: the revenue authorities in ceylon levied estate duty in respect of the estate of a and his son in the hands of their three widows and their adopted sons. the tribunal reversed the assessment order holding that the amount of interest received by the assessee was of a capital nature and was on that account not liable to tax.

tagline: Shauqin Singh And Ors. vs Desa Singh And Ors. on 4 December, 1969
summarized_judgment: judgment j. c. shah, originally a resident of district lyallpur, migrated to india in 1947 on the partition of the country. the land claims officer cancelled allotment of land to ram singh in village raipur arain and allotted in lieu of land. they installed wells and built houses on the land and started cultivation.

tagline: Chandra Prakash Agarwal vs Chaturbhuj Das Parikh & Ors on 18 December, 1969
summarized_judgment: the words " advocate of a high court " mean an advocate on the roll of a, high court. in art. 217 ( 2 ) ( b ) means an advocate in the high court, meaning of art. there is nothing in the article to indicate that an advocate of high court can only be that advocate who has been practising.

tagline: Imperial Tea Co. Ltd. vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, West ... on 11 December, 1969
summarized_judgment: judgment j. c. shah, j. 1, rejected the application under section 66 ( 2 ) of the indian income - tax act. the high court should have recorded some reasons for refusing to entertain the application in respect of the two questions raised by the party before it.

tagline: State Of Punjab vs Sant Singh Kanwarjit Singh on 4 December, 1969
summarized_judgment: the assessee filed returns of turnover of its business for the quarters ending 30th june, 1962 and 30th september, 1962. under the act, sales - tax is a yearly tax, but that does not imply that assessment of tax quarterly is illegal if provision is made in the act for quarterly returns.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs M/S. Binodiram Balchand, Indore on 16 December, 1969
summarized_judgment: the assessee was a hindu undivided family with its head office in a part b state. it was entitled to take the financial year as the relevant previous year. a part of the income, however, was attributable to the profits that accrued in part a state. in the 2011 - 49 it derived dividend income from a company registered in parts b state, under section b states.

tagline: Mohammad Ibrahim vs The State Of Andhra Pradesh And ... on 4 December, 1969
summarized_judgment: appellant in appeal entered service in the public works department of hyderabad as a sub - overseer. appellant filed a petition in the high court of andhra pradesh for a writ quashing the order of reversion. obul reddy, j., dismissed the petition holding that order did not amount to imposition of punishment.

tagline: S. Parthasarathy vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 1 December, 1969
summarized_judgment: the assessee's father purchased a vacant land in madras, on november 7, 1930. he gifted eight houses to his four daughters, two houses to each one of them. the property belonged to srinivasachariar, the father of an assessee, and that he had put up the foundations of the houses therein.

tagline: Hari Vishnu Kamath vs Gopal Swarup Pathak on 18 December, 1969
summarized_judgment: gopal swarup pathak was one of the losing candidates filed an. election petition under art. 71 of the constitution and s. 14 of the presidential and vice - presidential elections act. 1952 and prayed that the election of the respondent be declared void under s. 18 of the act.

tagline: B.P. (India) Ltd. vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax ... on 16 December, 1969
summarized_judgment: the high court has not passed any speaking order in disposing of the application. there will be no order as to costs. the appeal is allowed, and the case is remanded to the court for disposal in accordance with law law. the court has held in several cases that the court normally would not be justified.

tagline: Bhrigunath Tewary And Ramlal ... vs The State Of West Bengal on 1 December, 1969
summarized_judgment: judgment m. hidayatullah, c. j. 1, was detained under the orders of the district magistrate, burdwan, passed on september 1, 1969 under section 3 of the preventive detention act. in the grounds which were furnished to him, 4 matters are stated stated. he was seen in the act of removing railway stores and materials in a truck.

tagline: Ch. Laiq Singh And Ors. vs State Of Uttar Pradesh on 2 December, 1969
summarized_judgment: laiq singh has been sentenced in the aggregate to three years " rigorous imprisonment " the acquittal was recorded by the high court in respect of the two offences. but the appeals were set aside and the conviction and the sentences as stated above resulted in the convictions and sentences. the appeal was set aside in the appeal before the high parties had put in an application for compounding the offence.

tagline: Sayed Rehmanmiya Mustafamiya & ... vs The State Of Gujarat & Others on 2 December, 1969
summarized_judgment: state of gujarat and others were governed by the bombay land revenue code. act was amended by ordinance xxxix of 1948 and ordinance lxiv of 1949. it gives power to the collector for fixing the assessment of the amount to be paid as land revenue on all lands, chap. viii and viii - a and saurashtra barkhali abolition act ( 26 of 1951 ) act.

tagline: Pharmed Private Ltd. vs The Workmen on 2 December, 1969
summarized_judgment: judgment g. a. vaidialingam, j. 1, is directed against the award, dated june 26, 1969 of the industrial tribunal, maharashtra, bombay in reference ( it ) no 287 of 1967. when the bombay consumer 45 % rise on the wages arrived at price index is in the range of 601 / 610.

tagline: Kangra Valley State Co., Ltd. vs State Of Punjab And Ors. on 19 December, 1969
summarized_judgment: judgment j. m. shelat, j. 1. the question arising in this appeal is whether the appellant - company's application bearing the date september 20, 1961 for renewal of a mining lease was time barred and therefore not a valid application. the company had secured a perpetual lease dated march 22, 1879 of certain lands in villages.
